loans.name: Dieu Aide Nous (2) Group

texts.en: Lydie is a member of the group DIEU AIDE NOUS (2).  The leader of a group consisting of eight other micro-entrepreneurs from Brazzaville, Congo, Lydie is currently on her second loan cycle with HOPE Congo. Lydie is married with three children who are currently in school. Having been in the second-hand clothes business for approximately 20 years, Lydie plans to use her loan to purchase additional bundles of clothing to sell. She hopes to grow her business enough to become a second-hand clothing supplier, selling in bulk. Well acquainted with the market in which she works, Lydie is known for being vigilant and welcoming in her community.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of clothing to sell

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe SABOUGNOUMA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 42 ans, et 6 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Dounamakebougou, commune de Guégnéka, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce, de condiment, de charbon, et d’habillement. Les femmes du groupe SABOUGNOUMA sont à leur onzième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente MAH, la première personne à partir de la droite dans le rang des assis est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse d’habits  pour enfants. Elle compte acheter 25 complets pour enfant chez les grossistes à Bamako. La vente se fait à son domicile et parfois en ambulante en espèce et en crédit à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 11 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans l’activité.
texts.en: The SABOUGNOUMA group is comprised of married women, who on average are 42 years old and have 6 children. They all live in traditional families in the village of Dounamakebougou, a commune of Guégnéka, in the prefecture of Dioïla, in the region of Koulikoro (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They met each other through family, neighbors, and friends. They sell spices, charcoal, and clothing. The women of the SABOUGNOUMA group are on their eleventh group loan. In the goal of satisfying the enormous demand of their customers, they seek the help of SORO YIRIWASO. The funds will be used to buy the aforementioned items. The client, MAH, the woman sitting on the right, is illiterate, and she currently sells children’s clothing. She plans to buy 25 children’s outfits at wholesale in Bamako. She sells from her house and sometimes door-to-door for cash or credit to a mixed clientele. She plans to earn a monthly profit of 11,000 FCFA, which will be used to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Paxoj Huitan Group

texts.es:
La señora Elisa Modesta de estado civil Casada. De edad 42 años. No tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar. Tiene 4 hijos y de ellos 3 van a la escuela. Se dedica a la crianza de animales domésticos. Inició este negocio con un cerdo y a la fecha lleva 3 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utlizará para comprar cerditos para criarlos y luego venderlos. Desea en el futuro contar con un capital grande de trabajo y tener una granja. 

Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la crianza de animales domésticos.
texts.en:
Elisa Modesta is 42 years old and married.  She did not have the opportunity to go to school.  She has four children, and three of them go to school.

She raises domestic animals.  She started this business with a pig, and she has three years of experience so far.

She is organizing a group and requesting a loan.  She will use the loan to buy piglets to raise and later sell.  In the future she wishes to have a lot of working capital and to have a farm.

The other members of the group raise domestic animals.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Harmonie (1) Group

texts.en: Alphonsine is a member of the group HARMONIE (1) and is the leader of a group of 10 other micro-entrepreneurs from Brazzaville, Congo. Alphonsine is married with two children, and also looks after two other members of her family. Currently in her fifth loan cycle with HOPE Congo, Alphonsine sells manioc (a staple starch) in bulk and plans to purchase animals to expand her farm to include raising livestock. She hopes to raise chickens in the future and expand her business through loans from HOPE Congo. Alphonsine's vision for the future is to increase the well being of her family.

loans.use: to purchase livestock for her farm

loans.name: Harmonie (2) Group

texts.en: Moïse is a member of the group HARMONIE (2). He is a leader of a group of 10 other micro-entrepreneurs from Brazzaville, Congo. In addition to his wife and seven children, Moïse also looks after four additional members of his family. To support himself and his family, Moïse runs a produce and dry goods stand. Now on his second loan cycle with HOPE Congo, Moïse plans to purchase additional goods and grains to sell. In the future he hopes to expand his business with additional fresh produce from his own farm. Moïse’s dream is to take care of all seven of his children.

loans.use: to purchase grains and additional goods to sell at his stand

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya and at over 6,300 feet above sea level. It is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize producing regions, lending it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya.” Many farmers in the region have started projects planting bluegum trees on their land, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. The people around Kitale have been beekeeping for centuries, and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.

Susan is married and has four children. Both she and her husband are farmers. They have been farming for twenty years now and they are currently growing maize, beans, bananas, vegetables and they are rearing livestock. Susan is excited about beekeeping as the bees will help in pollinating their crops.

This is Susan’s first loan with Honey Care, and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to educate her children and improve her house. Susan’s hope for the future is to live a better life.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Crispus

texts.en:
Crispus lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia as one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. 

The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential beekeeping region.

Crispus is married and has six children. Both he and his wife are farmers. They have been farming for twenty two years now, and they are currently growing maize and tea, and rearing livestock in their farm. Crispus is excited about beekeeping as the bees will help in pollinating his crops.

This is Crispus' first loan with Honey Care, and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to educate his children. Crispus' hope for the future is to live a better life.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Genesis Rosalyn

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Primero De Abril se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Génesis, tiene 20 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un hijo de 3 años. Su esposo trabaja en el Municipio local. 
Ella hace tiempo atrás aprendió belleza en un centro en la ciudad y hoy con la finalidad de ayudarle a su marido a sacar adelante su hogar tiene un salón de belleza en su casa, realiza trabajos de arreglo personal y maquillajes en este lugar y su clientela cada día aumenta mas ya que su trabajo es muy bueno y novedoso, lleva tres años dedicada a esta actividad la cual le gusta ya que se entretiene y a la vez se gana algo para el bienestar de su familia. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar un letrero muy llamativo para su local y así poder mejorar su clientela. Está en el Grupo De Crédito casi desde el inicio y le gusta porque el grupo es bien unido. Sus sueños es tener un gran local.
texts.en:
The communal bank Primero De Abril meets every two weeks in the canton of Montecristi, known for its rich precolonial culture and its nationally and internationally renowned crafts. It is home to the famous Panama hat.

This is where Génesis lives. She is twenty years old and married. She and her husband have a three-year-old son. Her husband works for the local government. She went to beauty school a while back and, in order to contribute to her household, she has a beauty salon in her home, where she offers services like make-up. Her customer base is increasing daily because her work is very good and innovative. She has been in this business for three years and she enjoys her work because it keeps her busy and at the same time allows her to make some income for her family's wellbeing.

She will use this loan to buy a striking sign for her business so that she can attract more customers. She has belonged to her communal bank almost from the beginning and she enjoys it because they are a very united group. One of her dreams is to own a large space for her business.

loans.use: to buy a sign.

loans.name: Schilo Group

texts.en: Philippe is the leader of the group SCHILO, which consists of eight other micro-entrepreneurs from Brazzaville, Congo. The father of four children, Philippe is the proud owner of a small pastry business and also sells school supplies. Philippe is on his second loan cycle with HOPE Congo and plans to use his loan of 500,000 CFA (the local currency) to purchase sacks of flower and cans of oil to use in his pastry business. In the future Philippe hopes to open a bookstore. He dreams of being able to send his children to study in another country and hopes to one day own his own car.

loans.use: to pay for sacks of flour and cans of oil for his pastry making business

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia as one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. 

The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential beekeeping region.

Gilbert is married and has five children. He is a church elder. Both he and his wife practice farming. They have been farming for twenty eight years now and they are currently growing maize and tea, and rearing livestock in their farm. Gilbert is excited about beekeeping as it will earn him some income and the bees will help in pollinating his crops.

This is Gilbert’s first loan with Honey Care, and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to start a business. Gilbert’s hope for the future is to live a better and modern life.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Rayito De Luna Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “RAYITO DE LUNA” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamaya, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Margarita es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: compra y venta de ganado ovino, confección de polleras, venta de coca, venta de chuño y papa, tienda de barrio, elaboración de losetas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Margarita es integrante, ella indica que es el primer año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarla a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta y compra de ganado ovino; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de sus padres, ya que desde corta edad ella ayudo a su familia y así aprendió los procesos de comercio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ganado ovino) que adquirirá en las comunidades cercanas y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Rayito de Luna” (Little Moonbeam) is starting its second loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Patacamaya Community Center. This group consists of eight members and is led by a Board of Directors in which Sra. Margarita serves as the secretary. The members of this Communal Bank engage in different businesses such as buying and selling sheep, manufacturing traditional skirts, selling coca leaves, selling dried and fresh potatoes, managing a neighborhood store, and making floor tiles.

This loan will benefit small business owners such as Sra. Margarita. She says that this is her first year since joining Pro Mujer after receiving an invitation from a promoter of the organization who visited her at her house. Margarita currently has a business of buying and selling sheep. She is knowledgeable about this business because she learned the trade from her parents. At a very young age, she was able to help her family and learn about the trading process.

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying sheep. She will acquire the animals from nearby communities and then sell them from her vending space. Working in this manner enables her to generate income to sustain her family. Margarita is in a common-law relationship and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Margarita said that she enjoys the training seminars offered by the organization.

loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es:
La Sra. Felipa tiene una despensa en su casa desde el año 2003. Luego de enviudar, sus hijos le ayudaron a construir pequeños dormitorios con baños en el fondo de su terreno, para alquilarlos.   Por  la pérdida de su marido, ella entro en una depresión, de la que solo pudo salir gracias a sus hijos y nietos, que siempre estuvieron a su lado.
Felipa es muy querida en su barrio y tiene muchos clientes en su local. Ella anhela dejar el legado del trabajo y la perseverancia a sus nietos, pues también tiene hijos que han terminado la carrera universitaria luego de los 40 años. 
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de aceites, jabón en polvo, bebidas, enlatados y demás, y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo y dando a sus clientes todo lo que necesitan.
texts.en:
Felipa has been running a store in her home since 2003. After she became a widow, her children helped her build some small bedrooms with their own bathrooms in the back of her land for her to rent. When she lost her husband, she became very depressed, but she was able to come out of her depression thanks to her children and grandchildren, who were always by her side.

Felipa is very well loved in her neighborhood and has many customers that visit her store. She wants to leave her grandchildren a legacy of hard work and perseverance, since she also has children that have graduated from college after forty. 

She is requesting this loan in order to invest in buying oil, drinks, canned goods, powdered soap, and other items, so that she can continue to grow and give her customers everything they need.

loans.use: to buy oil, drinks, canned goods, powdered soap.

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe TIESSIRI est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 41 ans, et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Dibida, commune de Guégnéka, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce, de condiment, de charbon, de produit cosmétique, de savon, de boisson, et de patate. Les femmes du groupe TIESSIRI sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente KADIATOU, personne assise au milieu est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de patate. Elle compte acheter 8 sacs de patate chez les grossistes à Konobougou. La vente se fait à son domicile et parfois en ambulante en espèce et en crédit au marché journalier de Fana a une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 45 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans l’activité.
texts.en: The TIESSIRI group is comprised of married women, who on average are 41 years old and have 3 children. They all live in traditional families in the village of Dibida, a commune of Guégnéka, in the prefecture of Dioïla, in the region of Koulikoro (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They met each other through family, neighbors, and friends. They sell spices, charcoal, cosmetic products, soap, beverages, and potatoes. The women of the TIESSIRI group are on their second group loan. In the goal of satisfying the enormous demand of their customers, they seek the help of SORO YIRIWASO. The funds will be used to buy the aforementioned items. The client, KADIATOU, seated in the middle, is illiterate, and she currently sells potatoes. She plans to buy 8 sacks of potatoes at wholesale in Konobougou. She sells them from home and sometimes door-to-door for cash or credit at the daily market in Fana to a mixed clientele. She plans to earn a monthly profit of 45,000 FCFA, which will be reinvested into her business.

loans.use: to buy tubers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase the summer collection of clothes to sell

loans.name: Santa Teresita Group

texts.es:
Santa Teresita está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de Concepción, la cual es una zona un poco alejada de la zona céntrica y aún se encuentra en crecimiento. Es una zona de difícil acceso, por lo que las integrantes de este grupo luchan por ir creciendo y dar a la zona donde viven un mejor ambiente y que vayan creciendo lentamente.
La Sra.  Norma es parte de este grupo, ella es comerciante ya que tiene una modesta despensa en la que trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas. Ella se define como una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora que se esmera por poder salir adelante y dar a sus familiares todo para una vida digna.
Pide este préstamo para poder surtir su despensa con verduras, cárnicos, enlatados, frutas, bebidas y demás, lo que le permitirá seguir creciendo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The Santa Teresita communal bank is in its first cycle with the women’s committee program.  They are from the city of Concepción.  It is an area that is a bit away from the central zone, and it is still growing.  It is an area with difficult access.  Therefore, the members of this group struggle to keep growing, to give the place where they live a better atmosphere, and to grow slowly.

Norma is part of this group.  She is a merchant, and she has a modest store.  She works there every day, and she starts at the very early hours of the morning.  She describes herself as a very hard-working and tenacious person who puts forth great effort in order to be able to get ahead and give her family everything in order to have a decent live.

She is requesting this loan to be able to stock her store with vegetables, meat products, canned goods, fruits, drinks, and others.  This will allow her to continue growing as she is doing.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat products, canned goods, fruits, drinks, and other supplies.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina lives in Kakamega. Kakamega County is located in Western Kenya and is famous for having the only tropical rain forest in the country. Most farmers in Kakamega grow maize, but sugarcane, papaya, bananas and tea are also popular crops. The variety of crops grown in the region, as well as the abundance of vegetation in the old growth forest, make Kakamega particularly attractive for beekeeping.

Amina is married and has five children. She is a business lady. Both she and her husband practice farming where they grow maize, vegetables, bananas and sugarcane. Amina is excited about beekeeping as it will earn her some income and because it does not require hard labor.

This is Amina’s first loan with Honey Care and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to start a dairy farm. Amina’s hope for the future is to expand her business and save up for her old age.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 32 years old, married, and has two children who attend school. He lives in Kacawamba in the Fortportal region of Uganda. John works hard to manage his grocery shop, selling home use commodities and soft drinks. 

To help expand his business, John requested a loan from BRAC Uganda for 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings, which he will use to buy more home use commodities and soft drinks. This loan will help John to generate greater profits and increase his income. He hopes that in the future he will be able to acquire more capital. 

John is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like John  who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase home use commodities and soft drinks

loans.name: Eglay

texts.en:
Eglay lives in Kakamega. Kakamega County is located in Western Kenya, close to the Ugandan border. It contains the only tropical rain forest in Kenya, and the variety of the flora in the region makes it well suited for beekeeping. It has one of the highest rural population densities in the world (in some areas, close to 600 people per square kilometer), which may contribute to the region's high poverty rates.

Eglay is married and has nine children. Both she and her husband are farmers. They have been farming for fourteen years now and they are currently growing vegetables, maize and beans and they are also practicing dairy and fish farming. Eglay is excited about beekeeping as it will provide her with honey for medicine.

This is Eglay's first loan with Honey Care and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to pay school fees for her children and to repay her loan. Eglay's hope for the future is to have electricity installed in her house.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is 35 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi, in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has two children who are currently in school. For the past three years, Dorothy has been working hard to manage her bar and restaurant, in which she sells soft drinks, food, and beer. 

To help expand her business, Dorothy has requested a loan of UGX 2,000,000 (Ugandan shillings) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more food items, like posho, rice, drinks, salt, and meat and will help Dorothy to generate greater profits and boost her income. Dorothy hopes that, in the future, she will be able to become more productive. 

Dorothy is a member of BRAC Uganda's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs, like Dorothy, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more food items, like posho, rice, drinks, salt, and meat.

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en:
Teopista is 40 years old and lives in the town of Mukono, in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has five children who are all currently in school. For the past six years, Teopista has been working hard to manage her salon, which deals in hair products and clothing sales. 

To help expand her business, Teopista has requested a loan of UGX 2,000,000 (Ugandan shillings) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more braids, weaves, and clothes and will help Teopista to generate greater profits and educate her children. Teopista hopes that, in the future, she will be able to expand on her business. 

Teopista is a member of BRAC Uganda's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs, like Teopista, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more braids, weaves, and clothes to sell.

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en:
Yusuf is 39 years old, married, and has four children who attend school. He lives in Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past two years, Yusuf has been working hard to manage his bar, selling drinks and beverages. 

To help expand his business, Yusuf requested a loan from BRAC Uganda for 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings, which he will use to buy more beverages. The loan will help Yusuf to generate greater profits and boost the income level of the family. He hopes that in the future he will be able to become self reliant. 

Yusuf is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Yusuf who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase beverages for the bar

loans.name: Integracion Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Integracion, tiene 17 integrantes, donde cada una está poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza para que cada una pueda mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Daniela es una de las integrantes, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel tres, es decir que fue mejorando bastantes, pero es consiente que debe mantenerse, lo cual es la parte más difícil, pero ella a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y por medio de la venta de mercería que hace lo está logrando, ya que es una mujer muy trabajadora.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas, calzados, artículos de bazar, cubiertos y demás y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas, y dar a su familia una vida sin privaciones.
texts.en:
This group is called "Integracion" and is made up of 17 members. Each member puts forth her best effort to improve her and her family's living conditions. They are currently completing the poverty elimination survey so that each member can improve her quality of life.

Daniela is one of the members. On her last survey, her poverty level was below three, so she has improved a lot but she is aware that she must maintain her progress, which is the most difficult part. With her hard work and job, she continues to try. With the sales from her general store, she is achieving her goal since she is a hardworking woman.

She requests this loan to purchase clothing, shoes, miscellaneous items, cutlery, and other things so that she can continue making sales and providing her family with everything they need.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, shoes, miscellaneous items, cutlery, and other things to sell.

loans.name: Klara

texts.ru: Кларе 43 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают сына. У Клары - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Клара занимается полеводством и животноводством, стартовав 22 года назад, с 3,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Кларs, на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 2 теленка, также имеется 1,40 ГА земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивает перец и фасоль для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Ежемесячный совокупный доход составляет 11,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Клара обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом для закупа удобрений для обработки земли. Клара намерена получить хороший урожай, что непременно приведет к увеличению капитала семьи. Доходы от кредита Клара планирует вложить в приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на строительство нового помещения для скота.
texts.en: Klara is 43 years old, married, and together with her husband, is raising a son. Klara has a secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, Klara practices livestock breeding and crop farming. She started this business 22 years ago with 3,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Klara's hard work, she currently has 1 milk cow and 2 calves on her farm, as well as a 1.40 hectare plot of land on which she annually grows peppers and beans for personal consumption and sale. Her monthly cumulative income is 11,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Klara turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers for cultivating the land. Klara is determined to receive a good harvest which will fundamentally increase her family's capital. Klara plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money to build a new barn for her cattle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
Kuña guapa lleva por nombre este grupo, son 19 mujeres jefas de familia que se unieron con la esperanza de poder ayudar a sus familias por medio del trabajo en conjunto, y de esa forma también crecer en el emprendimiento de cada una de ellas.
La señora Elisa es la integrante que formo el grupo, ella tiene 51 años es una persona muy activa que trabaja para su familia, el grupo y por su comunidad; realiza trabajos de cotillón y costura en general, y por medio de eso da a sus seres queridos todo lo que ella no pudo tener. Su meta es poder tener un taller de costuras amplio donde pueda recibir más pedidos y dar también trabajo a otras personas.
Ella pide este préstamo ya que quiere comprar telas e hilos para seguir con sus confecciones, ya que tiene pedidos con los que quiere cumplir. También agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo, que le permitirá crecer.
texts.en:
Kuña Guapa is the name of this group.  They are 19 women, head of their households, who meet with the hope of being able to help their families by working together.  In this way each one of them will grow in their enterprises.

Elisa is the member that formed the group.  She is 51 years old, and she is a very active person who works for her family, the group, and her community. She does party supplies and general tailoring.  Through this work she gives her loved ones everything that she was not able to have.

Her goal is to be able to have a large seamstress shop where she will be able to take in more orders and also give work to other people.

She is requesting this loan because she wants to buy fabric and thread in order to continue with her sewing.  She has orders that she wants to complete.  

She is grateful for the opportunity that she is receiving, which will allow her to grow.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread for sewing.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 23 years old, married, and has two children. She is from Nakuru. She is a farmer, which she has been doing for five years. 

To enable her buy a motorcycle for her spouse so that he can transport passengers for a fee, Joyce requested her first loan from VisionFund Kenya for 113,000 KES. She plans to use the anticipated profits to engage in dairy farming and to repay her loan to VisionFund Kenya. She hopes to be a successful farmer in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for her spouse

loans.name: María Ilduara

texts.es:
María es una mujer luchadora y pujante de 60 años de edad, madre de 4 hijos a los que sacó adelante con empeño y dedicación. 
Durante su vida productiva ha trabajado como vendedora ambulante, caminando con su chaza por diferentes calles del centro de la ciudad, así ha logrado generar los recursos para sobrevivir, pues toda la responsabilidad económica recayó sobre ella desde el día que se separó de su esposo. Hace algún tiempo sufrió un accidente de tránsito, por lo que se lastimó la cadera  tuvo que dejar de trabajar, pero la necesidad de generar nuevamente los ingresos para su sustento la obligan a solicitar el crédito para reiniciar su actividad como vendedora ambulante; con el dinero comprará envases térmicos para café, aromáticas, cigarrillos, mecato y otros productos que ofrecerá a sus antiguos clientes, con lo que espera poder tener la capacidad económica para cumplir el sueño de disfrutar una vejez digna y con mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
María, age 60, is a determined and vibrant woman. She is the mother of four children who she has helped to move forward as a result of her effort and dedication.

Throughout her productive life, María has worked as a traveling vendor. She walks around with her push cart through different streets in the central part of the city. This is how she earns income to support herself. All of the financial responsibilities have fallen on her since she separated from her husband.

Some time ago María was in a traffic accident and injured her hip, which prevented her from working. For this reason, she needs to generate income in order to survive. She felt obligated to request a loan in order to restart her business as a street vendor. María will use the money to buy thermal containers for coffee, herbs, cigarettes, pastries, and other products that she can offer to her longtime customers. She hopes to have the financial capacity needed to fulfill her dream of enjoying a decent retirement and better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy thermal containers for coffee, herbs, cigarettes, pastries, and other products.

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es: Santiago, tiene 42 años de edad, es casado, tiene 4 hijos y vive en una aldea del municipio de Lempira junto a su familia. El lleva varios años de dedicarse a su propio cultivo de café. Produce café pergamino húmedo y seco y lo vende en el mercado local. El préstamo que solicita es el quinto ciclo y es por 28,000 Lempiras con el cual va comprar  fertilizantes y abonos para darle mantenimiento a la finca productora y plantilla de café y mejorar la producción y los ingresos familiares cada año. Su meta es sembrar mas café y que sus hijos estudien.
texts.en:
Santiago is 42 years old, married, and has four children. He and his family live in a neighborhood in the town of Lempira.

Santiago has devoted the past several years to growing his own coffee. He produces coffee in parchment, both moist and dried, and sells his product at the local market. The loan he is requesting is his fifth one and is in the amount of 28,000 HNL. He will use the money to buy fertilizers and compost so that he can maintain a productive farm full of coffee plants. Santiago hopes to improve production and grow his family’s income each year. His goals include planting more coffee and providing for his children’s education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and compost for his coffee crop.

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.ru: Зулфия жительница милого и дружелюбного района Шахритус. Ей 49 лет. Зулфия замужем. Ее муж находится на заработках в Российской Федерации. Она воспитывает троих детей. У нее два сына и дочка. Зулфия 2 года назад начала маленький бизнес в сфере животноводства. Она покупает теленка и после длительного откорма перепродает на местном скотном дворе с наценкой. На данный момент у Зулфии возникли финансовые проблемы и она решила взять кредит, чтобы купить пару телят и увеличить считанное количество скота и значительно расширить бизнес. Она просит ей помочь. Она верит, что ее поддержать в трудную минуту.
texts.en: Zulfiya is a resident of the small and welcoming Shahrituz District. She is 49 years old and married. Her husband works abroad in the Russian Federation. She is raising three children. She has two sons and a daughter. Two years ago, Zulfiya began a small business in the field of livestock breeding. She buys a calf and then after fattening it up for some time, she resells it at the local cattle yard at a profit. Currently, some financial problems have arisen for Zulfiya so she decided to take out a loan to buy a pair of calves. This will increase her number of cattle and vastly expand her business. She is asking for your help. She believes that she will receive support in her hour of need.

loans.use: to buy two calves and expand her small business.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
"Peter is 38 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the Mukono region of Uganda. He has three children who are all currently in school. For the past three years, Peter has been working hard to manage his Boutique, which sells trousers, skirts, dresses, and shirts. 

To help expand his business, Peter has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more trousers, skirts, dresses, and shirts, and will help Peter to generate greater profits and expand the business. Peter hopes that in the future he will be able to have a bigger store. 

Peter is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Peter who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.


"

loans.use: purchase more trousers, skirts, dresses, shirts

loans.name: Emmanuel's Group

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a member of this group in Lugari District.  He is pictured here in a group of 3 One Acre Fund group leader farmers.  The group leaders represent a total of 33 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here.  Emmanuel has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with his hand raised.  He and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.							

Emmanuel is 38 years old and has been a farmer for 20 years.  Emmanuel works as a farmer to provide for his three children.  The community and other farmers know Emmanuel as friendly, hardworking, reliable and trustworthy.  Other than farming, he is also involved in his community such as the prayer group.  Emmanuel described his harvest last year as good, but hopes he can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in her group.							

The 2014 Long Rains season won’t be Emmanuel’s first season with One Acre Fund.  He first joined One Acre Fund in 2013 and has continued working with One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, and get fertilizer and hybrid seeds.  As an active member in his community, Emmanuel also chose to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he wants to help more farmers, and wants to spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers.  Emmanuel plans on using future profits from the harvest to send children to school, save for the future, and buy a cow.  His life has improved by working with One Acre Fund because he was able to save money, and feed the family.							

One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya.  The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers.  Emmanuel and his group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund continues providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.	

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Nayely

texts.es:
Nayely es una clienta de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia.
Nayely tiene 23 años, es Licenciada en Psicología. Ella se dedica a vender cosméticos y productos de belleza por catalogo desde hace 3 años. Nayeli dice que ha crecido sus ventas e incluso ha recibido reconocimientos por desempeño. También capacita a otras mujeres vendedoras.
Ella esta solicitando el prestamos para comprar más productos y aprovechar las promociones que le están ofreciendo.
Ella esta orgullosa de haber terminado la universidad y haber ayudado a sus padres en el pago de la colegiatura.
texts.en:
Nayely is a client of Kubo Financiero and this is her story:

She is 23 years old and has a degree in Psychology. Nayely has been selling cosmetics and beauty products through catalogs for three years. She says that her sales have grown and that she has received awards for her performance. Nayely also trains other saleswomen.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy more products and to take advantage of some sales promotions that are being offered. Nayely is proud to have graduated from university and to have had the help of her parents in paying her tuition.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and beauty products.

loans.name: Cristo Rey Group

texts.es:
Las 17 integrantes de este grupo son mujeres muy trabajadoras que con mucho sacrificio están trabajando y quieren poder ayudar a sus familias por medio del esfuerzo en conjunto.
Cristina es una de las integrantes, que se destaca por ser una persona muy creativa, que hace artesanías en maderas, y por medio de ese trabajo tiene los ingresos para poder ayudar a su familia. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora que con mucho sacrificio está saliendo adelante, todo esto para ayudar a sus seres queridos, y que tengan una vida digna.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de maderas para poder seguir haciendo sus artesanías, y luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia. Agradece por esta oportunidad que todas están recibiendo, y que les será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en: The seventeen members of this group are very hardworking women who are working with much sacrifice, and they wish to be able to help their families through their joint effort.   Cristina, one of the members, is known as a very creative person.  She makes wood crafts, and through this work, she has income to help support her family.  She is a hardworking person who is getting ahead with much sacrifice, and doing all of this to help her loved ones so that they may have a dignified life. She is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of wood and be able to continue making her crafts, and she is striving to improve living conditions for herself and her family.  She is grateful for this opportunity that they are all receiving because it will be a great help to them.

loans.use: to purchase wood to make crafts.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge es soltero, tiene 26 años, nació en el municipio rural de El Torno de la provincia Andrés Ibáñez del departamento de Santa Cruz – Bolivia, vive con sus padres y hermanos. Estudio la carrera de Ingeniería en Redes y Telecomunicaciones y con mucho sacrificio por la distancia de su casa a la universidad, logró culminar sus años de estudio faltándole solo la defensa de su tesis de grado para poderse titular. 
Actualmente Jorge trabaja como técnico de mantenimiento satelital y planta externa en una empresa de telecomunicaciones, sus ingresos le sirve para sus gastos propios y para ayudar en su hogar. 
Jorge solicita un crédito educativo para cursar el programa de certificación en CCNA CISCO, mismo que le servirá para complementar sus actuales conocimientos y poder mejorar su fuente laboral, ya que piensa que la tecnología es el futuro donde siempre habrá demanda laboral para profesionales capacitados porque se desarrolla constantemente con el tiempo. 
Jorge se considera que es una persona muy perseverante para alcanzar sus objetivos ya que no se da por vencido fácilmente ante los obstáculos que pueda encontrar en el camino y lo emociona el hecho de saber que hay gente dispuesta a ayudar a otros, esto lo hace sentir feliz y motivado para terminar sus estudios universitarios y seguir especializándose en su área de trabajo.
texts.en:
Jorge is single, 26 years old, and was born in the rural town of El Torno, which is located in the Andrés Ibáñez province in the department of Santa Cruz, Bolivia. He lives with his parents and siblings. He is studying for a degree in Network and Telecommunication Engineering and, with great sacrifices due to the distance from his home to the university, he only needs to defend his thesis in order to graduate.

Currently, Jorge works as a technician for satellite and external plant maintenance at a telecommunications business. His income helps him with personal expenses and household expenses. Jorge requests this education loan to pay for the CISCO CCNA (CISCO Certified Network Associate) program, which will help him to complement his knowledge and improve his work. He believes that technology is the future and that there will always be a demand for trained professionals since the field is changing all the time. 

Jorge believes that he is a person who is very determined to achieve his goals since he is not easily defeated when he is faced with obstacles. He is happy to know that there are people who enjoy helping other people. This makes him happy and motivated to finish his university education and continue to specialize in his area of work.

loans.use: to pay for a CISCO CCNA certification course.

loans.name: Zakaria

texts.en:
Zakaria is 26 years old from Nakuru.. He is married and blessed with one child, aged three years old.

He owns and operates a motorcycle for public transport, earning an income of KES 10,000 per month. He has advanced to a third loan of KES. 85,000 from VisionFund Kenya after successfully repaying the previous loan.  He plans to use the funds to boost his motorcycle business.

He anticipates to use the gains from his business to pay his loan ,educate his child and boost his business.  In future, he hopes to buy a plot and build his own house.

loans.use: To boost his motorcycle transport business.

loans.name: Asneth's Group

texts.en:
Asneth is a member of this group in Lugari District.  She is pictured here in a group of 5 One Acre Fund group leader farmers.  The group leaders represent a total of 67 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here.  Asneth has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with her hand raised.  She and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.							

Asneth is married and has 11 children.  She is 62 years old and is known as friendly.  She is active in her community in groups such as the prayer group, and burial committee.  Asneth has been a farmer for 38 years.  Asneth described her harvest as not bad with One Acre Fund last year, but believes she can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.  							

Asneth is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season.  Asneth joined One Acre Fund in order to get fertilizer and hybrid seeds.  She also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because she is an active community member, and wants to help more farmers.  Asneth plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send children to school, and save for the future.  She notes that working with One Acre Fund has led to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers.    							

Asneth and her group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.  One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.							

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Florence's Group

texts.en:
Florence is a member of this group in Lugari District.  She is pictured here in a group of 2 One Acre Fund group leader farmers.  The group leaders represent a total of 22 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here.  Florence has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with her hand raised.  She and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.							

Florence is married and has five children.  She is 47 years old and is known as a friendly, hardworking, reliable experienced farmer.  She is active in her community in groups such as the women's group, and savings group.  Florence has been a farmer for 20 years.  Florence described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.  		

Florence first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2013 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season.  Florence joined One Acre Fund in order to get new farming methods, get fertilizer and hybrid seeds,  earn enough to feed family, and send children to school.  She also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because she is an active community member, and wants to help more farmers, and wants to spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers.  Florence plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send children to school, and repair the home, and save for the future, and buy a cow.  She notes that working with One Acre Fund has lead to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers.  Florence’s own life was improved because she has more farm training, has more farm group support and was able to feed the family.  							

Florence and her group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.  One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.							

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar power system for his parents' home.

loans.name: Bibizilol

texts.ru: Эту 35-летнюю женщину зовут Бибизилол. Она уроженка района Вахш. Бибизилол является матерью 7-летнего Бобура, трехлетней Нозимы и двухлетнего Джахонгира. Ее муж не найдя работу на родине, уехал в Россию и сейчас работает там таксистом. Сама Бибизилол занята в сфере торговли. Она в течение 5 лет занимается продажей продуктов питания. Сейчас в ее магазине осталось совсем мало товара. Она хочет увеличить ассортимент продуктов питания и таким образом увеличить доход. Однако она нуждается в кредите, чтобы закупить новую партию товара. Она очень надеется на Вашу финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: This 35-year-old woman's name is Bibizilol. She is a native of the Vakhsh District. Bibizilol is a mother to 7-year-old Bobur, 3-year-old Nozima and 2-year-old Jakhongir. Unable to find work in his own country, her husband left for Russia and now works as a tractor operator there. Bibizilol is busy in the retail sector. For five years, she has been selling food products. Now, only a small amount of goods remain in her store. She wants to increase her assortment of food products and thus increase her income. However, she needs a loan to buy this new shipment of merchandise. She really relies on your financial support.

loans.use: to buy food products to increase sales at her store.

loans.name: Wafaa

texts.en:
Wafaa is a 37 year-old  married woman from a small village near Nablus city.   She is a mother of one son. Three years ago, Wafaa started working in sewing.   She opened a small workshop in her home.  She takes orders from local traders. 
Wafaa took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new sewing machine for her workshop.   By taking this loan, Wafaa will be able to improve her business and increase productivity. 
Wafaa appears in the photo while she was working.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her workshop.

loans.name: Clement's Group

texts.en:
Clement is a member of this group in Lugari District.  He is pictured here in a group of 4 One Acre Fund group leader farmers.  The group leaders represent a total of 56 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here.  Clement has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with his hand raised.  He and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.							

Clement is married and has nine children.  He is 50 years old and is known as a friendly, trustworthy, and experienced farmer.  He is active in his community in groups such as the prayer group.  Clement has been a farmer for 20 years.  Clement described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.  				

Clement first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2013 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season.  Clement joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, and get fertilizer and hybrid seeds.  He also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he is an active community member, and wants to help more farmers.  Clement plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send children to school, and save for the future.  He notes that working with One Acre Fund has lead to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers.  Clement’s own life was improved because he has more farm training, and has more farm group support, and was able to save money.  		

Clement and his group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.  One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.							

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Catherine's Group

texts.en:
Catherine is a member of this group in Lugari District.  She is pictured here in a group of 4 One Acre Fund group leader farmers.  The group leaders represent a total of 53 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here.  Catherine has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with her hand raised.  She and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.							

Catherine is married and has six children.  She is 43 years old and is known as friendly, hardworking, and trustworthy.  She is active in her community in groups such as the women's group, and prayer group.  Catherine has been a farmer for 29 years.  Catherine described her harvest as excellent last year, but believes she can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre fund.  

Catherine first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2012 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season.  Catherine joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, and get new farming methods, and get fertilizer and hybrid seeds.  She also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because she wants to help more farmers, and wants to spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers.  Catherine plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send children to school, and repair the home.  She notes that working with One Acre Fund has lead to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers.  Catherine’s own life was improved because she has more farm training, was able to save money and feed the family.  							

Catherine and her group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.  One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: With God Group

texts.en:
With God is a group of five ladies.  They all live in Accra-Teshie, Ghana. They are asking for a loan of GHS 3800 from ID-Ghana to sell fruits, grocery, maize, bed sheets and beads.

Mildred is a 35-year-old married woman with three children. She has been selling beads and slippers for five years.  She supports her husband in taking care of the children by moving door-to-door to sell her goods. She wants to improve her business, and most of what she earns goes to family expenses. Therefore, she is applying for a loan of GHS 1,000 from ID-Ghana in order to buy more goods. 

She will save part of her profit and also invest back part after she finishes repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To buy and sell beads and slippers to customers.

loans.name: Rosa Mistica Group

texts.es:
Rosa Mistica es un grupo formado en la ciudad de Villarrica, están mujeres forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, en cual les permitirá conocer en qué situación está cada una y conforme a ello poder trabajar y ayudar a sus familias.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Gladys quien al entrar al grupo se encontraba en un estado verde del semáforo, pero le costaba mantenerse y hoy a través del esfuerzo y la aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, ella busca salir adelante constantemente. Ella se dedica a la artesanía, haciendo también unos de los trabajos más pesados que es lavar la ropa y también se dedica a su tiempo libre en la venta de empanadas casa por casa, por medio de su trabajo arduo ayuda a su familia, y lucha para poder darles lo mejor.
La Sra. Solicita este préstamo para invertirlo en compras de telas para artesanía, ingredientes y productos para el lavado de ropas, lo que le ayudará a poder concretar y potenciar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Rosa Mistica is a group formed in the city of Villarrica. These women are part of the poverty elimination program, which will allow them to understand their individual situations so that they can work and help their families accordingly.

One of the members is Señora Gladys. When she joined the group, she was "full steam ahead," but it was hard for her to keep that up. Today, through effort and by employing the essential behaviors of a successful woman, she is trying to make constant progress. She works as an artisan, and she also does one of the hardest jobs, which is washing clothes. In addition, she earns money in her free time by selling empanadas [savory stuffed pastries] door to door. Through her hard work, she is helping her family and striving to be able to give them the best.

Señora Gladys is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of fabrics for her handicrafts, ingredients, and laundry products; this will help her to be able to carry out and strengthen her business plan, thus helping her to improve her income.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics for handicrafts, ingredients, laundry products, etc.

loans.name: Nodira

texts.ru: Нодира 29-летняя продавщица из района Кубадиён. Она энергичная и предприимчивая молодая женщина. Два года назад Нодира начала свою торговую деятельность. Она занимается куплей и продажей орехов - миндального и грецкого, кишмиша, фисташек и т.д. Ей в деятельности помогает мать и муж. В данный момент Нодира хотела бы расширить торговлю и таким образом увеличить бюджет семьи. Она просит кредит, чтобы закупить партию нового товара. Нодира ценит свой бизнес, так как благодаря ему она помогает мужу в обеспечении семьи и чувствеут себя счастливой и независимой женщиной. Она очень надеется, что Вы поддержите ее в расширении своего бизнеса.
texts.en: Nodira is a 29-year-old salesperson from the Qubadiyon District. She is an energetic and entrepreneurial young woman. Two years ago, Nodira began her retail business. She buys and sells almonds, walnuts, sultana raisins, pistachios, etc. Her mother and husband help her with her business. Currently, Nodira would like to expand her sales and thus increase her family's budget. She is requesting a loan to buy a shipment of new merchandise. Nodira values her business because thanks to it, she is able to help her husband provide for their family and feels like a happy, independent woman. She really hopes that you will help her expand her business.

loans.use: to buy and resell almonds, walnuts, sultana raisins, etc. to develop her business and increase her family's budget.

loans.name: Nenny

texts.en:
Nenny lives north of Bogor, about two hours from Jakarta. She manages a small shop selling snacks, drinks and mobile phone airtime credit. Nenny is married and lives with three persons in the family home.

Nenny joined Ruma two months ago because she was interested in selling mobile phone airtime credit. With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Nenny sees improvements in her shop. For the last two months, she has earned an average of $13 - $14 per day in mobile phone airtime credit sales.  

She hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions on the weekends. Her goal for her business is to expand and have more new business in the future.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
From Nyahururu, Christopher is 54 years old, married to Margaret and blessed with four children aged 30, 28, 24 and 10 years old. He has owned and operated a retail shop for 10 years, earning a monthly income of KES 20,000. 

Christopher is requesting his third loan from VisionFund Kenya to purchase more stock for resale. He will use his profits to repay his loan, educate his children and boost his business.

loans.use: To buy more stock for resale in his general shop

loans.name: Laura Idaly

texts.es:
Laura es una joven de 20 años, madre de un niño de dos años de edad, cursa tercer semestre en   auxiliar  de enfermería, en el  año 2010 se graduó de bachiller y en el 2011  quedo embarazada, se fue a vivir con el papa  del hijo, pero por cosas del destino no continuaron con ese hogar, el padre le colaboro con la estadía  y le ayudo a pagar el estudio en el 2013, en este año curso los dos primeros  semestres pero el padre por cuestiones  de salud  tuvo que trasladarse a una ciudad de tierra caliente y no le pudo seguir  colaborando con este  gasto. 

Ella vive ahora con una tía la cual le cobra un arriendo y los servicios aparte de este gasto le toca pagar el jardín al hijo hasta las 4 de la tarde y de ahí hasta las 7:30 que llega  ella le toca pagarle  a otra señora puesto que  la  tía trabaja y no se lo puede tener. Ella cuenta que se le a dificultado para pagar la cuota de  la carrera, la cual es de una suma de $182.000 pesos mensuales y es por eso que ella a acudido a kiva para que le colaboren con la necesidad y así poder terminar la carrera y poderse graduar este año y así brindarle lo mejor al hijo a si como lo ha venido haciendo hasta el momento de hoy.
texts.en:
Laura is a young woman who is 20 years of age. She is the mother of a two-year-old child. Laura is in her third semester of the nursing assistant’s program. She graduated from high school in 2010 and became pregnant in 2011. Laura was about to go live with the father of her child, but as things turned out, she did not follow through with that plan. Instead, the father helped with her expenses and paid for her studies in 2013. For the past two semesters, however, the father was not able to contribute because he had to move to another city with a warmer climate because of health reasons.

Laura currently lives with an aunt who charges her for rent and basic services. In addition to these expenses, she has to pay for her son’s day care, where he stays from 4:00 P.M. to 7:30 P.M. After that, she must pay another woman to look after her son since her aunt is not able to because of her work.

Laura says that it is difficult for her to pay for her degree program, which costs 182,000 COP per month. For this reason, she came to Kiva to seek assistance with this need so that she can finish her degree program and graduate this year. As a result, she will be able to provide the best for her child in the same manner that she is doing today.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of tuition.

loans.name: Xexac 1.1 Group

texts.es:
Manuela (primera de izquierda a derecha en la fotografía) es una mujer soltera, de 42 años de edad, vive junto a sus dos hijos, en Nahualá, Sololá. 
Manuela expresa muy orgullosa que la actividad que realiza es la venta de banano silvestre, que es un producto muy demandado en su comunidad y por lo mismo su comercialización es rentable. Esta labor la aprendió de sus padres hace 35 años; además es algo que le gusta hacer y con ello obtiene buenos ingresos y ganancias que le ayudan a colaborar con la economía de su familia.
Ella ha venido realizando esta actividad desde muy joven, y ahora ha adquirido más conocimiento en esta área, así que tomo la decisión de formar un grupo con el objetivo de diversificar sus productos en el mercado y de esta manera obtener un ingreso para mejorar la economía de las familias de los integrantes de su grupo. El préstamo lo utilizaran para la compra de insumos para el mantenimiento de banano.
Su sueño es poder construir una casa para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Manuela (first on the left in the photo) is 42 years old and single. She lives with her two children in Nahualá, Sololá.

Manuela is very proud of her work selling bananas. Bananas are popular in her community, making sales profitable. Manuela learned this trade from her parents 35 years ago. She likes to do this work and, with it, she earns a good living and good profits with which to support her family economy.

Manuela has been doing this work since she was very young, and she is now very knowledgeable about her work. As a result she has taken the decision to start a group in order to diversify her products for the market and earn more money for the families of her group's members. This loan will be used to buy supplies for looking after her banana plants.

Manuela's dream is to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to buy supplies for looking after her banana plants.

loans.name: John Gitau

texts.en:
John is 46 years old from Olkalou. He is married to Margaret and they are blessed with three children, aged 16, 10 and six years old.

He is a farmer, a business he has been running for the last five years.  To enable him to hire laborers to assist in preparation of land for the next planting season and to buy buy maize and beans seeds, he has applied for his third loan of KES. 60,000 from VisionFund Kenya.

John's monthly income right now is KES. 20,000 and his intention is to use the anticipated profits from his expanded business to educate his children and to pay his loan back to VisionFund Kenya.  He hopes to be a successful farmer in the future.

loans.use: To hire laborers to assist in preparation of the land for the next planting season and to buy maize and bean seeds

loans.name: Lydia Wanjiru

texts.en:
Lydia is 31 years old and is from Olkalou. She is married to Johann and they are blessed with three children aged 12, 7 years and an eight months old.

She is a farmer, a business she has been running for the last five years.  To enable her buy herbicides and pesticides to use on her potato crop, she has applied for her first loan of KES. 20,000 from VisionFund Kenya.

Lydia's monthly income right now is KES. 15,000 and her intention is to use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to educate her children and to pay her loan back to VisionFund Kenya.

She hopes to be a successful farmer in the future.

loans.use: To buy herbicides and pesticide to use on her potato crop

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace, who comes from a rural area in Ibanda district, is a married mother of seven children, four of whom are in school. She is a coffee farmer and also sells produce. 

Grace has requested a loan of UGX.700,000 to help her buy more coffee for trade. She hopes to make greater profits to pay her children's school fees and meet other family needs. Grace is a very hardworking woman.

loans.use: To buy coffee for resale

loans.name: Horassudin

texts.en:
Horassudin lives north of Bogor, about two hours from Jakarta. He manages a small shop selling snacks, drinks and mobile phone airtime credit. Horassudin is married and lives with four persons in the family home.

Horassudin joined Ruma one month ago because he was interested in selling mobile phone airtime credit. With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Horassudin sees improvements in his shop. For the last month, he has earned an average of $12 - $13 per day in mobile phone airtime credit sales.  

He hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions on the weekends. His goal for his business is to expand and have more new business in the future.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends.

loans.name: Ephantus

texts.en:
From Nyahururu, Ephantus is 50 years old, married to Emily and blessed with two children aged 21 and 17 years old. For 23 years he has owned and operated a clothes-selling business, earning a monthly income of KES 25,000.

Ephantus has applied for his first loan from VisionFund Kenya, with which he plans to buy clothes for resale. He will use his profits to repay his loan, educate his children and boost his business. 

In the future, Ephantus plans to buy a plot of land and build his own house.

loans.use: To buy more clothing for resale to expand his business.

loans.name: Mujeres Alegres Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Alegres es un grupo que se formó en la ciudad de Caacupé, donde cada una de ellas ponen su mejor esfuerzo para poder dar a sus seres queridos todo lo que ellas no pudieron tener, y de esa forma evitar que pasen por privaciones.
La señora Felina es casada, y tiene hijos por quienes lucha para poder sacarlos adelante. La señora Felina se dedica a la elaboración de canastos de tacuara y el préstamo que pide lo quiere usar para la compra de plantas, ya que quiere dedicarse también a la venta de las mismas, ya que de esa forma podrá ayudar con un poco más de ingresos a su familia.
Agradece por la oportunidad que están recibiendo de poder salir adelante y ayudar a sus familias.
texts.en: Mujeres Alegres ("Joyful Women") is a group that was formed in the city of Caacupé, where each of the ladies makes her best effort to be able to give her loved ones everything she never had. This way they avoid hardship. Felina is married and has children whom she struggles to support. She works making baskets from reeds, and the loan that she requests will be used to buy plants, since she also wants to work selling those. This way she can help a little more with the family's income. Felina appreciates the opportunity they are receiving to support and help their families.

loans.use: to buy plants to sell.

loans.name: Salima

texts.ru: Салима улыбчивая, миролюбивая и добрая женщина из района Шахритус и мать четверых детей. Старшему ребенку 15 лет, а младшему 3 года. Воспитанием детей занимается Салима. Ее муж, как и большинство мужчин сел, деревень и районов Таджикистана из-за отсутствия рабочих мест уехал на заработки в Российскую Федерацию. Салима не унывает, и посвящает свое время детям и домашними делами. Сейчас у нее появилось большее времени, и она планирует получить кредит и купить телят для откорма и продажи. Салима верит и надеется на доброту людей, и они помогут ей обзавестись скотинами. Когда у нее будет коровы и быки она сможет их продать с наценкой и купить детям необходимые вещи для учебы и позволить семье новые экономические возможности.
texts.en: Salima is a smiling, peaceful, kind woman from the Shahrituz District. She is a mother to four children. Her oldest child is 15 years old and her youngest is 3 years old. Salima takes care of raising the children. Her husband, like the majority of the men from villages, towns and districts in Tajikistan, left to work in the Russian Federation due to the lack of jobs in the country. Salima keeps her spirits up and devotes her time to her children and her household chores. Now she has more free time, so she plans to get a loan and buy calves for fattening up and reselling. Salima believes in and relies on the kindness of people and that they will help her acquire cattle. When she has cows and bulls, she will be able to sell them at a profit and buy her children necessary items for school. It will also create new economic opportunities for her family.

loans.use: to buy calves to develop her small business.

loans.name: Kuña Kyrey Group

texts.es:
El grupo Kuña kyrey está en su ciclo número 5to. del programa de comité de mujeres, donde las señoras se ayudan para poder salir adelante y por medio del esfuerzo en conjunto poder dar a sus familias todo lo que ellas no pudieron tener.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Mirna quien través del esfuerzo y la dedicación ha podido ir mejorando su bienestar económico dentro de la familia, es una mujer luchadora que pone todo de si parte para salir adelante y generar nuevos ingresos dentro de la familia. Cuenta la misma que realiza la venta de  queso y venta de productos generales y así lograr adquirir más beneficios.
La Sra. Mirna solicita de este préstamo para la compra de productos para la elaboración de quesos para su posterior venta dentro y fuera de la ciudad, con eso ella va mejorando su bienestar económico dentro del hogar.
texts.en:
The Kuña Kyrey Group is in its fifth cycle of the Women's Committee Program. The women help each other to move ahead and, through their joint effort, to give their families everything which they never had.

One of the members of this group is Mirna, who has been able to improve her family's financial well-being through her effort and dedication. She is a hardworking woman who gives everything she has to move ahead and earn an income for her family. She sells cheese and general products to earn a better income.

Mirna has applied for this loan to buy products to make cheese, which she will then sell in and out of the city. In this way, she will continue improving her household's financial well-being.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make cheese, which she will then sell.

loans.name: Irene Gissela

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Virgen Del Rosario se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. En este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes se dedican a la fabricación de botones de tagua, artesanía y comercio en general.
Aquí vive la señora Irene, tiene 30 años  de edad,  está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 11, 7 y 2 años, los dos mayores estudian en escuela. Su esposo es artesano.
Doña Irene es una muy buena madre y esposa que realiza el crédito para el negocio que tiene con su marido, ellos se dedican a fabricar harina de pescado. Trabajan de lunes a viernes en la elaboración de este producto, el se desplaza a Manta a comprar la parte del pescado que no se utilizan para fabricar el atún y luego lo traslada hasta su casa para hacer la harina de pescado, la misma que luego  entregan a comerciantes que la exportan al extranjero donde este producto es muy utilizado. Ellos llevan más de 10 años en esta actividad con la cual salen adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar pescado para  elaborar la harina. Está  en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 3 años y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos. Sus sueños son tener una gran fábrica y un camión para comprar el pescado y vender la harina.
texts.en:
