The “Virgen Del Rosario” [Virgin of the Rosary] communal bank meets every fifteen days in Colorado, in Montecristi canton, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its nationally and internationally recognized artisanal crafts.  Most of the residents of this area are engaged in making tagua buttons, crafts, and general trade.

Irene lives here.  She is 30 years old, and married with three children, ages 11, 7, and 2.  The two oldest are in school, and her husband is an artisan.
Irene is a very good wife and mother who is taking out the loan for the business she has with her husband; they are engaged in making fishmeal.  They work Monday through Friday on the preparation of this product.  He travels to Manta to purchase the part of the fish that isn’t used in making tuna, and then transports it to their home to make the fishmeal.  Then they deliver it to traders that export it abroad, where this product is widely used.  They have been engaged in this business for over ten years, and this is how they get ahead.

This loan is for the purchase of fish to make the meal.  She has been a member of the group for three years, and she is pleased with the help they have given her through the loans.  She dreams of having a big factory and a truck to use for purchasing the fish and selling the meal.

loans.use: to purchase fish.

loans.name: Piturish's Group

texts.en:
Piturish  is a member of this group in Lugari District.  She is pictured here in a group of four One Acre Fund group leader farmers.  The group leaders represent a total of 50 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here.  Piturish  has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with her hand raised.  She and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.							

Piturish  is 44 years old and has been a farmer for 17 years.  Piturish  works as a farmer to provide for her fdive children.  The community and other farmers know Piturish as a friendly, hardworking, experienced farmer.  Other than farming, she is also involved in her community such as the women's group, and prayer group.  Piturish  described her harvest last year as good, but hopes she can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in her group.							

The 2014 Long Rains season won’t be Piturish ’s first season with One Acre Fund.  She first joined One Acre Fund in 2013 and has continue working with One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, and get new farming methods, and get fertilizer and hybrid seeds, earn enough to feed family, and send children to school.  As an active member in her community, Piturish  also chose to be a group leader and Kiva representative because she is an active community member, and wants to help more farmers, and wants to spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers.  Piturish  plans on using future profits from the harvest to send children to school, and save for the future.  Her life has improved by working with One Acre Fund because she has more profits from harvest, has more farm training and was able to save money.		

One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya.  The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers.  Piturish  and her group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund continues providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.		

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds for maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Herti

texts.en:
Herti lives north of Bogor, about two hours from Jakarta. She manages a small shop selling gifts and mobile phone airtime credit. Herti is married and lives with six persons in the family home.

Herti joined Ruma one month ago because she was interested in selling mobile phone airtime credit. With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Herti sees improvements in her shop. For the last month, she has earned an average of $7 - $8 per day in mobile phone airtime credit sales.  

She hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions on the weekends. Her goal for her business is to expand and have more new business in the future.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends.

loans.name: San Jorge Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Vicente está en su 2º ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas se comprometieron a trabajar y a ayudarse entre todas para salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde gracias al trabajo podrán ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
Zulma es una de las integrantes de este grupo, ella es vendedora de cosméticos, y por medio de este trabajo ayuda a su familia a poder darles todo lo que ella no pudo tener. Ella es una persona muy sacrificada que con mucha lucha está poniendo su esfuerzo para salir adelante.
Zulma pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de cosméticos variados para la venta, ya que de esa forma podrá seguir con sus ventas luchando por mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The San Vicente Group is in the second cycle of the Women's Committee Program. All of the members are committed to working and helping each other to move forward. They are participating in the poverty elimination survey. Thanks to their work, they can continue improving their living conditions.

Zulma is one of the members of this group. She is a cosmetics saleswoman. Through this work, she helps her family to give them everything which she could not have. She is a hardworking, fighting person who is putting all of her effort into moving forward.

Zulma has applied for this loan to invest in the purchase of various cosmetics, which she will then sell. In this way, she will continue with her sales, fighting to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, which she will then sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizers, pest control and herbicides to improve his land.

loans.name: Bazarbubu

texts.ru: Базарбубу 43 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 5 детей. У Базарбубу - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Базарбубу занимается животноводством, стартовав 9 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Базарбубу, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 6 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 12,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Базарбубу обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Базарбубу планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en: Bazarbubu is 43 years old, married, and together with her husband, is raising five children. Bazarbubu has a secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, Bazarbubu practices livestock breeding. She started this business 9 years ago with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Bazarbubu's hard work, she currently has 3 milk cows and 6 sheep on her farm. Her monthly income is 12,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Bazarbubu turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan to buy sheep to increase the size of her herd. Bazarbubu plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money for her children's future education.

loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Rosa Aura

texts.es: Rosa es una mujer de 56 años de edad, ella vive con su esposo y 5 de sus 8 hijos y 2 nietos en una casa prestada  por su cuñada, comenta que ella se hace cargo de sus nietos ya la madre de los niños les abandono, Rosa se dedica a la crianza de chanchos y también lava ropa de otras personas para así obtener otros ingresos, su esposo se dedica a reciclar botellas de plástico y las vende en la ciudad de Quito, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos ya que esta actividad la realiza desde que tenía 15 años, la mayor aspiración de Rosa es ampliar su negocio y obtener los ingresos necesarios para cubrir los gastos de su familia y seguir ayudando a sus nietos es la educación.
texts.en:
Rosa, 56, lives with her husband, five of her eight children, and her two grandchildren in a house provided by her sister-in-law. She is responsible for her grandchildren because their mother abandoned them. 

Rosa makes a living raising pigs. She also washes clothing for other people to earn an additional income. Her husband makes a living recycling plastic bottles and selling them in the city of Quito.

She will invest this loan in the purchase of pigs. She has raised pigs for 15 years. Her greatest wish is to expand her business and to earn the necessary income to cover her family's expenses and to continue helping her grandchildren with their education.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.es:
Doña Rosalina tiene 44 años de edad con un grado de educación de primaria incompleta el cual pudo cursar hasta el segundo año ya que sus padres no pudieron apoyarle por la falta de dinero, soltera y madre de 3 hijos el mayor quien está en el sexto año es su único apoyo, la segunda es una niña la cual está en quinto grado y el tercer hijo que está en segundo grado. Ella es la única y la encargada de proveer a sus hijos la alimentación, vestimenta, medicina entre otras cosas para el cuidado y protección de la salud. El cultivo de zanahoria es la actividad financiera que genera ingresos para su familia en la cual trabaja desde hace más de 6 años dedicándose al igual que la mayoría de los habitantes que viven en la zona a la alfarería siendo sus clientes el mercado zonal el cual está ubicado a 20 kilómetros desde su casa de habitación al cual se trasladan en auto bus. 
Sus metas, planes y sueños, poder seguir ampliando sus parcelas de tierra para poder seguir cultivando zanahoria  al igual que poder diversificar sus cultivos sembrando otra clase de hortalizas. Para con sus hijos poder apoyarlos en sus estudios de manera que ellos puedan culminarlos y preparase académicamente para que no pasen por la misma situación que ella en su juventud. Doña Rosalina solicita apoyo para la compra de insumos agrícolas que ayuden al crecimiento, protección, entre otros de animales, plagas y factor clima para obtener un excelente ingreso al final de la temporada.
texts.en:
Doña Rosalina is 44 years old and was not able to finish her primary school education. She only finished through the second grade because her parents lacked the money for her to continue. Rosalina is single and the mother of three children. Her oldest child, a son, is in the sixth grade and is her only means of support. The next child is a daughter who is in fifth grade and the youngest child is a son who is in second grade. Rosalina is the only one responsible for providing her children with food, clothing, medicines, and other things to protect them and keep them healthy.

Rosalina grows carrots in order to generate income for her family. She has been doing this type of work for more than six years. Like most of the other residents who live in the area and make pottery, she sells to her customers at the local market, which is located 20 kilometers from her house. Therefore, she must travel by bus.

Her goals, plans, and dreams include continuing to expand her parcels of land so that she can continue growing carrots. In addition, she would like to diversify her crops by planting other types of vegetables. Rosalina wants to help her children with their studies so that they can finish their education and become prepared academically. She does not want them to go through the same situation that she experienced in her youth.

Doña Rosalina is requesting assistance with buying farming supplies that will help her crops grow and will protect them from animals, pests, and weather factors. She hopes to obtain a good income at the end of the season.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies for her carrot crop.

loans.name: Topik

texts.en:
Topik lives north of Bogor, about two hours from Jakarta. He manages a small shop selling mobile phone airtime credit. Topik is single and lives with three persons in the family home.

Topik joined Ruma one month ago because he was interested in selling mobile phone airtime credit. With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Topik sees improvements in his shop. For the last month, he has earned an average of $14 - $15 per day in mobile phone airtime credit sales.  

He hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions on the weekends. His goal for his business is to expand and have more new business in the future.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends.

loans.name: Silvia Alexandra

texts.es: Silvia es una joven de 24 años de edad ella vive con sus padres y sus hermanos y 2 sobrinos, ella se dedica al jornal y trabaja lavando ropa para ganar algo más de dinero, comenta que son ya 10 años que se dedica a la crianza de chanchos y el crédito lo va a invertir comprando chanchos para obtener una utilidad por esta actividad, a Silvia le gustaría salir adelante, mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia ya que sus padres también se dedican a la crianza de animales menores y se esfuerzan para sobrevivir.
texts.en: Silvia is a 24 year old young woman.  She lives with her parents, two brothers, and two nephews.  She is a day worker, and washes clothes to earn extra money.  She say that she has been engaged in raising pigs for ten years already, and she will use the loan to purchase pigs and gain a profit from this business.  Silvia would like to get ahead, and improve the quality of life for herself and her family because her parents are also engaged in raising small animals and they work hard to survive.

loans.use: to purchase pigs.

loans.name: Peter's Group

texts.en:
Peter is a member of this group in Lugari District.  He is pictured here in a group of five One Acre Fund group leader farmers.  The group leaders represent a total of 48 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here.  Peter has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with his hand raised.  He and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings (KES) for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.

Peter is married and has six children.  He is 64 years old and is known as a friendly, hardworking and experienced farmer.  He is active in his community in groups such as the men's group, savings group and burial committee.  Peter has been a farmer for 33 years.  Peter described his harvest as poor last year, but believes he can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.  		

Peter first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2012 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season.  Peter joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, get new farming methods and get fertilizer and hybrid seeds.  He also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he likes being a leader and is an active community member who wants to help more farmers by spreading the story about One Acre Fund farmers.  Peter plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send children to school, repair his home, save for the future, and buy a cow.  He notes that working with One Acre Fund has lead to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers.  Peter’s own life was improved because he has more profits from harvest, has more farm training and was able to feed his family.  							

Peter and his group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.  One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings on to the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.							
						
The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Ariyen

texts.en:
Ariyen lives north of Bogor, about two hours from Jakarta. He manages a small shop selling tools and mobile phone airtime credit. Ariyen is married and lives with three persons in the family home.

Ariyen joined Ruma one month ago because he was interested in selling mobile phone airtime credit. With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Ariyen sees improvements in his shop. For the last month, he has earned an average of $10 - $11 per day in mobile phone airtime credit sales.  

He hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions on the weekends. His goal for his business is to expand and have more new business in the future.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends.

loans.name: Los Olivos Group

texts.es:
El grupo Los Olivos está en su ciclo número 12° Del programa de comité donde están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 4 integrantes se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir que deben seguir trabajando por mejorar sus ingresos.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Lorena, quien a través del trabajo y esfuerzo que está haciendo pretende lograr un éxito total, y también gracias a la venta de bijouteries que hace, por medio de ello quiere salir adelante y ayudar a su familia como lo viene haciendo.
La Sra. Lorena pide este préstamo para la compra bijouteries para vender, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The Los Olivos group is in the twelfth cycle of the Women's Committee Program. They are participating in the poverty elimination survey. Four members were found to be under the poverty line, so they must continue working to improve their income.

One of the members of this group is Lorena, who hopes to achieve success through her hard work and effort selling jewelry. Through this work, she hopes to move forward and help her family as she has been doing.

Lorena has applied for this loan to buy jewelry, which she will then sell. This will help her to strengthen her business plan and improve her income.

loans.use: to buy jewelry, which she will then sell.

loans.name: Uzul

texts.ru:
Узул 33 летняя жительница маленького района Шахритус. Она с мужем воспитывает троих детей. Узул с детьми с мужем и родителями мужа живет в одном доме. Узул занимается животноводством, выращивает скотин. Ей активно помогает муж в работе. Узул счастлива в браке.
  На сегодняшний день из-за повышения семейных расходов ее мужу трудно обеспечить семью и Узул просит кредит, чтобы купить бычков и расширить маленький бизнес и увеличить доходность. Поддержите Узул.
texts.en:
Uzul is a 33-year-old resident of the small Shahrituz District. She and her husband are raising three children. Uzul lives with her children, her husband and her husband's parents all in one house. Uzul practice livestock breeding, specifically raising cattle. Her husband actively helps her with this work. Uzul is happy in her marriage.

Currently, due to rising family expanses, her husband is having difficulty providing for their family. Uzul is requesting a loan to buy bull calves to expand her small business and increase its profitability. Please support Uzul.

loans.use: to buy bull calves.

loans.name: Hector Manuel

texts.es: Hector de 46 años de edad vive junto a su esposa y sus ocho hijos en casa propia, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene 25 años de trabajar en la agricultura y eso le  ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, sus cosechas las comercia en los alrededores de la comunidad, ya tiene mucha clientela que lo prefieren por la calidad, los buenos precios y sobre todo por el buen servicio; el necesita invertir por eso le solicita un credito que le permita comprar semillas, insecticida, herbicida, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno donde piensa hacer su siembra que es el que muestra la fotografía.  Hector  tiene buenas referencias de pago por parte de sus conocidos, y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda en el periodo establecido y a la vez confía que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Hector is 46 years old and lives with his wife and eight children in their own home. He makes a living growing corn and beans. He has been farming for 25 years, giving him the experience he needs to receive the best possible harvests. He sells his crops in his community's surroundings. He already has a lot of customers, who choose his goods because of the high quality, good prices and above all, good service. 

He is requesting a loan to invest to buy seeds, insecticide, herbicide, fertilizer, manure, and pest control to improve the land where he plans to sow, as shown in the photo. Hector has good payment references from those who know him. He is very responsible and is certain that he will be able to pay his loan over the established period, and is confident that it will give his home economic security.

loans.use: to buy seeds, insecticide, herbicide, fertilizer, manure, and pest control to improve his land.

loans.name: Mujeres Para El Desarrollo Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Para el Desarrollo está en su Segundo ciclo del programa de comité, ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, donde por medio de ella podrán conocer la situación en la que cada una se encuesta y conforme a eso poder trabajar.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Evany, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel dos, es decir con niveles medios de ingresos, donde ella pone su mejor esfuerzo para poder ir mejorando su vida y la de su familia día a día. Evany se dedica a la confección, y comenta que gracias al buen trabajo que hace ya se ha formado una buena clientela que siempre le trae muchos trabajos y gracias a los cuales puede mantener a su familia.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas, hilos, gomas, cierres y demás, y de esa forma poder cumplir con sus clientes como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Mujeres Para el Desarrollo (Women for Development) is in its second cycle of the committee program. They are carrying out the poverty elmination survey from which the situation of each woman who is surveyed can be known and in this way they can work together. 

One of the members is Evany who in her most recent survey had a level two poverty level, meaning that she has a medium level of earnings. She puts her greatest effort in every day to improve her and her family's lives each day. Evany makes a living making clothing. She comments that thanks to the good work that she does, she has a good clientele that always brings her lots of work. Thanks to these orders, she can sustain her family. 

Evany is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of fabric, thread, bands, and fasteners. In this way she will meet her customers' needs as she has already done in the past.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, bands, and fasteners.

loans.name: Cristian Xavier

texts.es: Cristian tiene 21 años de edad, él es un joven soltero trabajador y con muchas ganas de luchar para salir adelante, Cristian vive con sus padres y con una hermana que tiene 16 años y se encuentra asistiendo a colegio, Cristian se dedica hace 3 años a la agricultura y comenta que le va bien ya que su padre le enseña a cuidar sus cultivos, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de semilla y en la preparación del terreno para sembrar sus plantas, lo que este joven aspira es incrementar su actividad y mejorar sus ingresos para seguir con sus negocio.
texts.en: Cristian is 21.  He's a single, hardworking young man with a great desire to fight to succeed.  He lives with his parents and a 16-year-old sister, and he goes to high school.  He's been farming for 3 years and says it's going well because his father teaches him how to care for his crops.  Cristian's loan will go toward investing in seeds and preparing the land for planting his crops.  This young man aspires to step up his activity and improve his income so he can continue on with the business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more food stuffs and soft drinks for her business

loans.name: Mehriniso

texts.ru: Мехринисо жительница района Шахритус. Ей 48 лет. Она замужем. Мехринисо решила начать новый бизнес и принести в семью новый источник дохода. Она хочет начать новый бизнес в сфере животноводства. Мехринисо начинает разводить быков у себя дома в коровнике. У нее имеется все условия для начала данного бизнеса, но не хватает достаточной суммы для купли телят и бычков. Она обратилась за кредитом, с надеждой, что ей помогут, и у ее семьи будет дополнительный источник дохода. Она верит в Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Mehriniso lives in the Shaartuz region.  She's 48 and married.  She has decided to start up a new business to bring in some new income for the family.  She wants to start a business in the livestock breeding sphere.  She'll begin by raising bulls in a cowshed by her house.  She has everything in order for launching the business but she doesn't have sufficient funds to buy calves and bulls.  She's seeking a loan in the hope that she'll get help and her family will be able to have more income.  She trusts in your support.

loans.use: to buy calves and bulls to start a new livestock breeding business.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: Pedro de 47 años de edad es un hombre  muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarle lo mejor a su familia. Actualmente vive junto a su esposa y sus hijos,  es muy trabajador, siempre lo ha realizado con alegría y entusiasmo, se dedica a ser agricultora siembra todos los años los principales granos básicos de la zona como lo son, maíz y frijol.  Pedro desea incrementar sus ventas y por eso visitó las oficinas de INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas entre otros y mejorar el terreno que es el que muestra la fotografia. Desea contar con la ayuda solicitada puesto que no tiene otros ingresos monetarios, y así el seguirá llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Pedro, 47, is very responsible with his household obligations. He has always been characterized as giving the best to his family. He lives with his wife and children. He is very hardworking and has always worked happily and with enthusiasm. He is a farmer who plants the main basic grains from the region, rice and beans, every year.

Pedro would like to increase his income, so he visited the INTEGRAL office to apply for a loan. This loan will allow him to buy seeds, manure, fertilizer, and pesticide, among other items, and to improve his land (shown in the photo). He hopes to have this help because he does not have other sources of financial income. He will then continue bringing home the daily bread to his family without limitations.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, fertilizer, and pesticides, and to improve his land.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a 40-year-old lady from a location known as Ilesi, which is found within Kakamega County in the western part of Kenya. She is married and supports three people in her family, and she has one daughter.

She is operating a money transfer service, a business she has been doing for the last two years. She gets a monthly income of KES 40,000. She is taking her first loan with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to increase her working capital. She will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business.

Her dream is to expand her business.

loans.use: to increase her working capital for her money transfer service.

loans.name: Ntalama

texts.en:
Ntalama has successfully repaid his KES 60,000 loan after receiving good proceeds from the harvested crops. He is now able to pay school fees for all his children.

He has now borrowed KES 90,000. This will enable him to expand his farming to include an unutilized piece of land. He hopes to harvest more, as the weather conditions have been very favorable. His dream is to become a successful farmer and to own his own machinery.

loans.use: to pay for land cultivation.

loans.name: Uwizeyimana

texts.en: Uwizeyimana, a 25-year-old married mother of a three-year-old, has been selling foodstuffs for the past two years. She has requested this loan to buy more foodstuffs such as beans and corn flour to resell. Uwizeyimana will use her profits to complete the house that she has already started constructing.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs such as beans and corn flour for resale.

loans.name: Mavzuna

texts.ru:
Мавзуна портниха из города Куляб. Ей 29 лет. Она не так давно начала свое швейное дело. Уже год как она занимается пошивом женских платьев национального стиля. Она приобрела постоянных клиентов и теперь хочет расширить свою деятельность. Мавзуна берет кредит, чтобы купить модернизированную компьютерную вышивальную машинку, с помощью которой она будет делать на платьях красивые вышивки, чтобы привлечь больше клиенток. Сегодня платья с вышивками стали модными и такая услуга стала востребованной. Таким образом Мавзуна расширит свое дело и увеличит доходность своего дела, так как услуга за вышивку стоит дороже.
Семья Мавзуны большая. Она с тремя детьми и мужем живет под одной крышей со свекровью, свёкорю и братьями мужа. Их в семье 8 человек. Муж Мавзуны таксист. Сыновьям Мавзуны 5 и 3 года, а младшему 6 месяцев. Мавзуна успевает и ухаживать за детьми и вести домашние дела и заниматься своим швейным делом. Она счастливая женщина, так как у нее дружная семья и любимая работа, которую она хочет с вашей поддержкой расширить.
texts.en:
Mavzuna is a seamstress from the city of Kulob. She is 29 years old. Not long ago, she began her own sewing business. It's already been a year since she took up sewing ethnic Tajik-style women's dresses. She has acquired loyal customers and now wants to expand her business. Mavzuna is taking out a loan to buy a modernized, computerized sewing machine. With its help, she will be able to make dresses with beautiful embroidery in order to attract more customers. Currently, dresses with embroidery are very fashionable and such services are in demand. Therefore, Mavzuna will expand her business and increase the profitability of her business, as embroidery services cost more.

Mavzuna's family is large. She lives with her husband and three children under one roof with her mother-in-law, father-in-law and brothers-in-law. There are 8 people in her family. Mavzuna's husband is a taxi driver. Mavzuna's sons are 5 and 3 years old, and her youngest is 6 months old. Mavzuna successfully manages to look after her children and run the household and do her sewing business. She is a happy woman as she has a close-knit family and a beloved profession which she hopes to expand with your support.

loans.use: to buy a computerized sewing machine to develop her sewing business.

loans.name: Matroba's Group

texts.en:
Matroba is a member of this group in the Lugari District. She is pictured here in a group of six One Acre Fund group leader farmers. The group leaders represent a total of 57 individual One Acre Fund farmers, who are not pictured here. Matroba has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with her hand raised. She and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet. Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.

Matroba is married and has 3 children. She is 53 years old and is known as friendly, hardworking, reliable, trustworthy, and an experienced farmer. She is active in her community in groups such as the women's group, and the savings group. Matroba has been a farmer for 40 years. Matroba described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.

Matroba first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2013 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 long rains season. Matroba joined One Acre Fund in order to learn new farming methods, to receive fertilizer and hybrid seeds, and to earn enough to feed her family. She also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because she is an active community member who wants to help more farmers. Matroba plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send children to school, save for the future, and to buy a cow. She notes that working with One Acre Fund has lead to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers. Matroba’s own life was improved because she has more farm training, and was able to feed the family.

Matroba and her group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests. One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Benard's Group

texts.en:
Benard is a group member in the Lugari District. He is pictured here in a group of 4 One Acre Fund group leader farmers. The group leaders represent a total of 41 individual One Acre Fund farmers, who are not pictured here. Benard has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with his hand raised. He and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet. Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet, and sorghum cultivation.

Benard is married and has 10 children. He is 53 years old and is known as hardworking, and an experienced farmer. He is active in his community in groups, such as the men's group. Benard has been a farmer for 15 years. Benard described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.

Benard first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2013 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 long rains season. Benard joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, to learn new farming methods, and to earn enough to feed his family. He also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he wants to spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers. Benard plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send children to school, and to buy a cow, goat, and a pig. He notes that working with One Acre Fund has lead to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers. Benard’s own life was improved because he was able to feed the family.

Benard and his group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests. One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
Este grupo llamado Divino Niño Jesus forma parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde todas podrán conocer la situación en la que se encuentran y conforme a ello poder trabajar.
Leonida es una de ellas, es una mujer muy trabajadora que con esfuerzo y sacrificio está saliendo adelante, es el sostén de su familia y los ayuda por medio de la venta de comidas que ella misma hace. Leonida comenta que todos los días empieza su jornada desde muy tempranas horas y que gracias a ese trabajo esta saliendo adelante.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para poder seguir haciendo sus comidas, como ser verduras, condimentos, carne, pollo, jamón, queso y demás. Todas las integrantes agradecen por la oportunidad que están recibiendo que les será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The group called Divino Niño Jesus is part of the poverty elimination programme, where everyone can know their situation and can work accordingly.

Leonida is one of the group members, and is a hard-working woman who, by her effort and sacrifice, is making progress. She is the breadwinner of the family and helps them by selling meals she herself prepares. Leonida says that she starts her working day very early and that thanks to this work she is able to get on in life.

She is asking for this loan to invest in buying supplies such as vegetables, condiments, meat, chicken, ham and cheese to continue making her meals. All the members of the group are grateful for this opportunity, which will be a great help to them.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, condiments, meat, chicken, ham, cheese and other ingredients to prepare meals.

loans.name: Rukhshona

texts.ru: Этой женщине 38 лет. Ее зовут Рухшона, она мать троих сыновей, которым по 14, 16 и 19 лет. Ее муж в течение 18 лет работает в России. А Рухшона с сыновьями живет в городе Куляб. Ее старший сын учится в первом курсе в университете, а младшие сыновья ходят в школу. Сама Рухшона у себя дома предоставляет услуги швеи. Она занимается этой деятельностью уже год. Она шьет на очень старой швейной машинке. Рухшона хочет расширить свою деятельность и на сумму кредита планирует купить новую модернизированную швейную машинку. Она очень надеется на финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: This woman is 38-years-old.  Her name is Rukhshona and she's the mother of three sons, ages 14, 16, and 19.  Her husband of 18 years works in Russia, and she and her sons live in Kulob.  Rukhshona's eldest son is in his first year in college.  The youngest is in school.  Rukhshona has been in business for a year providing sewing services from her home.  She uses a very old sewing machine.  She wants to expand the business and plans put her loan toward the purchase of a new, up-to-date machine.  She is really hoping for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine to develop her business.

loans.name: Nahashon's Group

texts.en:
Nahashon is a member of this group in Lugari District. He is pictured here in a group of five One Acre Fund group leader farmers. The group leaders represent a total of 58 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here. Nahashon has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with his hand raised. He and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet. Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 KES for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.							

Nahashon is married and has four children. He is 52 years old and is known as a friendly, hardworking, reliable, trustworthy, and experienced farmer.  He is active in his community in groups such as the men's group. Nahashon has been a farmer for 22 years. Nahashon did not work with One Acre Fund last year, but believes he can have an even better harvest this year by working with One Acre Fund.  							

Nahashon first enrolled with One Acre Fund this year and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season. Nahashon joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, learn new farming methods, get fertilizer and hybrid seeds, earn enough to feed his family, and send his children to school. He also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he is an active community member. He wants to help more farmers and wants to spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers. Nahashon plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school, to repair his home, to save for the future, and to buy a cow. He notes that working with One Acre Fund has led to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers.  			

Nahashon and his group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests. One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.							

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Ameen

texts.en:
Ameen is a 23-year-old single young man from a small village near Jenin city. Three years ago, he started his own business, which is a barber shop. He has very good experience in this field.
 
Ameen would like to improve and expand his business. He took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to renovate and decorate his barber shop. By taking this loan, Ameen will be able to improve his business and attract more clients.

loans.use: to renovate and decorate his barber shop

loans.name: Mayrambi

texts.ru: Майрамби живет в городе Куляб с мужем и четырьмя сыновьями. Все ее сыновья являются подростками и ходят в школу. Муж Майрамби работает в государственном агентстве по противодействию коррупции. Майрамби сама продавщица. Ей 47 лет. Она в течение 4 лет занимается продажей тканей и материалов. Она продает свой товар в селах и в районах и на ее товар всегда имеется спрос. Майрамби хочет увеличить товарооборот и для цели просит кредит. Она планирует закупить ассортимент сезонных тканей, чтобы привлечь больше клиентов. Благодаря кредиту она приобретет продаваемый товар и таким образом увеличит количество продажи. Она надеется на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Mayrambi lives in the city of Kulob with her husband and four sons. All of her sons are teenagers and attend school. Mayrambi's husband works in a government agency to combat corruption. Mayrambi is a salesperson. She is 47 years old. For the past four years, she has been selling fabrics and materials. She sells her merchandise in villages and districts. Her merchandise is always in demand. Mayrambi wants to increase her sales turnover for which she is requesting a loan. She plans to buy an assortment of seasonal fabrics to attract more customers. Thanks to the loan, she will buy her retail merchandise and thus increase her number of sales. She relies on your support.

loans.use: to buy and resell fabrics and materials.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a 30-year-old woman who lives in a rural area in the Kazo Kiruhura district. She is divorced with 2 children and 4 dependents, with whom she is living due to the death of their parents. She deals in cattle fattening and milking as her major source of income. She owns 60 cows, of which the majority are for milk. With this income, Monica has managed to look after her family by providing medication and by paying school fees for her two children and three sisters.

Monica is applying for a loan of UGX 3,000,000 to buy more dairy cows to increase her milk production. She will also buy drugs for her sick cows.

Her major challenge is the dry season, which leads to inadequate grass to feed her animals, lack of water, and the resulting decrease in milk production.

Her dream is to own a milk cooling plant in her region and also to see her children graduating from the University.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Shabnam

texts.ru: Шабнам 20-летняя молодая девушка самостоятельно зарабатывающая на жизнь. Четыре года назад изучив профессию швеи у жены своей дяди, она открыла свое швейное дело. Шабнам сама из города Куляб. Она живет там с матерью, двумя братьями, дядей и его женой, которая является опытной швеей. Шабнам тоже уже набрала хороший опыт в этой сфере. Она шьет качественно и быстро. Она еще и дополнительно научилась делать вышивки на платьях. Теперь чтобы принимать заказы на эту услугу, ей необходимо купить компьютерную швейную машинку. Для этой цели она просит кредит, поскольку собственного сбережения не хватает. Она надеется на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Shabnam is a 20-year-old young woman who self-sufficiently makes her own living. Four years ago, after learning the sewing profession from her uncle's wife, she opened her own sewing business. Shabnam is from the city of Kulob. She lives there with her mother, two brothers, her uncle and his wife, who is an experienced seamstress. She sews quickly and skillfully. Additionally, she already learned how to do embroidery on dresses. Now, in order to take more orders for her services, she needs to buy a computerized sewing machine. For this reason, she is requesting a loan because her personal savings are not enough for the purchase.  She relies on your support.

loans.use: to buy a computerized sewing machine.

loans.name: Martin's Group

texts.en:
Martin is a member of this group in the Lugari District. He is pictured here in a group of 5 One Acre Fund group leader farmers. The group leaders represent a total of 52 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here. Martin has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with his hand raised. He and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet. Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.

Martin is married and has six children. He is 49 years old and is known as an experienced farmer. He is active in his community in groups, such as the prayer group and burial committee. Martin has been a farmer for 30 years. Martin described his harvest as excellent last year, but believes he can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.

Martin first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2013 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 long rains season. Martin joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, to learn new farming methods, and to get fertilizer and hybrid seeds. He also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he likes being a leader, and wants to help more farmers. Martin plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send children to school, to buy a cow, and to invest in a business. He notes that working with One Acre Fund has lead to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers. Martin’s own life was improved because he has more profits, training, and group support. He was also able to save money and feed the family.

Martin and his group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests. One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Enock

texts.en:
Enock comes from Nyakabungo, Sigirira in Ibanda district. Enock is 55 years old, married, and has eight children. He is an agriculturalist who primarily raises cattle and goats. He owns 22 cows (10 for milk and 12 for fattening) and 20 goats. Enock also does agriculture on a large scale to supplement his income from the fattening work. He has managed to look after his family and also pay the school fees for his three daughters at the University.
  
Enock is applying for a loan of 2,000,000 UGX to buy more bulls for fattening and to dig a dam to store water. He needs the water for his animals in order to mitigate the lack of water during the drought. Enock’s major challenges are inadequate water supplies in his region and the dry season, which leads to a shortage of pastures for his animals. Without enough pasture, his cattle die. His dream is to own one of the largest farms in his region and to produce 200 liters of milk a day. Enock is an honest and hard-working man.

loans.use: To buy baby bulls for fattening and to dig a dam to store water

loans.name: Hercilia

texts.es: Hercilia de 65 años de edad es muy amable y trabajadora, vive con su esposo y sus siete hijos, Ella trabaja muy duro en su propia parcela donde siembra maiz y frijol; sus productos son de muy buena calidad comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que estan cerca de su lugar de residencia. Hercilia solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL para contar con el dinero necesario e invertir en la compra de insumos agrícolas como controles de plaga, fertilizantes, abonos, semillas entre otras cosas que necesita para su siembra y también mejorar el terreno donde desea hacer su siembra que es el que muestra la fotografía, ella ansía aumentar sus ventas para poder percibir mayores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en:
Hercilia is 65 and is very friendly and hard-working. She lives with her husband and their seven children. She works very hard on her own plot of land, where she sows maize and beans. Her produce is of very good quality, and she sells it in the different markets near her home.

Hercilia is asking for a loan through Integral to have the necessary money to invest in buying agricultural supplies like items to control blight, such as fertilisers, manure and seeds that she needs for sowing, and also to improve the land where she intends to sow, shown in the photo. She is eager to increase sales so she can earn more money and provide her family with greater economic stability.

loans.use: to buy items to control blight, such as fertilisers, manure and seeds, and to improve her land.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is a 35-year-old woman, a widow with three children, aged 12, 8 and 4 years old, whom she supports. 

This is her third loan of KES 90,000. She was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by the VisionFund officer. She has a café, and her business is located at Gongoni. She has been in this business for ten years, and she earns a monthly income of KES 18,000.

She is planning to use the loan to purchase more furniture and foodstuff for her business. She will use the profit to expand the business. 

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to open a restaurant and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more furniture and foodstuff for her business.

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima Group

texts.es:
Virgen de Fatima  se formó en la ciudad de Itá con la unión de varias vecinas y amigas de esa ciudad. Ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza  donde por medio de ella podrán conocer la situación en la que se encuentran todas y conforme a ello poder trabajar por mejorar.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Virginia, quien es una persona por sobre todo muy entusiasta que está luchando por salir adelante y mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Se dedica a ser manicurista, trabajo con el cual ayuda a su familia generando un poco de ingresos. Comenta que todo lo que hace es por sus seres queridos, ya que no quiere que pasen por necesidades. Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de esmaltes, limas, alicates y demás insumos que le servirán para poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo, luchando por un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
The Virgen de Fatima group was formed in the city of Itá by the joining together of a number of friends and neighbors.  They are participating in the Poverty Elimination Survey in order to understand each one's situation and use that knowledge to work toward improvement.  

One of the members is Virginia, who is, above all, really excited to be fighting to succeed and improve her quality of life. She earns her living as a manicurist and works to help the family by bringing in a bit of income.  She says that everything she does is for her loved-ones because she doesn't want them to go without necessities.  She is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of nail polish, files, clippers and all the other supplies she needs to continue on with her work just like she's been doing, fighting for a better future.

loans.use: to buy nail polish, files, clippers and other supplies.

loans.name: Olga Del Carmen

texts.es: Olga de 43 años de edad, reside en casa propia con sus tres hijos. Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de ricas pupusas. Día a día se levanta muy temprano para ir al mercado y tener frescos y listos los ingredientes que le permiten hacer sus deliciosas pupusas. Tiene mucha clientela ya que cuando de pupusas se trata ella tiene las mejores y con los precios más accesibles.  Ha decidido hacer este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su negocio ya que su sueño es verlo crecer de manera que pueda así mejorar su calidad de vida. Piensa invertir en la materia prima necesaria como: maíz, arroz, chicharron, queso, frijoles, tomates, repollo, etc. de esta manera espera lograr su sueño y poder dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Olga, 43 years old, lives in her own house with her three children. She works in the production and sale of delicious "pupusas" (stuffed tortillas). Day by day she gets up very early to go to the market and have fresh and ready the ingredients that allow her to make her delicious pupusas. She has a lot of customers since she has, regarding pupusas, the best ones, and the best prices. She has decided to request a loan from INTEGRAL to invest in her business, because her dream is to see it grow and in this way to improve her quality of life. She plans to invest in the necessary raw materials like: corn, rice, pork rind, cheese, beans, tomatoes, cabbage, etc. and in this way she hopes to achieve her dream and be able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn, rice, pork rinds, cheese, beans, tomatoes, cabbage, etc.

loans.name: Floride

texts.en:
Floride is 66 years old and widowed. She owns a mini-supermarket where she sells various snacks and beverages. 

With the loan, Floride will buy more snacks to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy a cow to provide milk for the entire family for better feeding.

loans.use: to buy more snacks to sell.

loans.name: Speciose

texts.en:
Speciose is 35 years old. She is married, with three children aged between two and ten. She owns a boutique and has been in the business for the past seven years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more retail items to sell, such as lotions, soaps, sugar, and salt. She plans to use the profits to be obtained from the business for reinvestment in the same boutique business.

loans.use: to buy more retail items to sell, such as lotions, soaps, ans sugar.

loans.name: Moses' Group

texts.en:
Moses is a member of this group in the Lugari District. He is pictured here in a group of five One Acre Fund group leader farmers. The group leaders represent a total of 62 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here. Moses has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with his hand raised. He and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet. Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet, and sorghum cultivation.							

Moses is married and has two children. He is 46 years old and is known as a friendly and experienced farmer. He is active in his community in groups such as the men's group, savings group, prayer group, and burial committee. Moses has been a farmer for 24 years. He described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.  	

Moses first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2013 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season. He joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices and learn new farming methods to earn enough to feed his family and send his children to school. He also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he likes being a leader.  

Moses plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school and repair his home. He notes that working with One Acre Fund has lead to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers. Moses ’s own life was improved because he has more profits from harvest, more farm training, and more farm group support. He was able to save money and feed his family.  							

Moses and his group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests. One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings on to the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits, and improved lives.							

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Limpai

texts.en:
Limpai is 45 years old. He is married and a father of six children aged between 3 and 15 years old. He has been farming on his own piece of land for the last three years. 

He learned about VisionFund Kenya from staff. This will be his third loan after successfully paying back the previous loans. He plans to spend the loan amount to prepare his land and to buy chemicals and fertilizer for his wheat farm. Because of the climate conditions and fertile soil, wheat has proved to do very well. Also, the market is readily available in the area for both retail and wholesale buyers.

Limpai hopes to use the profits from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activity from small-scale to commercial farming. His dream is to do large-scale farming and to have his own farm machinery. He is a diligent man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Magret's Group

texts.en:
Magret is a member of this group in the Lugari District. She is pictured here in a group of five One Acre Fund group leader farmers. The group leaders represent a total of 54 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here. Magret has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with her hand raised. She and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet, and sorghum cultivation.							

Magret is married and has five children. She is 47 years old and is known as hardworking. She is active in her community in groups such as the women's group and prayer group. She has been a farmer for 20 years. She described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.  							

Magret first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2013 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season. She joined One Acre Fund in order to earn enough to feed her family. She also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because she is an active community member. Magret plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school. She notes that working with One Acre Fund has lead to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers. Magret’s own life was improved because she was able to feed the family.  							

Magret and her group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests. One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits, and improved lives.							

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Aracema Madilia

texts.es: Aracema de 52 años de edad  posee un negocio de venta de todo tipo de productos de uso personal como lociones, desodorantes, canchos para el cabello, perfumes, también ropa para damas y caballeros entre otras cosas, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su familia, la clienta desea acrecentar su negocio por eso solicita un credito que le permita poder comprar todo lo necesario como: perfumes, esmaltes para uñas, desodorantes, cremas, lociones, ropa por mayor  ya que tiene mucha clientela por dar sus productos a precios accesibles con la ayuda solicitada ella podra obtener mejores ganancias y asi seguira dandole a su familia lo que necesita sin limitacion alguna.
texts.en: Aracema is 52 years old and has a business selling all kinds of personal care products, like lotion, deodorant, hairpins, perfume and clothing for men and women, among other things. Her business is located in her home, and with the income she earns from her sales she is able to cover her household expenses. She lives in her own home with her family. She wants to grow her business, which is why she is requesting a loan that will allow her to buy everything she needs, such as perfume, nail polish, deodorant, cream, lotion, and bulk clothing. She has many clients, since she offers her wares at accessible prices. With the requested loan, she will be able to earn more profits and continue to give her family everything they need without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, nail polish, deodorant, lotion, and bulk clothing

loans.name: Simon's Group

texts.en:
Simon is a member of this group in the Lugari District. He is pictured here in a group of five One Acre Fund group leader farmers. The group leaders represent a total of 52 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here. Simon has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with his hand raised. He and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet, and sorghum cultivation.							

Simon is married and has six children. He is 36 years old and is known as hardworking. He is active in his community in groups such as the men's group. Simon has been a farmer for 12 years. He describes his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.  							

Simon first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2013 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season. He joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, learn new farming methods, and get fertilizer and hybrid seeds. He also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he likes being a leader. Simon plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school and save for the future. He notes that working with One Acre Fund has lead to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers. Simon’s own life was improved because he has more profits from harvest and has more farm group support.  							

Simon and his group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests. One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits, and improved lives.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Silia

texts.en: Silia is 40 years old and married with 5 children. She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as twistes, donuts,german buns soups and etc. She has been doing this for 3 years. Silia needs a loan to buy goods such as tin fish, chicken leg quarters, snacks, drinks to restock her shop, school fees and uniforms for her kids. She hopes to use her profits to expand her business in the future . She became a member of SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy goods such as tin fish, chicken leg quarters, snacks, drinks, school fees and uniforms

loans.name: Malama

texts.en: Malama is 36 years old with 3 children. She runs a small business selling meat buns in her community and has been doing this for 2 years. Malama has requested a loan to buy chicken leg quarters, mutton flaps, onion, garlic onion, soya, flour, cooking oil, plastic bags, steamer pot. She has re-joined SPBD this year to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Malama plans to have a store in the future by saving more money in her savings account.

loans.use: to buy chicken leg quarters, mutton flaps, onion, garlic onion, soya, flour, cooking oil, plastic bags, steamer pot

loans.name: Viviana Andrea

texts.es:
Ella es Viviana Andrea, se encuentra estudiando actualmente auxiliar administrativo en salud en campo alto segundo fuera de y hace aproximadamente dos años se encuentra viviendo en la ciudad de bogota, la familia conformada por el padre Demetrio de 48 años de edad, la madre Maria  Luisa de 44 años de edad, los hermanos Tatiana, Jose y  Diana  todos menores de edad, ellos están en un pueblo fuera de bogota, los padres no tienen suficientes recursos económicos para ayudar en los estudios a la hija  Viviana Andrea  además ellos son agricultores y no están pasando por el  mejor momento. 
Así que la joven Viviana Andrea se encuentra totalmente sola en la ciudad de bogota, pagando arriendo y en una mala situación económica, por este motivo quiere tener el subsidio de kiva, que sería el  apoyo para poder continuar en los estudios, ya que ella es muy responsable, inteligente, honesta, colaboradora y con muchas cualidades más que la hacen merecedora de esta ayuda. 
Ella desea seguirse preparando aunque no cuente con el apoyo de la familia y teniendo en cuenta que ella en este momento no está pasando por el mejor momento económico, ya que el sueldo no es suficiente para cubrir todas las  necesidades  y hasta el momento no se ha  podido matricular para el segundo semestre por falta de dinero  como se comento  anterior mente, ella desea continuar los estudios y después de terminar el auxiliar administrativo en salud va a sacar un crédito en el  ICETEX para culminar los estudios superiores, ya que ella desea ser una gran gerente hospitalaria  y que está totalmente enamorada de esta profesión y tiene muchas aspiraciones, en conclusión ella quiere ser la mejor ya que tiene muchas propuestas para mejorar el servicio de salud, teniendo en cuenta las nuevas reformas en salud, todo pensando en la satisfacción de los usuarios.
texts.en:
This is Viviana Andrea, who is currently studying to be a health administration assistant at Campo Alto. About two years ago she found herself living in the city of Bogota. Her family, which consists of her father Demetrio aged 48, her mother Maria Luisa aged 44 and her younger brothers and sisters Tatiana, Jose and Diana, all live in a town outside Bogota. 

Viviana Andrea's parents don't have enough money to help her in her studies since they are farmers and are going through a difficult time. So Viviana Andrea is a young lady who finds herself all alone in the city of Bogota, paying rent and in a difficult financial situation. 

This is why she wants to have help from Kiva, which would give her support to be able to continue with her studies. She is very responsible, intelligent, honest and helpful and has lots of other qualities which make her worthy of this help. She wants to continue her education even though she does not have any support from her family and bearing in mind that she is not having a very good time financially at the moment, as her salary is not enough to cover all her needs. 

At present she has not been able to  sign up for the second term because of a lack of funds. As already mentioned, she wants to continue with her studies and when she finishes her health administration assistant studies she is going to take out a loan from ICETEX to finish the higher level studies, as she wants to be a senior hospital manager. She is totally captivated by this profession and has a lot of ambition. 

In conclusion, she wants to be the best as she has lots of ideas for improving the health service, taking into account the new health reforms, always thinking about the satisfaction of the service users.

loans.use: to pay for a term's tuition fees.

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en: Alphonsine is 46 years old. She is a mother of five children between 9 and 25 years old. She sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for the past 20 years. She would like to get a loan to buy more foodstuffs such as beans, cassava, and sorghum to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs such as beans, cassava and sorghum for sale.

loans.name: Baloon Bay Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of three women who are part of the Baloon Bay Group and are very ready to develop their money-earning businesses. For several years, they've all been living in the same area and they maintain good relationships. Their main business is selling cooking items, second hand clothing and selling water. 

Diana is the featured borrower and the leader of the group. She's the woman standing on the right in the photograph. She's a very energetic married woman who has her two children in her care. She buys water from the distributors and she intends to sell it to her neighbors. She has a very large base of clients because water is a very scares commodity in Accra. 

With her new loan, she intends to buy GHS 1,800 worth of water and to sell to her customers.

She intends to use her profits to improve the standard of living of her family and ensure that her children get a better education.

The group will need a total amount of GHS 3,000 to maintain their businesses at this level.

loans.use: To buy water to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Siala

texts.en: Siala is a 25 year old married woman with 3 children. She has a small plantation and grows taro and banana trees to earn a living. She has been doing this for 3 years. Siala has requested a loan to buy wheel barrow, mistblower, digging tool, shovel, chemicals, fertilisers, knives.She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. With her profits, Siala hopes to extend her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy wheel barrow, mistblower, digging tool, shovel, chemicals, fertilisers, knives

loans.name: Mayra Yanira

texts.es: Mayra de 30 años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos, desde hace 2 años decidió poner un negocio en su lugar de residencia, posee una ferretería tiene muchos clientes por la variedad de productos que comercializa, por la calidad y los buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gatso que se le presentan en su hogar, Mayra esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas productos por mayor como: focos, clavos, tornillos, pegamentos, pinturas, cementos, etc, y asi podrá atender mejor a sus clientes tendrá buenas ganancias y le dara a du familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Mayra is 30 years old and lives with her partner and two children, and two years ago decided to set up a business in her home. She owns a hardware store and has many customers because of the variety of products she sells, the quality, and good prices. What she makes through her sales allows her to pay the household expenses. Mayra is requesting a loan to purchase more products wholesale such as: light bulbs, nails, screws, adhesives, paint, cement, etc, and in that way provide better service to her customers and make good profits to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase wholesale light bulbs, nails, screws, adhesives, paint, cement, etc,

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is thankful for the good work the Kiva lenders are doing in contributing to his previous loan. He is also grateful to Kiva for the good services UGAFODE renders the community. Being a disabled person, John is usually marginalized but it was a different case with UGAFODE. He was, therefore, able to fertilize his coffee plantation, which is having a positive effect on the growth of his coffee plants and beans. He anticipates a bumper harvest this season. He also deals in cattle fattening and milking as a secondary source of income. He owns 20 cows, the majority of which are for milk. Through the income he earned from the milk, John has managed to look after his large family by providing them with medication, paying school fees for his eight school-going children and constructing a permanent house for the family.

John is applying for al loan of 2,000,000 UGX to buy more cows to increase his milk production and to buy drugs for his sick cows. His major challenges are the increase in school fees for his school-going children, the dry season, which leads to inadequate grass to feed his animals, and the lack of water due to the prolonged dry season, which leads to a decrease in the milk supply.

His dream is to see all his children attend school. John is honest and hard working.

loans.use: To buy cows

loans.name: Nika

texts.en: Nika is a 44 year old married woman with 5 children. She has a small plantation and grows taro plants to earn a living. She has been doing this for 3 years. Nika has requested a loan to buy wheelbarrow, fertilisers, mistblower, knives, knife sharpner for her business.She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. With her profits, Nika hopes to reinvest it in her business and provide essentials for her kids school needs.

loans.use: to buy wheelbarrow, fertilisers, mistblower, knives, knife sharpner

loans.name: Burazio

texts.en:
Burazio comes from Katembe, Rwobuzizi in Ibanda district. He is 49 years and married with eight children and two dependents who are his parents  who are too old to stay alone. He deals in cattle fattening and milking as his major source of income. He owns 32 cows for milk production. Through income he earned from milk, Burazio has managed to look after his family and his parents by providing them with medication, paying school fees for his six school-going children and constructing a permanent house for the family.

Burazio is applying for al loan of 2,000,000 UGX to buy more cows to increase his milk production and buy drugs for his sick cows.

His major challenge is the dry season, which leads to inadequate grass to feed his animals, and the lack of water due to the prolonged drought, which leads to a decrease in milk supply.

His dream is to own a milk cooling plant in his region. Burazio is honest and hard working.

loans.use: To buy cows

loans.name: Ephantus

texts.en:
Ephantus is 69 years old, from Nakuru. He is married to Teresia and they are blessed with five children, aged 20, 14, 12, 10 and six years old.

Ephantus is a farmer and he has been farming for the last 30 years. 

To enable him to buy a motorcycle, which will be used by his son to carry passengers for a fee, thereby increasing the family's income, he has applied for his first loan from VisionFund Kenya, in the amount of KES 100,000.

Ephantus' monthly income right now is KES 20,000 and he intends to use the anticipated profits from his expanded business to pay his loan back to VisionFund Kenya and to educate his children. 

Ephantus hopes to be a successful farmer in the future.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for his son to use in transportation of passengers for a fee, so as to increase his family's income.

loans.name: Margaret's Group

texts.en:
Margaret is a member of this group in Lugari District.  She is pictured here in a group of five One Acre Fund group leader farmers.
