The group leaders represent a total of 53 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here.  Margaret has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with her hand raised.  She and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving seeds and fertilizer to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.							

Margaret is married and has five children. She is 47 years old and is known as friendly, hardworking, trustworthy, and an experienced farmer.  She is active in her community in groups such as the women's group and the prayer group.  Margaret has been a farmer for 29 years.  Margaret described her harvest as poor last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. 

					
Margaret first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2013 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season.  Margaret joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, get new farming methods, get fertilizer and hybrid seeds and earn enough to feed her family.  She also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because she is an active community member and wants to help more farmers by spreading the story about One Acre Fund farmers.  Margaret plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school and buy a cow.  She notes that working with One Acre Fund has led to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers.  Margaret’s own life was improved because she has more farm training and has more farm group support.  					

	
Margaret and her group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.  One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.							

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Matauaina

texts.en:
Matauaina is 19 year old married woman with 1 child. She has a small garden where she grows cucumbers, tomatoes and other vegetables that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 2 years. Matauaina needs a loan to buy tools, fertilizer and vegetable seeds for her business. 
She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. Matauaina will use the profits from her sales to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy gardening tools, such as shovels, spade, knives, mistblower, fertilizer, vegetable seeds.

loans.name: James' Group

texts.en:
James is a member of James' Group in Lugari District. He is pictured here in a group of three One Acre Fund group leader farmers. The group leaders represent a total of 38 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here. James has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right, with his hand raised. The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo. 

James and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet. Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of KES 5,349 (shillings) for maize, millet, and sorghum cultivation.							

James is married and has 15 children. He is 60 years old and is known as friendly, hardworking, trustworthy, and an experienced farmer. He is active in his community, in groups such as the men's group and prayer group. James has been a farmer for 34 years. He described his harvest as excellent last year, but believes he can have an even better one this year, by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.  	

James first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2012 and he is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season. James joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, get new farming methods, and earn enough money to feed his family and send his children to school. He also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he is an active community member and he wants to help more farmers by spreading the story about One Acre Fund farmers.  

James plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school. He notes that working with One Acre Fund has led to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers. His own life was improved because he has more profits from harvest, has more farm training, has more farm group support, was able to save money, and was able to feed the family.  							

James and his group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers, through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.  

One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  

With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits, and improved lives.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Las Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
El comité se llama Las Luchadoras, donde las 17 integrantes de este grupo son mujeres luchadoras, que con gran esfuerzo trabajan por salir adelante.
Petrona es parte de este grupo, ella es vendedora ambulante, y tiene a la venta todo tipo de productos, como ser ropas, calzados, camisas y demás. Tiene muchas zonas donde hace sus ventas y ya tiene una clientela bien formada, a quienes ofrece siempre una buena calidad.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar jeans, camisas, calzados y demás productos, con lo cual podrá seguir con sus ventas, luchando para poder ayudar a su familia con su trabajo.
texts.en:
The communal bank is named Las Luchadoras [The Determined Women], where the 17 members of this group are determined women, who work with great effort to get ahead. 

Petrona, who is a street vendor, is part of this group. She sells all types of products such as clothing, footwear, shirts and more. She has many areas where she makes sales and now has a well established clientèle, to whom she always offers high quality. She is requesting this loan in order to purchase jeans, shirts, footwear and other products, with which she can continue with her sales, struggling to be able to help her family through her work.

loans.use: to purchase jeans, shirts, footwear and other products for sale.

loans.name: Roselyne's Group

texts.en:
Roselyne is a member of this group in Lugari District.  She is pictured here in a group of four One Acre Fund group leader farmers. The group leaders represent a total of 85 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here. Roselyne has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with her hand raised. She and the other farmers represented by this group are each receiving one-quarter acre of maize and one-quarter acre of sorghum or millet. Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 KES for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.							

Roselyne is 44 years old and has been a farmer for 10 years. Roselyne works as a farmer to provide for her five children. The community and other farmers know Roselyne as friendly, hardworking and reliable. Other than farming, she is also involved in her community in other ways, such as the women's group and prayer group. Roselyne describes her harvest last year as good, but hopes she can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in her group.							

Roselyne joined One Acre Fund in 2013, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2014 season as a group leader. Roselyne joined One Acre Fund so that she could get fertilizer and hybrid seeds. Roselyne has gotten more involved with One Acre Fund as a group leader and Kiva representative. Working with One Acre Fund has improved Roselyne's life because she is able to feed the family. In the future, Roselyne hopes that her profits from 2014 can be used to send children to school and to buy a cow.  	

One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya. The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers. Roselyne and her group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund continues providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.	

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left.

loans.use: to support farmers in purchasing hybrid seeds and fertilizer to increase better harvests of maize, millet and sorghum.

loans.name: Frederick

texts.en: Frederick is 30 years old. He is married with three children aged between four and five, all of whom go to school. He owns a boutique and has been running it for the past one year. With this loan, he would like to buy more soap and sugar for resale. The profits from the business will be used to pay for the childrens' school fees.

loans.use: to buy more soap and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Alice's Group

texts.en:
This group consists of six group leader farmers in Lugari District, with Alice selected as the Kiva representative. Alice has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and is on the right of the photo with her hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to her and the 86 other individual farmers represented by this group. The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant one-quarter acre of maize and one-quarter acre of millet or sorghum.  The individual farmers are not pictured here, but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 KES each.	

Alice is 51 years old and has been a farmer for 18 year. She works as a farmer to provide for her four children. The community and other farmers know Alice as hardworking and trustworthy, and an experienced farmer. Other than farming, she is also involved in her community in other ways, such as the women's group, savings group, prayer group and burial committee. Alice describes her harvest last year as not with One Acre Fund, but hopes she can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in her group.

Alice joined One Acre Fund in 2013, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2014 season as a group leader. Alice joined One Acre Fund so that she could learn new farming methods, get the best seed prices, and get fertilizer and hybrid seeds. Because she likes being a leader and wants to help more farmers, Alice has gotten more involved with One Acre Fund as a group leader and Kiva representative. In the future, Alice hopes that her profits from 2014 can be used to send her children to school, to save for the future and to buy a goat.  							

One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya. The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers.  Alice and her group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund continues providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.		

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet and sorghum.

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es: María tiene 53 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y dos sobrinos. María se dedica a la prestación de servicios domésticos  y es una mujer muy trabajadora, responsable y visionaria. María solicita este crédito a FUSAI dado que desea apoyar a su familia para terminar de construir la vivienda que por falta de recursos no han podido terminar. Con el monto solicitado comprará cemento, arena y ladrillo. Espera poder contar con  este financiamiento dado que desea terminar  la vivienda antes de que el invierno llegue.
texts.en:
María is 53 years of age and lives in her own house along with her husband and two nephews. María makes a living by providing domestic services and is a very hard-working, responsible and visionary woman. 

María is requesting this loan from FUSAI as she wishes to support her family in finishing the construction of the house that they have been unable to finish due to lack of resources. With the requested amount she will purchase cement, sand and bricks. She hopes to be able to count on this funding as she wishes to finish the house before the winter arrives.

loans.use: to purchase: cement, sand and bricks to finish the construction of the house.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en: Nilda is a 46-year-old married woman from the town of Loon, Bohol. She operates a sari-sari store for a living. She sells vinegar, shampoo, bath soap, detergent, coffee, canned goods and toiletries. She has requested a loan to buy more items to sell like chips, coffee, sugar, cooking oil, canned goods and toiletries. Nilda hopes that someday she can save enough for her future needs as well as expand her business.

loans.use: to buy chips, coffee, sugar, cooking oil, canned goods and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Beatrice's Group

texts.en:
Beatrice is a member of Beatrice's Group in Lugari District. She is pictured here in a group of seven One Acre Fund group leader farmers. The group leaders represent a total of 62 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here. Beatrice has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with her hand raised. The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

Beatrice and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet. Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of KES 5,349 (shillings) for maize, millet, and sorghum cultivation.							

Beatrice is married and has six children. She is 51 years old and is known as friendly, hard-working, and a reliable farmer. She is active in her community, in groups such as the women's group and prayer group. Beatrice has been a farmer for 27 years. She described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have an even better one this year, by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.  			

Beatrice first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2013 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season. She joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices and new farming methods. She also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because she is an active community member and wants to spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers.  

Beatrice plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school, repair the home, and save for the future. She notes that working with One Acre Fund has led to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers. Her own life was improved because she has more profits from harvest, has more farm training, and was able to feed the family.  							

Beatrice and her group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.  

One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  

With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits, and improved lives.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Rosemary's Group

texts.en:
Rosemary is a member of this group in Lugari District. She is pictured here in a group of five One Acre Fund group leader farmers. The group leaders represent a total of 86 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here. Rosemary has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with her hand raised. She and the other farmers represented by this group are each receiving one-quarter acre of maize and one-quarter acre of sorghum or millet. Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 KES for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.							

Rosemary is 48 years old and has been a farmer for 10 years. She works as a farmer to provide for her five children. The community and other farmers know Rosemary as friendly, hardworking, reliable, trustworthy and an experienced farmer. Other than farming, she is also involved in her community in other ways, such as the women's group and savings group.  				

Rosemary first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2013 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season. Rosemary joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, to learn new farming methods and earn enough to feed the family. She also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because she is an active community member and wants to help more farmers. Rosemary plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school, repair the home, and save for the future. She notes that working with One Acre Fund has led to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers.  

One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya. The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers. Rosemary and her group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund continues providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.							

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet and sorghum.

loans.name: Simon's Group

texts.en:
Simon is a member of this group in Lugari District.  He is pictured here in a group of 9 One Acre Fund group leader farmers.  The group leaders represent a total of 93 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here.  Simon has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with his hand raised.  He and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.							

Simon is a reliable member of the community.  He is married with 1 child.  Simon is 45 years old and has been working as a farmer for the last 7 years to support his family.  In addition to this, Simon is very active in his community and is involved in the men's group, prayer group, and burial committee.  He described his harvest last year as good.  He hopes to continue working with One Acre Fund and to continue the success he is having with the One Acre Fund farm packages.					

Simon joined One Acre Fund in 2012, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2014 season as a group leader.  Simon joined One Acre Fund so that he could get the best seed prices, new farming methods, fertilizer and hybrid seeds.  Because he likes being a leader, and is an active community member and wants to help more farmers, Simon has gotten more involved with One Acre Fund as a group leader and Kiva representative.  Working with One Acre Fund has improved Simon's life because he has more farm training, more profits from harvest, more farm group support, and was able to feed his family.  In the future, Simon hopes that his profits from 2014 can be used to send his children to school and buy a cow.  			

One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya.  The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings on to the farmers.  Simon and his group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund continues providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.		

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To support farmers in purchasing hybrid seeds and fertilizer to increase better harvests of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es: Victor de 40 años de edad vive junto a su familia en casa propia; el se dedica a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de maíz y maicillo, tiene muchos años de trabajar en este rubro y se ha hecho de experiencia muy valiosa que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas , el terreno de cultivo está ubicado en una zona de incidencia agrícola, el comercia en todas las zonas aledañas y ya tiene mucha clientela fija, estas personas siempre prefieren su producto pues es de calidad y a precios realmente accesibles además el servicio es inigualable, quiere aprovechar el auge de su negocio para aumentar la producción y así poder tener mejores ganancias, necesita invertir en insumos pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semillas, abono, insecticida, fertilizantes, controles de plagas, herramienta, etc. el tiene buenas referencias de pago y está seguro que podrá saldar su deuda a tiempo, y a la vez tiene la confianza que podrá darle a su familia la vida que se merecen sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Victor is forty years old and lives with his family in his own home. He works as a farmer, specifically growing corn and sorghum. He has been in this line of work for many years and has gained lots of valuable experience, which allows him to obtain the best harvests. His land is located in a highly agricultural area. He sells his crops in all the surrounding areas and already has many regular customers, people who always prefer his products because of their quality and his really affordable prices. His level of service is also unmatched. 

He wants to make the most of the boom his business is experiencing and increase production so that he can earn more profit. He needs to invest in supplies but needs capital, which is why he is requesting a loan from Integral that will allow him to buy seeds, fertilizer, insecticide, pesticide, tools, etc. He has good credit references and is positive that he will be able to pay off his debt on time. He is also confident that he will be able to give his family the life they deserve without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, insecticide, pesticide, tools, etc.

loans.name: Josias

texts.en: Josias comes from the Nyabikamba Ruhunga Kicheche Kamwenge district. He is single with no children. He is a motorcycle (boda boda) rider where he earns income to look after his aged father. He has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 UGX to buy a new motorcycle to help him improve his business and increase his income, because the bike he has been riding is not his. Josias hopes to build a permanent house for his family. He is hardworking and honest.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Andrew's Group

texts.en:
Andrew is a member of this group in the Lugari District.  He is pictured here in a group of 7 One Acre Fund group leader farmers.  The group leaders represent a total of 66 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here.  Andrew has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with his hand raised.  He and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.							

Andrew is 65 years old and has been a farmer for 9 years.  Andrew works as a farmer to provide for his 4 children.  The community and other farmers know Andrew as friendly, hardworking, trustworthy and an experienced farmer.  Other than farming, he is also involved in his community men's group, savings group, prayer group, and burial committee.  Andrew described his harvest last year as good, but hopes he can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in his group.

The 2014 Long Rains season won’t be Andrew’s first season with One Acre Fund.  He first joined One Acre Fund in 2013 and has continued working with One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, and learn new farming methods.  As an active member in his community, Andrew also chose to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he is an active community member who wants to spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers.  Andrew plans on using future profits from the harvest to send his children to school, repair their home and save for the future.  His life has improved by working with One Acre Fund because he has more profit from harvest, farm training and farm group support. He has also been able to save money and  feed his family.							

One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya.  The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings on to the farmers.  Andrew and his group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund continues providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.			

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds for maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Elyse

texts.en: Elyse is 27 years old. She is married with two children. She owns a restaurant and has been in this business for one year. With the loan, she would like to buy more food items for use in the restaurant such as vegetables, drinks, and food for cooking in order to sell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for sale in her restaurant.

loans.name: Walter Edgardo

texts.es: Walter de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el se dedica desde hace varios años a la agricultura su principal siembra es el maiz y frijol, comercializa en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra solventar algunos gastos del hogar, Walter esta solicitando un credito para a compra de insumos agricolas como: fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, semillas, etc. para poder continuar con sus cosechas y asi poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Walter is 45 years old and lives in his own house with his family. He has worked for several years in agriculture, his principal crops being corn and beans. He sells in the surroundings of the area in which he lives, and with what he obtains from his earnings he manages to cover some of the household expenses. 

Walter is asking for a loan to buy agricultural supplies such as: fertilizers, manure, pesticides, herbicides, seeds, etc. in order to be able to continue with his harvests and therefore be able to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure, pesticides, herbicides, seeds, etc.

loans.name: San Francisco Group

texts.es:
“San Francisco” es un grupo que se formó en la ciudad de Asunción, es un comité nuevo que está en su ciclo número 1º del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. 
Una de ellas es la Sra. Josefina, quien se dedica a la venta de bebidas varias, y que le está yendo muy bien, en especial los fines de semana es cuando más ventas tiene. Ella es muy luchadora, que con sacrificio está mejorando su vida. Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de bebidas varias, como ser gaseosas, cervezas, vinos, y demás. Agradece por esta ayuda que está recibiendo.
texts.en:
“San Francisco” is a group which was founded in the city of Asunción. It is a new communal bank that is requesting it's first loan from the women's communal bank program, where everyone works and helps each other to move forward. 

One of them is Sra. Josefina, who works selling various drinks, which is going very well for her, especially at the weekends, when she sells the most. She is very determined, and through sacrifices is improving her life. She is asking for this loan so that she can invest it in the purchase of various drinks, such as fizzy drinks, beers, wines and others. She is grateful for the help that she is receiving.

loans.use: to buy various drinks, such as fizzy drinks, beers, wines and others.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To clean his two plots of cacao trees

loans.name: Jose Misael

texts.es: Jose se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años y eso le ha dado la capacidad y el conocimiento necesario para asistir sus cultivos, su principal siembra es el maíz y frijol, comercializa sus cultivos en agencias de compra-venta de granos básicos que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas ayuda en los gastos que su familia tiene, vive en casa propia con su esposa, cuando pasa la temporada agrícola el cliente se dedica a trabajar  como motorista de un camión de carga, el esta solicitando un crédito para poder comparar insumos agrícolas que le ayuden en la siembra de sus cultivos como: abonos, semillas, fertilizantes y asi poder tener mejores ganancias y seguir solventando los gastos de su casa sin ninguna limitación.
texts.en:
Jose has been farming for a number of years, and this has given him the skills and knowledge he needs to tend to his crops.  His main crops are corn and beans.  He sells his crops to the staple grain wholesalers who are close to his home.  With the earnings he gets from his sales, he helps with the family's expenses.  He lives in his own house with his wife.  When the growing season is over, he works as a truck driver.  

Jose is requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies that will help him with his crops, such as organic and chemical fertilizers and seeds.  This way, he can increase his earnings and continue to cover the household expenses without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy organic and chemical fertilizers, seeds, etc.

loans.name: Las Buenas Esposas Group

texts.es: Dirigido por el señor Olivero con 36 años de edad soltero, con dos hijos de edades 1 y 7 años se dedica a reparar bicicletas y venta de repuestos posee un trabajador quien es su principal ayuda,  tiene tres años de  brindar este servicio en su comunidad, con el préstamo piensa invertir principalmente en repuestos, de automóviles y bicicleta como pide vías, rines, llantas de bicicletas, manubrios, frenos de bicicletas, asientos, neumáticos etc. porque es lo que más demanda la población. El grupo se encuentra integrado por 5 socias más, la primera la señora Conny con 36 años la cual posee una pulpería en su domicilio,  la socia Xiomara 31 años vende cosméticos AVON y fines de semana vende comida, la  señora Cenelia con 37 años vende  fritanga los fines de semana en su casa, la  socia Yamileth 37 años vende truchas (Pinturas de uña, colas, pirañas, etc.) y por último socia Lilliam posee una pulpería y una moto taxis brinda servicio a la población y tiene  56 años de edad.
texts.en:
This group is led by Olivero, 36. He is single with two children aged 1 and 7 years. He earns his living repairing bicycles and selling spare parts. He employs a worker who is his main support in his business. He has had this business providing this service in his community for 3 years. He intends to invest the loan primarily in bicycle and automobile parts as requested such as auto and bicycle rims, handlebars, brakes, seats, tires, and more because these are the parts that most people demand. 

The group is composed of five members again. The first woman, Conny, is 36 years old and has a grocery store in her home. Xiomara, 31, sells AVON cosmetics and prepares fast food to sell on the weekends. Cenelia, 37, sells fried foods on the weekends from her home. Yamileth, 37, sells accessories such as nail polish, hair ties, and hair clips. Finally, Lillian, 56, owns a grocery store and a motorcycle taxi service.

loans.use: to invest in auto and bicycle parts.

loans.name: Bergelina Elizabeth

texts.es: Bergelina de 43 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 12  años siembra frijol y maiz y con las ventas que realiza de sus cosechas logra solventar los gastos que tiene en su hogar, es una mujer muy responsable, honesta y trabajadora vive con su esposo y sus cinco  hijos en casa propia. Bergelina está solicitando un credito para poder comprar insumos para su cosecha como: herbicidas, abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, etc. ya que con lo que gana no le alcanza para cubrir esos gastos y asi tener mejores ingresos y tener una mejor estabilidad económica
texts.en: Bergelina is 43 years old and has worked in agriculture for 12 years. She plants beans and corn and uses the proceeds from selling the harvest to pay her household's expenses. She 's a very responsible, decent, hardworking woman who lives with her husband and five children in her own home. Bergelina is requesting a loan to buy supplies for the harvest such as: herbicides, soil amendments, seeds, fertilizers, etc, because she doesn't make enough to cover the expense. This is so she can have higher income and more financial stability.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, soil amendments, seeds, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Francis' Group

texts.en:
Francis is a member of this group in Lugari District.  He is pictured here with two other One Acre Fund group leaders, who together represent a total of 29 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured.  Francis has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with his hand raised.  He and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet, and sorghum cultivation.							

Francis is married and has 1 child.  He is 33 years old and is known as friendly and hardworking.  He is active in his community in groups such as the savings group, prayer group, and burial committee.  Francis has been a farmer for 3 years.  He described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have an even better harvest this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.  				

Francis first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2013 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season.  Francis joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, learn new farming methods, get fertilizer and hybrid seeds, and earn enough to feed his family.  He also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he likes being a leader, and is an active community member, and wants to help more farmers.  Francis plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school, save for the future, and buy a cow.  He notes that working with One Acre Fund has lead to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers.  Francis’s own life was improved because he has more profits from his harvest and more farm training, and he was able to save money and feed his family.  	

Francis and his group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.  One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits, and improved lives.							

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Adlam's Group

texts.en:
This group consists of 4 group leader farmers in Lugari District with Adlam selected as the Kiva representative.  Adlam has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and is on the right of the photo with his hand raised.  Farming inputs will be delivered to him and the 56 other individual farmers represented in this group.  The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum.  The individual farmers are not pictured here but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 shillings.

Adlam is a reliable member of the community.  He is married with 9 children.  Adlam is 77 years old and has been working as a farmer for the last 42 years to support his family.  In addition to this, Adlam is very active in his community and is involved in the men's group, and savings group, prayer group, and burial committee.  He described his harvest last year as good.  He hopes to continue working with One Acre Fund and to continue the success he is having with the One Acre Fund farm packages.							

Adlam joined One Acre Fund in 2013, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2014 season as a group leader.  Adlam joined One Acre Fund so that he could get the best seed prices, learn new farming methods, get fertilizer and hybrid seeds, earn enough to feed family, and send children to school.  Because he is an active community member, and wants to help more farmers, and wants to spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers, Adlam has gotten more involved with One Acre Fund as a group leader and Kiva representative.  Working with One Acre Fund has improved Adlam's life because he has more profits from the harvest, more farm training and group support, and because he was able to save money and feed the family.  In the future, Adlam hopes that his profits from 2014 can be used to send children to school, and repair the home.

One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya.  The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers.  Adlam and his group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund continues providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits, and improved lives.			

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds for maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, red oil, maggi cub, pepper, tomato, salt, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Shariniso

texts.ru: Шаринисо 52 года. Она начинающий предприниматель из района Рудаки. Шаринисо замужем, имеет двоих сыновей, которым по 29 и 25 лет. Она собирается начать семейный торговый бизнес. Шаринисо при поддержке мужа и сыновей будет заниматься продажей продуктов питания. Она уже приобрела просторное хорошее помещение для магазина, оснастила его стеклянными стеллажами и полками, купила два холодильника, стол и весы. Для купли товара ей не хватает собственного сбережения и она решила обратиться за кредитом. Шаринисо планирует привезти качественные продукты питания и наконец открыть свой магазин. Благодаря кредиту она начнет свой бизнес и у нее и у ее семьи будет прибыльная работа.
texts.en: Shariniso is 52 years old. She is a first-time entrepreneur from the Rudaki District. Shariniso is married and has two sons who are 29 and 25 years old. She is planning to start a family retail business. With the support of her husband and sons, Shariniso will take up selling food products. She already purchased a nice, spacious premises for her store, fitted it out with glass racks and shelves and bought two refrigerators, a table and scales. She does not have enough personal savings to buy the goods for sale, so she decided to request a loan. Shariniso plans to bring in quality food products and finally open her store. Thanks to the loan, she will start her own business and she and her family will have a profitable job.

loans.use: to buy food products for opening her own store.

loans.name: Rosemary's Group

texts.en:
Rosemary is a member of this group in Lugari District.  She is pictured here in a group of six One Acre Fund group leader farmers, who together represent a total of 73 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here.  Rosemary has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with her hand raised.  She and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet, and sorghum cultivation.							

Rosemary is 68 years old and has worked as a farmer for 47 years to provide for her six children.  The community and other farmers know Rosemary to be hardworking, reliable, and an experienced farmer.  Other than farming, she is also involved in her community through the women's group, savings group, prayer group, and burial committee.  Rosemary described her harvest last year as good, but hopes that she can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in her group.	

The 2014 Long Rains season won’t be Rosemary’s first season with One Acre Fund.  She first joined One Acre Fund in 2013 and has continue working with One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, learn new farming methods, get fertilizer and hybrid seeds, and earn enough to feed her family and send her children to school.  As an active member in her community, Rosemary also chose to be a group leader and Kiva representative because she likes being a leader, and is an active community member who wants to help more farmers and spread the story about the One Acre Fund.  Rosemary plans on using future profits from the harvest to send her children to school and repair her home.  Her life has improved by working with One Acre Fund because she has more profits from the harvest, more farm training and group support, and was able to save money and feed her family.							

One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya.  The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers.  Rosemary and her group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund continues providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.	

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy cost-efficient maize, millet, and sorghum seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Transplant 1,000 cacao seedlings

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more bowls, cups, spoons, and plates to increase the range of sales.

loans.name: Nehemiah's Group

texts.en:
Nehemiah is a member of this group in Lugari District.  He is pictured here in a group of 5 One Acre Fund group leader farmers, who together represent a total of 57 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here.  Nehemiah has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with his hand raised. He and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet, and sorghum cultivation.							

Nehemiah is 80 years old and has been a farmer for 47 years to provide for his 7 children.  The community and other farmers know Nehemiah as hardworking, reliable, trustworthy, and as an experienced farmer.  Other than farming, he is also involved in his community through the men's group, and savings group, prayer group, and burial committee.  Nehemiah described his harvest last year as good, but hopes he can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in her group.							

Nehemiah joined One Acre Fund in 2013, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2014 season as a group leader.  Nehemiah joined One Acre Fund so that he could get the best seed prices, learn new farming methods, and earn enough to feed family and send children to school.  Because he likes being a leader, and is an active community member, and wants to help more farmers, Nehemiah has gotten more involved with One Acre Fund as a group leader and Kiva representative.  Working with One Acre Fund has improved Nehemiah's life because he has more profits from the harvest, more farm training and group support, and was able to save money and feed his family.  In the future, Nehemiah hopes that his profits from 2014 can be used to send his children to school and invest in a business.  			

One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya.  The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers.  Nehemiah and his group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund continues providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits, and improved lives.		

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To provide Kenyan farmers with increased access to hybrid seed and fertilizer for harvesting maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Josphine's Group

texts.en:
This group consists of seven groups of farmers in the Lugari District with Josphine selected as Kiva representative. She is on the right in the photo with her hand raised. Supplies will be delivered to her and the 90 other farmers represented in this group. These supplies include the materials necessary to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum. The individual farmers are not pictured here but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 Ugandan shillings each.							

Josphine is 57 years old and has been a farmer for 15 years. She works hard to provide for her three children.  The community and other farmers know her as a friendly, hardworking, reliable and experienced farmer. Apart from farming, she is also involved in many community activities such as a women's group and a savings group. She described her harvest last year as good, but hopes she can have an even better one with the support of the One Acre Fund and the other farmers in her group.			

Josphine’s first joined the group in 2013 and has continued working with it in order to get the best seed prices, and learn new farming methods to earn enough to feed family and send her children to school.  As an active member of her community, she also chose to be a group leader and Kiva representative because she wants to help more farmers and spread the story of the One Acre Fund.  Josphine plans to use future profits from her harvest to send children to school.  Her life has improved because she has more profits, more farming opportunities and support and was able to feed her family.							

Josphine and her group need a loan to cover the initial costs of buying seeds and fertilizer through the One Acre Fund. The fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from their harvests. The fund pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the savings to the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, the fund also provides training and support to farmers as they make payments.  With this support, farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.							

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left.

loans.use: to buy hybrid seed and fertilizer to cultivate maize, millet and sorghum.

loans.name: Faima

texts.en: Faima is a 41 year old married woman with 3 children. She has a small plantation and grows taro to earn a living. She has been doing this for 3 years. Faima has requested a loan to buy chemicals, mist blower, fertiliser, chain saw, knives, spade, shovel to help with the work on her plantation. She just became a member of SPBD this year. With her profits, Faima hopes to provide a decent living for her family.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, mist blower, fertiliser, chain saw, knives, spade, shovel

loans.name: Silia

texts.en: Silia is a 26 year old mother of 2 children. She has a small plantation being operated as a business to earn a living. She has been doing this for 3 years. Silia has requested a loan to buy mist blower, chemicals, knives, spade, taro roots, fertilisers. She has just joined the SPBD program to gain financial assistance. With her profits, Silia hopes to provide a better life for her family, especially her children.

loans.use: To buy mistblower, chemicals, knives, spade, taro roots, fertilisers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, garlic, oil, pepper, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Jane's Group

texts.en:
Jane is a member of this group in Lugari District.  She is pictured here in a group of 5 One Acre Fund group leader farmers, who together represent a total of 92 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here.  Jane has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with her hand raised.  She and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.							

Jane is married and has six children.  She is 66 years old and is known as trustworthy and as an experienced farmer.  She is active in her community in groups such as the women's group and prayer group. Jane has been a farmer for 54 years, and she described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.  	

The 2014 Long Rains season won’t be Jane’s first season with One Acre Fund.  She first joined One Acre Fund in 2013 and has continued working with One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices and learn new farming methods.  As an active member in her community, Jane also chose to be a group leader and Kiva representative because she is an active community member and wants to spread the story about the One Acre Fund.  Jane plans on using future profits from the harvest to save for the future.  Her life has improved by working with One Acre Fund because she was able to save money and feed her family.

One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya.  The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers.  Jane and her group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund continues providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest, and repayment.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

loans.use: To buy cost efficient maize, millet, and sorghum seeds.

loans.name: Santa Elena Group

texts.es:
Santa Elena es un grupo muy unido, donde cada una de ellas  trabaja con la intención de generar una ayuda a sus familias y también para ayudarse las unas a las otras.
Se destaca el trabajo en equipo, entre ellas organizan actividades en donde se ayudan entre todas para el bien del grupo y ser beneficiadas cada una.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Angela quien a través del trabajo y deseo de superación se esmera en trabajar para lograr sus objetivos en la elaboración de los productos artesanales para lograr mayor producción y mejor ganancia, ella demuestra interés y dedicación en su trabajo para poder solventar los gastos de la casa y con  el compromiso que tiene con su grupo.
La Sra. Angela solicita de este préstamo para la compra de sus insumos para hacer sus respectivas artesanías, como ser telas, hilos, agujas y demás, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos y para el progreso de cada una de ellas.
texts.en:
Santa Elena is a very united group, where every one of them works with the intention of generating help for their families and also to help each other.  They do work as a team.  Between them they organize activities where they can help each other for the good of the group and benefit everyone.  

One of the group members is Angela, who works and has a desire to improve.  She works to achieve her objectives in making traditional craft products.  She wants to improve production and earn more profits.  She has an interest and dedication to her work to be able to meet her household expenses and the agreement she has with her group.  

Angela is requesting this loan to purchase materials to make her crafts, such as fabric, thread, needles, and other items.  This will help her improve her income and help the progress of each group member.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, thread, needles, and other items.

loans.name: Jane's Group

texts.en:
Jane is a member of this group in Lugari District.  She is pictured here in a group of eight One Acre Fund group leader farmers, who together represent a total of 84 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here.  Jane has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with her hand raised.  She and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.							

Jane is a reliable member of the community. She is married with 7 children. Jane is 53 years old and has been working as a farmer for the last 20 years to support her family.  In addition to this, Jane is very active in her community and is involved in the women's group and prayer group.  She described her harvest last year as good, and she hopes to continue working with One Acre Fund and continue the success she is having with its farm packages.							

Jane joined One Acre Fund in 2013, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2014 season as a group leader.  Jane joined One Acre Fund so that she could get the best seed prices, learn new farming methods, and get fertilizer and hybrid seeds.  Because she is an active community member and wants to spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers, Jane has gotten more involved with One Acre Fund as a group leader and Kiva representative.  Working with One Acre Fund has improved Jane's life because she has more farm training.  In the future, Jane hopes that her profits from 2014 can be used to send her children to school.  		

One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya.  The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers.  Jane and her group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund continues providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest, and repayment.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits, and improved lives.

loans.use: To provide Kenyan farmers with increased access to hybrid seed and fertilizer for harvesting maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Lote

texts.en: Lote is 40 years old with 5 children. She has a plantation where she grows taro and bananas. Lote has had this plantation for more than two years and has decided to sell of these crops in order to get some money to take care of her family. That is why she has just joined the SPBD program to gain financial assistance. She plans to use this loan to buy a mistblower, chemicals, fertilisers, bushknives, wheelbarrow, spade, shovel to help with the plantation. She plans to save most of the money she is able to earn from her sales so that it could be reinvested back to the plantation business and also provide essentials for her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy a mistblower, chemicals, fertilisers, bushknives, wheelbarrow, spade, shovel

loans.name: Talosaga

texts.en: Talosaga is a 46 year old woman with 4 children. She has a vegetable garden which is earning her a decent income to cater for her family's every day needs and things also needed to improve her garden. She has been doing this for 3 years. Talosaga has requested a loan to iron roofing and nails for her home renovation, school fees, registration and school uniforms for her kids. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. With her profits, Talosaga hopes to expand her garden and supply essentials for her family needs.

loans.use: to buy iron roofing, nails, school fees, school uniforms, school registration

loans.name: Potoae

texts.en: Potoae is a 42 year old married woman with 6 children. She has a operates a small canteen to earn a living. She has been doing this for 4 years. Potoae has requested a loan to buy a new fridge, gas stove, rice, chicken leg quarters, cooking oil, corn seeds so that she is able to improve the type of food she sells at the canteen. She has been a member of SPBD since last year. With her profits, Potoae hopes to pay for her families weekly expenses and invest it back to her business so that she may be able to expand it in the future.

loans.use: to buy new fridge, gas stove, rice, chicken leg quarters, cooking oil, corn seeds

loans.name: Emmanuel 1 Group

texts.en:
Claribel is the coordinator of Emmanuel 1. She is a single woman who runs a business where she sells miscellaneous products like clothes, shoes, women accessories, and other products. She lives in one of the slum neighborhoods located in Los Alcarrizos, south of Santo Domingo. Claribel is very excited to receive her sixth loan with Esperanza International.

She has had her business for around three years. She started it with some savings and her first loan. She used a little bit of capital to buy miscellaneous products and started selling from her house and by walking around. After some years of doing business, Claribel is planning to use her new loan to purchase cosmetics, clothing, shoes, jewelry, clothing, and other products. She will use her business profits to continue investing in her business and to save for her future and plans. Claribel will achieve her dream of having a successful business and stable income to support her family. She thanks you all for your support!!!

loans.use: To  buy cosmetics, clothing, shoes, jewelry, etc. to sell

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan de 59 años de edad desde hace 20 años se dedica a la agricultura su principal siembra es el maíz, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia con las ganancias que obtiene de su trabajo logra sacra adelante a su familia, vive en casa propia con su familia, Don Juan esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno donde siembra que es el que muestra la fotografia y así poder seguir con sus siembras para obtener mejores ganancias y darle a su familia lo que necesitan sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Juan, who's fifty-nine years old, has been working in agriculture for twenty years. His main crop is corn. He sells his products at several markets that are located near his place of residence. He manages to get his family ahead with his earnings. He lives in his own home with his family.

Juan is applying for this loan to improve his soil, which can be seen in the photograph, as well as to buy seeds, manures, fertilizers, and pest control products. In this manner, he will be able to continue farming to obtain better earnings and provide his family with everything they need without limitation.

loans.use: to improve his soil and buy seeds, manures, fertilizers, and pest control products.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
This is Myrna, 39, resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Melvin, a jeepney driver and a mother to their children. She, together with husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Myrna operates a rug-making business. She mainly offers rugs, from those round palm sized ones, to the much larger doormats and other crafts that most rug-makers come up every day. As rugs are a major part of Filipino housekeeping and cleaning, rugs are one of the most common products that can be bought, sometimes even from a peddler while you are riding in a speeding jeepney down the highway. She also sells different condiments. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php10, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials for her business. 
Myrna dreams to expand her business and dreams to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional goods such as rice, coal, soap, red oil and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper, oil, and onions for her business

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel de 38 años, es una persona emprendedora y luchadora, ha trabajado en el gremio de las confecciones y por ello tiene amplio conocimiento y experiencia, desde hace más de un año tiene una microempresa familiar de confección a terceros, y ha generado empleo a otras dos personas de su familia, Maribel sueña con adquirir una moto para agilizar más la entrega y la recogida de la mercancía, motivo por el cual hace la respectiva solicitud ante la Corporación y con éste crédito comprará la moto y también surtirá la microempresa de insumos para desempeñar mejor su labor ( hilos, telas, resortes,etc) teniendo mayor producción y por lo consiguiente aumentar los ingresos familiares obteniendo de ésta manera un nivel de vida de mayor calidad.
texts.en:
Maribel is 38 years old and is an entrepreneurial and hardworking person. She has worked in the sewing guild and, as a result, she has a lot of knowledge and experience. For more than a year she has had a small family business doing third party clothing manufacturing and has generated work for two other members of her family.

Maribel dreams of acquiring a motorcycle to facilitate merchandise deliveries and pick ups. This is why she is requesting this loan from the corporation. With this loan she will buy the motorcycle as well as stocking up the small business with supplies to carry out her work (thread, cloth, elastic, etc.). This will allow her to have better production and, as a result, increase her family's income. In this way she will obtain a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to transport merchandise.

loans.name: Cipriana

texts.en:
This is Cipriana, 44, resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Teodoro, a technician, and they have children. She and her husband are managing their household while operating the business. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

Cipriana operates an appliances-repair shop. Her husband is the main technician while she handles finances, accounts, inventories and promotion. They offer repair and check-up of all types of appliances like electric fan, washing machine, air-con, television and others. Her shop is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 600 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.
 
To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php20, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts of appliances and materials needed in her business. 

Cipriana dreams to expand her business and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts of appliances and materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Francisco Fredy

texts.es: Francisco, con 52 años, tiene aún sueños por cumplir, cuatro años atrás trabajaba fuera de la ciudad y por la dificultad para emplearse nuevamente, decidió viajar a nuestra ciudad, desde hace cuatro años y por la experiencia adquirida en el pasado como vendedor ambulante, actualmente vende helados y minutos a celular, él no cuenta con un permiso de espacio público por lo que debe estar pendiente de su mercancía, Francisco anhela tener una distribuidora de helados y generar muchos empleos, pero con el préstamo solicitado el comprará surtido (paletas, helados, galletas heladas,etc) y podrá ofrecer más variedad de productos y generará con ello el incremento de sus ganancias y continuar con el sustento de su familia brindando una mejor estabilidad económica y bienestar familiar.
texts.en: Francisco is 52 years old and still has dreams that he wants to achieve. Four years ago he was working outside of the city and, given the difficulties of finding a new job, he decided to travel to Medellín and, with his experience as a street vendor, found work selling ice cream and renting out a phone for making calls. Francisco does not have a licence to sell in public places and so must always have merchandise. Francisco would really like to have a business wholesaling ice creams and to generate many jobs. With this loan, Francisco will buy stock (ice lollies, ice creams and frosted cookies). With this he will be able to offer a greater variety of products and increase his income. Francisco will then be able to continue supporting his family and offering them more financial stability and well-being.

loans.use: to buy stock (ice lollies, ice creams and frosted cookies).

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne is a member of a group in Lugari District. She is pictured here and the field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo. The group leader represents a total of 10 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here. Everlyne has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with her hand raised. She and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet. Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.							

Everlyne is a reliable member of the community. She is married with six children. Everlyne is 57 years old and has been working as a farmer for the last 20 years to support her family. In addition to this, Everlyne is very active in her community and is involved in the prayer group. She described her harvest last year as not with One Acre Fund. She hopes to continue working with One Acre Fund and to continue the success she is having with the One Acre Fund farm packages.							

The 2013 Long Rains season will be Everlyne’s first season with One Acre Fund. She joined this year. As an active member in her community, Everlyne also volunteered her time to be a group leader and Kiva representative. Everlyne plans on using future profits from the harvest to send her children to school.  						

One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya. The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers. Everlyne and her group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund continues providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

loans.use: To gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds for maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Francia Edith

texts.es: Francia, es casada, con 46 años de edad y tiene 3 hijos, uno de ellos aún es menor de edad, desde muy joven su madre la enseñó en la venta de las loterías, desde hace 19 años desempeña esta labor, aunque manifiesta que la actividad le gusta porque maneja su propio tiempo pero tiene también desventajas porque no genera prestaciones sociales, ni pensión.  Francia sueña con brindarle a su hijo menor una carrera y también con terminar su vejez en una casa finca sin problemas económicos.  Con el préstamo solicitado ella podrá adquirir mercancía (loterías) y tener un stock y aumentar sus ventas y obtener grandes ganancias, lo cual mejorarían sus ingresos  y la de su familia, y poder seguir costeando el estudio de su hijo para que sean un futuro profesional y poder disfrutar los triunfos con su familia.
texts.en: Francia is 46 years old and married. She has three children, one of whom is still a child. From a very young age, Francia's mother taught her to sell lottery tickets and Francia has now been doing this work for 19 years. Francia tells us that she likes this work because she can organise her own time. However, there are disadvantages, such as the lack of welfare state benefits and she will receive no pension. Francia dreams of give her youngest son a university education and of spending her old age on land with no financial problems. This loan will be used to buy more merchandise (lottery tickets) and to have stock and increase sales in order to gain greater profits. This will give Francia and her family a higher income and she will be able to continue paying for her son's education. He can then have a profession and share in his triumphs with his family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (lottery tickets).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to underbrush her farmland and plant 500 seedlings

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To hire workers to clean five acres of cacao trees

loans.name: Carlos Rolando

texts.es: Carlos de 44 años de edad desde hace 23 años que se dedica a la agricultura la cual es su principal fuente de ingresos, siembra maiz y frijol con lo que gana de sus cosechas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar. El quiere comprar los insumos necesarios para sus cosechas como abonos, fertilizantes, semillas y mejorar el terreno donde siembra que es el que muestra la fotografia pero dado que no cuenta con los recursos económicos necesarios para dicha inversión ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito ya que solo de esta forma puede continuar su proceso de cultivo. Al igual que todo campesino, deposita su confianza en la agricultura ya que no poseen otra fuente de ingresos y desea superarse haciendo lo mejor que puede en sus cultivos. Espera obtener una cosecha abundante que le permita seguir llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar y cancelar dicho crédito.
texts.en: For 23 years, forty-four-year-old Carlos has been working in farming, which is his main source of income.  He grows corn and beans and with his earnings from these harvests he is able to cover some of his household expenses.  He wants to buy the supplies he needs for his crops, such as manures, fertilizers, and seed, and to improve the land where he plants, which you can see in the photograph.  However, because he does not have the financial resources he needs for this investment, he has made the decision to request a loan, as this is the only way for him to continue with the growing process.  Like all people living in the country, he has placed his faith in farming, as he does not have another source of income and he wants to better himself by doing the best he can with his crops.  He hopes for an abundant harvest that will allow him to keep bringing home the daily bread and repay this loan.

loans.use: to buy manures, fertilizers, and seed, and to improve the land.

loans.name: Alice's Group

texts.en:
Alice is a member of this group in Lugari District.  She is pictured here in a group of three One Acre Fund group leader farmers.  The group leaders represent a total of 30 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here.  Alice has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with her hand raised.  She and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving seeds and fertilizer to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.							

Alice is married and has seven children.  She is 50 years old and is known as hardworking, trustworthy, and an experienced farmer.  She is active in her community in groups such as the women's group, savings group, and prayer group.  Alice has been a farmer for 26 years.  She described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.  		

Alice first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2012 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season.  Alice joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, get new farming methods, get fertilizer and hybrid seeds, and earn enough to feed her family and send her children to school.  She volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because she is an active community member who wants to help more farmers and spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers.  Alice plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school, repair the home and save for the future.  She notes that working with One Acre Fund has led to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers.  Alice’s own life was improved because she has more profits from her harvest and was able to save money and feed the family. 

Alice and her group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.  One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.							

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To  hire someone to clean his three plots of cacao trees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cosmetics for her business.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
This is Merlinda, 44, resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Mario, a tricycle driver and they have four children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Merlinda operates a poultry supply store where she sells different supplies mostly for cocks. She sells it by kilo and her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She also has a variety store for additional income. She earns a minimum of Php600 in sales every day.
