To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more feeds and other supplies needed to expand her product inventory.

Merlinda dreams that her business will grow bigger and hopes to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more feeds and other supplies needed to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Viviana Andrea

texts.es:
Viviana es una madre soltera de 3 hijos a los que ha sacado adelante con esfuerzo y dedicación. Durante su vida productiva se ha dedicado a la confección a terceros, actividad que realiza desde la comodidad de su vivienda, trabaja sola todos los días y así ha logrado generar recursos para solventar los gastos familiares.
El crédito que solicita será invertido en la adecuación del espacio de trabajo, pues requiere ampliarlo para cumplir su sueño de brindar oportunidades de empleo y así mejorar la agilidad y la capacidad de producción para mejorar las ventas e ingresos. 
Viviana manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es ver crecer su negocio y tener la capacidad económica para sacar adelante a sus hijos y brindarles educación para que sean personas íntegras y existosas.
texts.en:
Viviana is the single mother of three children, whom she has gotten ahead through hard work and dedication.  During her professional life, she has worked in third-party tailoring.  She does this work from the comfort of her own home.  She works on her own every day, which has allowed her to generate the income to cover her family's expenses.  

The loan she is requesting will be invested in remodeling her workspace, as she needs to expand it to realize her dream of offering others employment.  This will also improve the flexibility and quantity of her output, which will improve sales and profits.

Viviana tells us that her greatest wish is to see her business grow and to have the financial ability to get her children ahead and offer them an education so they will become upstanding, successful people.

loans.use: to remodel her workspace

loans.name: Liaina

texts.en: Liaina is 49 years old, married with 2 children. She runs a small business selling bbq in her community and has been doing this for 2 years. Liaina used her profit to reinvest back into her Barbeque business and sets some aside as savings. Liaina has requested a loan to buy schooll text books, stationery, school uniforms and school fees for her kids. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Liaina hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy schooll text books, stationery, school uniforms and school fees for her kids

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
This is Thelma, 47, resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. She is a widow and she has children. She and her children manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Thelma operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a Php20,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Thelma hopes to have more customers and dreams to have a car.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Ferney David

texts.es: Ferney, soltero, tiene 29 años de edad, se desempeña como estilista y ha adquirido mucha experiencia en el gremio, desde hace varios años inició su propia peluquería en un barrio de la ciudad, Sueña con ampliar su negocio y hacerle mejoras para que sea un lugar agradable a su público el cual ha ido creciendo. Con el préstamo Ferney surtirá su negocio de diversos productos de belleza (tintes, bálsamos, perfumes, accesorios, etc) los cuales ofrecerá a su fiel clientela y con ello le dará más prestigio y reconocimiento a su negocio, dando como resultado mayores ingresos y poder disfrutar de un nivel de vida como lo ha visionado, con mucho éxito.
texts.en: Ferney is 29 and single.  He works as a stylist and he has gained a lot of experience in the profession.  Several years ago he started his own hair salon in a neighborhood in the city.  He dreams of expanding his business and making improvements so it will be a place that appeals to his clientele, which has been growing.  With this loan, Ferney will stock his business with different beauty products (hair colors, hair products, perfumes, accessories, etc.), which he will sell to his loyal clientele.  This will make his business more prestigious and better known, which will result in greater profits and allow him to enjoy the quality of life he has envisioned very successfully.

loans.use: to stock his business with different beauty products (hair colors, hair products, perfumes, accessories, etc.)

loans.name: Rarotoga

texts.en: Rarotoga is a 39 year old single mother of  4 children. She operates an elei clothing business selling to the public and people around her village. She has 1 year of experience with this business. Rarotoga has requested a loan to buy fabric, fabric pain, elei designs, brushes. Rarotoga is hoping to do well in her business being able to save her profits so that she may expand it in the future. She joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy fabric, fabric pain, elei designs, brushes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pepper, oil, rice, and maggi cubes for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more rice, fish, onion, oil, meat, and water for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition fee

loans.name: Rubie

texts.en: Rubie has been operating their own farm for a living. She earns well from this while her husband works as a foreman in a construction. With her generated income from farming, she had successfully repay her previous loan used for fertilizer. It is her dreams of providing her children better education and she work for it. Recently, she took a new loan to purchase fertilizer and seedling for the next cropping season.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seedling

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more biscuits, candy, rice, etc for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice, vita juice drinks, pepper, oil, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more paper tissue, sardines, rice, tomatoes, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Vagavao

texts.en: Vagavao is 19 years old and single with no children. She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as sugar,salt,rice,chicken etc. She has been doing this for 3 years. Vagavao needs a loan to buy sugar, flour, chicken leg quarters, noodles, soya, tin fish. She hopes to use her profits to not only reinvest it back to her business, but also look into renovating her. She has just joined SPBD in order to get access to financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour, chicken leg quarters, noodles, soya, tin fish

loans.name: Iván Darío

texts.es: Iván de 55 años, es separado y con dos hijos mayores de edad, desde hace 3 años tuvo una gran idea para incrementar sus ingresos familiares, y reordenó su vivienda y la adecuó para parqueadero de vehículos y también lavadero en general, negocio que ha tenido buena acogida y le ha representado ganancias, aprovechando el entorno de su negocio con el de  la moda, también vende camisetas de punto estampadas. Iván sueña con tener un gran almacén para la venta y distribución de las misma y tener la oportunidad de generar empleo para otras personas, este préstamo lo utilizará para comprar un stock grande de camisetas y pagar la estampación ofreciendo su mercancías a todos los visitantes de su parqueadero y lavadero, todo esto le generará grandes ganancias y seguirá disfrutando de su vida en compañía con su familia.
texts.en: Fifty-five-year-old Iván is separated with two adult children.  Three years ago he had a great idea to increase his family's income and he reorganized his home and set it up with a parking lot and general laundry services.  His business has been well received and it has produced earnings for him.  Taking advantage of his business setting in terms of clothing, he also sells silkscreened t-shirts. Iván dreams of having a bigger area to sell and distribute his shirts and of having the opportunity to offer other people employment.  He will use this loan buy a large stock of t-shirts and to pay for silkscreening so he can offer his merchandise to everyone who visits his parking lot and laundromat.  All of this will generate high earnings for him and he will keep enjoying his life in the company of his family.

loans.use: to buy a large stock of t-shirts and to pay for silkscreening.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more door catches, hinges, nails, locks, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more rice, pepper, onions, fish, meat, charcoal, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more flour, sugar, oil, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock like locks, nails, and hinges for her business.

loans.name: Fonofono

texts.en: Fonofono is a 25 year old single mother of 1 child. She has a small business, operating a taxi and has been in operation for a year. Fonofono needs a loan to pay for her taxi registration which is due, and 4 new tyres. She will save her profits so that it may come in handy when her taxi is due for vehicle service maintenance so that it would continue to be serviceable. Fonofono joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to pay for her taxi registration which is due, and buy 4 new tyres

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more dry fish to increase her business.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 47 ans, et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Zanfina, commune de Guégnéka, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce, de condiments, de charbon de bois, d’habillement, et de tubercule. Les femmes du groupe BENKADI sont à leur septième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente FATOUMATA , première personne à partir de la droite dans le rang assis est actuellement vendeuse d’habits pour enfant. Elle compte acheter 25 complets d’habits pour enfant chez les grossistes à Fana. La vente se fait à son domicile et parfois en ambulante en espèce et en crédit à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 22 000Fcfa, qui sera utilisé pour assurer la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
The group BENKADI is composed of married women, who average 47 years of age and three children each. The women all live in traditional families in the village of Zanfina, Commune de Guégnéka, Préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). And they know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They do commerce in condiments, charcoal, clothing, and tubers.


The women of the group BENKADI are on their seventh solidarity loan. To satisfy the enormous demand from their customers, they turn to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. These funds will be used to purchase their merchandise as cited above.

This client, FATOUMATA, who is sitting first from the right in the photo, is illiterate. She is currently a vendor of children's clothing. She intends to purchase 25 children's outfits from wholesalers in Fana. At her home and sometimes by hawking, the retail sales are made to a mixed customer base paying with cash or credit. She plans on making a monthly profit of 22,000 francs CFA that will be used to ensure her children's schooling costs are covered.

loans.use: to purchase children's clothing to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more artificial hair for her business.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 35 ans, et 2 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Dounamakebougou, commune de Guégnéka, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréale, de condiment, de savon, d’habillement, et d’article divers. Les femmes du groupe BENKADI sont à leur cinquième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente OUMOU, la première personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des débout est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de d’habit pour enfants. Elle compte acheter 10 complets pour enfant chez les grossistes à Bamako. La vente se fait à son domicile et parfois en ambulante en espèce et en crédit à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 12 000Fcfa, qui sera réinjecté dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The group BENKADI is composed of married women, who average 35 years of age and two children each. The women all live in traditional families in the village of Dounamakebougou, Commune de Guégnéka, Préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). And they know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They do commerce in grains, condiments, soap, clothing, and general merchandise.


The women of the group BENKADI are on their fifth solidarity loan. To satisfy the enormous demand from their customers, they turn to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. These funds will be used to purchase their merchandise as cited above.

This client, OUMOU, who is standing first from the left in the photo, is illiterate. She is currently a vendor of children's clothing. She intends to purchase 10 outfits for children from wholesalers in Bamako. The retail sales are made to a mixed customer base paying with cash or credit at her home and sometimes as she goes door to door. She plans on making a monthly profit of 12,000 francs CFA that will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase children's clothing

loans.name: Toreka

texts.en: Toreka is 25 years old married woman with 2 children. She runs a small business selling meat bun in her community and has been doing this for a year. Toreka has requested a loan to buy bags of flour, cooking oil, box of chicken leg quarters, yeast, garlic, onion, soya, gas. She joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Toreka hopes to expand her business and enables to provide necessities for her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, cooking oil, box of chicken leg quarters, yeast, garlic, onion, soya, gas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to renovate her restaurant in order to attract more customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more goods for her business.

loans.name: Bilbil

texts.en:
Bilbil needs your help again to stock up on used inventory items to resell. He used your previous loan for the same thing and he and his wife have been very appreciative of your financial help. Their grandchildrens' well-being is improving and they deliver many thanks to Kiva lenders and VisionFund Albania.
 
Bilbil is been photographed here with his grandchildren. :)

loans.use: To buy used clothes to resell.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en:
Andrea is a married father of two. He has been photographed in his home yard. The two rows covered with waterproof material are called "warm beds" among villagers in Albania. This is where the seeds are thrown first during cold months in order to become seedlings, and then they are planted outside when the weather gets better. 

Agriculture/livestock is the only means of living for Andrea’s family. The loan that he is requesting from Kiva lenders will be used to prepare the soil and buy fertilizers and seeds for planting. Andrea has one dairy cow that produces more than 15 kg milk per day; he uses some of it for the family and sells the rest. Andrea also plants wheat, corn, sage, and animal fodder in large quantities.

loans.use: to prepare the soil and buy fertilizers and seeds for planting.

loans.name: Angie

texts.en: Angie is a 24 year old single mother of 2 children. She runs a small canteen like business selling food and snacks not only to the children but the public as well around her community and has been doing this for 2 years. Angie has requested a loan to buy box of chicken leg quarters, cooking oil, rice, onion, salt, snacks, ice pops, lollies, boiler. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Angie is hoping to save alot in order to expand her business in the future and provide for family's immediate daily needs.

loans.use: to buy box of chicken leg quarters, cooking oil, rice, onion, salt, snacks, ice pops, lollies, boiler

loans.name: Djiguignouma Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DJIGUIGNOUMA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 47 ans, et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Dibida, commune de Guégnéka, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce, de céréale, de condiment, de charbon, et de tomate. Les femmes du groupe DJIGUIGNOUMA sont à leur onzième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente BINTOU, personne assise au milieu est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de tomate. Elle compte acheter 8 gros paniers de tomate chez les grossistes à Somo. La vente se fait à son domicile et parfois en ambulante en espèce et en crédit au marché journalier de Fana a une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 23 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The group DJIGUIGNOUMA is composed of married women, who average 47 years of age and four children each. The women all live in traditional families in the village of Dibida, Commune de Guégnéka, Préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). And they know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They do commerce in grains, condiments, charcoal, and tomatoes.


The women of the group DJIGUIGNOUMA are on their eleventh solidarity loan. To satisfy the enormous demand from their customers, they turn to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. These funds will be used to purchase their merchandise as cited above.

This client, BINTOU, who is sitting in the middle in the photo, is illiterate. She is currently a vendor of tomatoes. She intends to purchase 8 big baskets of tomatoes from wholesalers in Somo. At her home and sometimes by hawking, the retail sales are made to a mixed customer base paying with cash or credit at the Fana daily market. She plans on making a monthly profit of 23,000 francs CFA that will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes

loans.name: Rokhaya

texts.fr: Madame Rokhaya est une femme mariée et mère de famille. Elle évolue dans la commercialisation des produits alimentaires divers et a une expérience de plus de 10 ans dans cette activité. Elle aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses journalières et les frais de scolarisation des enfants. Elle sollicite ce prêt d’un montant de 200.000 F pour acheter des produits alimentaires et ensuite les revendre. Elle commence sa journée à 9h pour la terminer à 22h. Elle souhaite à l’avenir augmenter ses revenus et avec l’aide de l’institution ouvrir d’autres boutiques afin de pouvoir épargner de l’argent et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: Ms. Rokhaya is a married woman and mother. She works at selling a variety of grocery items and has over ten years of experience in this business. She helps out her husband in managing the day-to-day expenses and the children's schooling costs. She is requesting this loan in the amount of 200,000 francs to purchase grocery items and then resell them. Her day starts at 9 AM and finishes at 10 PM. For the future, she would like to increase her revenues with the microfinance institution's help and to open another shop to be able to save some money and to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of grocery items to sell

loans.name: Alafaga

texts.en: Alafaga is 25 years old and married with 2 children. She runs a small business selling meat bun in her community and has been doing this for 1 year. Alafaga has requested a loan to buy pots, plastic containers, onion, flour, soya, chicken leg quarters. She has just joined SPBD in order to gain access to capital. Alafaga hopes to provide for her family's daily needs with the profit she will earn, and reinvests it back to her business buying more ingredients in case it runs out.

loans.use: to buy pots, plastic containers, onion, flour, soya, chicken leg quarters

loans.name: Asllan

texts.en:
Asllan is requesting a loan to buy medicinal sage seedlings. So far, he has had only cherry orchards and grapevines, and he recently decided to add sage as well. He has been photographed in the field planted with cherry trees.

Sage also grows wild in southwestern Albania and in a northern region that is considered the poorest corner of Albania, making it perhaps the poorest part of all of Europe. The wild sage smells very strong. Albania exports sage to the USA and, according to the statistics, 60% of domestic use of sage in the United States is imported from Albania. USAID has done a wonderful job in this area, raising incomes of the poorest villagers through this activity.

loans.use: to buy medicinal sage seedlings.

loans.name: Deme Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DEME est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 50 ans, et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Dibida, commune de Guégnéka, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce, de céréale, de condiment, de charbon, d’habillement, du lait, et de tubercule. Les femmes du groupe DEME sont à leur cinquième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente MOUSOKORO, la première personne à partir de la droite dans le rang des debout est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de pagne. Elle compte acheter 7 pièces de pagnes wax chez les grossistes à Bamako. La vente se fait à son domicile et parfois en ambulante en espèce et en crédit à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 31 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The group DEME is composed of married women, who average 50 years of age and 4 children each. The women all live in traditional families in the village of Dibida, Commune de Guégnéka, Préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). And they know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They do commerce in grains, condiments, charcoal, cloth, milk, and tubers.


The women of the group DEME are on their fifth solidarity loan. To satisfy the enormous demand from their customers, they turn to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. These funds will be used to purchase their merchandise as cited above.

This client, MOUSOKORO, who is standing first from the right in the photo, is illiterate. She is currently a vendor of 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa). She intends to purchase 7 lengths of Wax 'pagne' cloth from wholesalers in Bamako. At her home and sometimes by hawking, the retail sales are made to a mixed customer base paying with cash or credit. She plans on making a monthly profit of 31,000 francs CFA that will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa)

loans.name: Jenni Roxana

texts.es: Jenni gracias a los diferentes apoyos financieros que ha recibido desde abril del 2013 para poder dar asistencia y mantenimiento a sus cultivos de arroz estos han ayudado a crecer y fortalecer su tierra, cosecha, ingresos familiares y a poder cubrir los gastos en su hogar de una manera más pacífica y sin preocupaciones. En su primer financiamiento  lo utilizo para terminar de asistir 1 manzana de arroz la cual obtuvo excelentes ingresos y pudo cancelar su primer financiamiento satisfactoriamente y que gracias a este pudo comprar: urea, abono 12-24-1, en su segundo financiamiento fue solicitado también para el mismo rubro de manera que este le ayudaría a asistir toda la manzana de arroz con el que compro: abono, urea, rienda para la plaga, herbax para la hierba, boro y foliar con lo que le dio el mantenimiento a su cultivo de arroz obteniendo una producción de 100 quintales de en oro siendo la cosecha excelente ya que asistió adecuadamente y a tiempo sus cultivos. Con el deseo y las esperanzas de seguir creciendo actualmente Jenni solicita pueda ser apoyada con financiamiento en una tercera ocasión mismo que invertirá siempre en el cultivo de arroz, comprara  urea, abono 12-24-12, boro, rienda para la plaga, domines, herbax, ya que con la producción que obtuvo cancelo el crédito anterior y las ganancias fueron invertidas en mejoras de su vivienda las cuales eran necesarias como ser: piso digno, repello y pulido. Ella necesita volver asistir sus cultivos de arroz esperando nuevamente ser apoyada por los diferentes inversionistas en la plataforma de Kiva.
texts.en: Thanks to the various financial support that Jenni has received since April, 2013, to give assistance and maintenance to her crops of rice, these crops have been helped to grow, her land, harvest, and family income have been strengthened, and she has been able to cover her household expenses in a more orderly manner and without worry. She used her first loan to finish helping one manzana (about 1.75 acres) of rice, from which she obtained excellent income and was able to pay off her first loan satisfactorily. Thanks to this, she was able to buy urea and 12-24-12 fertilizer. She applied for her second loan for the same purpose so that it would help her to care for the whole manzana of rice, and with it she bought compost, urea, Rienda insecticide for the blight, Herbax herbicide for the weeds, boron, and foliar spray, with which she could maintain her planting of rice, obtaining a production of 100 quintales [1 quintal is approximately 100 lbs] of husked rice, which was an excellent harvest, since she helped her plantings adequately and on time. With the desire and hopes to continue to grow, Jenni is now applying to be supported with financing for a third time, which, as before, she will always invest in growing rice. She will buy urea, 12-24-12 fertilizer, boron, Rienda insecticide for the blight, Domines insecticide, and Herbax herbicide, since with the production that she obtained she paid off the last loan, and the earnings were invested in improvements in her house, which were necessary, such as a quality floor, coating, and polishing. She needs to return to helping her plantings of rice, hoping again to be supported by the various investors from the Kiva platform.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and compost that will help protect her plantings of rice.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DANAYA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 28 ans, et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Djoni, commune de Konobougou, préfecture de Baroueli, Région de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de cacahouète, de patate, et de galette. Les femmes du groupe DANAYA sont à leur premier prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente BINTOU la première personne à partir de la droite dans le rang assis est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de cacahouète. Elle compte acheter  150 kg d’arachide non décortique pour faire des cacahouètes et des sachets en plastiques pour son emballage, chez les grossistes à Konobougou.  La vente se fait à son domicile et parfois en ambulante en espèce et en crédit à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 10 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The group DANAYA is composed of married women, who average 28 years of age and 3 children each. The women all live in traditional families in the village of Djoni, Commune de Konobougou, Préfecture de Barouéli, Région de Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). And they know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They work in food service and do commerce in peanuts, sweet potatoes, and galettes.


The women of the group DANAYA are on their first solidarity loan. To satisfy the enormous demand from their customers, they turn to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. These funds will be used to purchase their merchandise as cited above.

This client, BINTOU, who is sitting first from the right in the photo, is illiterate. She is currently a vendor of  peanuts. She intends to purchase 150 kg of unshelled peanuts for processing and some plastic bags as packaging material. At her home and sometimes by hawking, the retail sales are made to a mixed customer base paying with cash or credit. She plans on making a monthly profit of 10,000 francs CFA that will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase peanuts

loans.name: Fuifui

texts.en: Fuifui is a 34 year old woman with 3 children. She has a small plantation and grows Plantation to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Fuifui has requested a loan to buy chain saw, chemicals, fertilizers for her plantation business, cement for her home renovation, to buy new school uniforms for her kids. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011 With her profits, Fuifui hopes to improve/extend her plantation business.

loans.use: to buy chain saw, chemicals, fertilizers, cement, kids school uniforms.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DANAYA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 31 ans, et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Djoni, commune de Konobougou, préfecture de Barouéli, Région de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de céréale, de savon, de beignet, et de lait. Les femmes du groupe DANAYA sont à leur sixième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente BAH , la première personne à partir de la droite dans le rang des assis est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de beignet. Elle compte acheter 1 sac de mil, du beurre de karité, et des sachets plastiques chez les grossistes à Konobougou. La vente se fait à son domicile et parfois en ambulante en espèce et en crédit à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 10 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The group DANAYA is composed of married women, who average 31 years of age and 3 children each. The women all live in traditional families in the village of Djoni, Commune de Konobougou, Préfecture de Barouéli, Région de Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). And they know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They work in food service and do commerce in grains, soap, beignets, and milk.


The women of the group DANAYA are on their sixth solidarity loan. To satisfy the enormous demand from their customers, they turn to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. These funds will be used to purchase their merchandise as cited above.

This client, BAH, who is sitting first from the right in the photo, is illiterate. She is currently a vendor of  beignets. She intends to purchase a sack of millet, shea butter, and plastic bags from wholesalers in Konobougou. At her home and sometimes by hawking, the retail sales are made to a mixed customer base paying with cash or credit. She plans on making a monthly profit of 10,000 francs CFA that will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase the ingredients for making beignets

loans.name: Odonchimeg

texts.en:
Mrs.Odonchimeg is 24 years old lives with her husband and a son in their Ger, traditional nomadic yurt, in Uvs province, Mongolia. Her husband Otgonhuu provides taxi service in town during winters and works at construction site during the construction season. 
Odonchimeg has been working as saleswoman in groceries store for a while and now she is planning on running her husband's taxi service business in town while her husband works at construction site. She and her husband is saving small amount every month to open a groceries store of their own. She is now requesting loan of MNT 800,000 to purchase spare parts and tires to run a taxi service business town to increase their family income. Odonchimeg and her husband are hardworking, happy couple.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and tires to run a taxi service business town to increase their family income

loans.name: Tausala

texts.en: Tausala is 45 years old and married with 3 children. She runs a small business selling Meat buns, pan cakes, pastries in her community and has been doing this for 4 years. Tausala has requested a loan to buy more sacks of flour, yeast, sugar, cooking oil, baking powder, yeast, milk, gas stove, frying pan. She joined SPBD to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Tausala will improve/extend her business, and also is able to provide for her family's immediate needs.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of flour, yeast, sugar, cooking oil, baking powder, yeast, milk, gas stove, frying pan

loans.name: Marta Irene

texts.es: Marta vive junto con su familia en casa propia, ella  se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol tiene muchos años de dedicarse a la agricultura por lo que se ha hecho de mucha experiencia en el rubro, es muy conocida en la zona y ya tiene buena clientela pues obtiene las mejores cosechas, por lo tanto comercia producto de primera calidad y a precios muy accesibles, además el servicio es inigualable, Marta se caracteriza por su gran amabilidad, es una mujer emprendedora con muchas ganas de salir adelante, piensa que aprovechar las oportunidades lo llevaran un paso más adelante del éxito; en la última siembra no obtuvo las ganancias esperadas y esta vez quiere aumentar la producción, pero necesita de un apoyo de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que es que muestra la fotografía para seguir con sus siembras. Ella tiene referencias de tener una moral intachable, responsable y de muy buena paga, confía que podrá responder a la deuda y al mismo tiempo podrá darle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en: Maria lives with her family in their own house. She grows corn and beans. She has worked in agriculture for many years, and so she has much experience in this area. She is very well known in her zone, and she has good customers, since she obtains the best harvests and consequently sells products of the best quality at very affordable prices. Furthermore, her service is unequaled. Maria is characterized by her great friendliness. She is an entrepreneurial woman with a great will to advance. She thinks that taking advantage of opportunities will take her one step further toward success. In the last planting, she did not obtain the expected earnings, and this time she wants to increase production, but she needs the support of some capital, and for this reason she is applying to Integral for a loan that will allow her to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, pest controls, herbicides, etc., and to improve the land, which is shown in the photograph, in order to continue with her plantings. She has references of having impeccable morals, is responsible, and has a record of very good payment. She is confident that she will be able to return the debt, and at the same time she will be able to give her family a full life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, pest controls, herbicides, etc, and improve the land

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase spare parts and repair his vehicle to start his business and also purchase some silk and other materials to his wife's business

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 34 ans, et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Djoni, commune de Konobougou, préfecture de Barouéli, Région de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréale, de savon, d’habillement, du beurre de karité, et de fruits et légume. Les femmes du groupe BENKADI sont à leur sixième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente INA  la deuxième personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang debout est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de beurre de karité. Elle compte acheter 32 kg de beurre de karité sur place avec les femmes du village. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce à Konobougou à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 13 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The group BENKADI is composed of married women, who average 34 years of age and 4 children each. The women all live in traditional families in the village of Djoni, Commune de Konobougou, Préfecture de Barouéli, Région de Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). And they know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They do commerce in grains, soap, clothing, shea butter, and fruit & vegetables.


The women of the group BENKADI are on their sixth solidarity loan. To satisfy the enormous demand from their customers, they turn to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. These funds will be used to purchase their merchandise as cited above.

This client, INA, who is standing second from the left in the photo, is illiterate. She is currently a vendor of  shea butter. She intends to purchase 32 kg of shea butter locally from women in the village. The retail sales are made to a mixed customer base paying with cash in Konobougou. She plans on making a monthly profit of 13,000 francs CFA that will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase shea butter locally from women in the village

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase inventories from Erlian, China to sell at her rental stall

loans.name: Ana Miriam

texts.es: Ana de 37 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con su hijo, ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol desde hace varios años y eso le ha dado la experiencia necesaria para asistir sus cultivos, sus cosechas las comercializa en los mercados de granos basicos que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar. Ana solicita un credito para poder mejorar el terreno donde piensa hacer su siembra y comprar los insumos necesarios como fertilizantes, herbicidas, abonos, entre otras cosas para tener buenas cosechas y asi el pueda obtener  mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Ana, who is 37 years old, is a single mother. She lives in her own house with her son. She has been growing corn and beans for a number of years, and this has given her the necessary experience to assist her plantings. She sells her harvests in the markets for basic grains that are near her place of residence. With the earnings that she obtains from her sales, she manages to pay her household expenses. Ana is applying for a loan to be able to improve the land where she is thinking of doing her planting and to buy the necessary supplies such as fertilizers, herbicides, and compost, among other items, in order to have good harvests and thus obtain better earnings in order to give her family better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, herbicides, and compost, among other items.

loans.name: Hava

texts.en: Hava is a member of the vulnerable ethnic-Egyptian community who lives in southeastern Albania. She is very poor, which in her country means she makes no more than $2/day. She needs this loan to make some basic home improvements and is almost begging for your financial help. She is the widowed mother of three who works as a cleaner on different days of the week. Here it is what she said during the interview with the branch assistant: “I have been trying to get out of poverty, yet at no avail even though I have worked hard and have done my very best to find another labor job that would offer more money.”

loans.use: to make basic home repairs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add a dairy cow to his existing herd of two cows and a baby calf.

loans.name: Noel Hernesto

texts.es:
Noel Ernesto es un joven de 29 años, originario del municipio de El Sauce, un poblado ubicado a 180 kilómetros de la capital de Nicaragua.
A pesar de ser muy joven es bien responsable en su trabajo y con su familia, ya que está casado y es padre de un pequeño que estudia el tercer nivel de preescolar.
Noel se desempeña como profesor de primaria en una escuelita de una comunidad muy alejada del municipio que le toca ir en motocicleta para poder estar puntual en su trabajo, donde los habitantes son de escasos recursos que apenas cosechan para su sobrevivencia. 
Noel en este momento tiene la necesidad de un crédito para comprar medicamento y mejorar la salud de su niño, ya que no ha asistido a la escuela por estar enfermo y con lo poco que gana no le alcanza para cubrir estos gastos que se dan por emergencia en la familia, por lo que recurrió a Ceprodel en busca de un financiamiento con apoyo de los inversionistas KIva.
Espera y confía en Dios que estas personas de buen corazón apoyen su solicitud para que su pequeño se cure pronto.
texts.en:
Noel Ernesto is a young man who is 29 years of age. He is originally from the town of El Sauce, which is located 180 kilometers away from the Nicaraguan capital.

Despite his age, this young man is very responsible in his work and with his family. He is married and is the father of a young son who is in the third level of preschool.

Noel works as a teacher at a primary school in a community that is located far from the city. Therefore, he must travel by motorcycle in order to get work on time. The residents of that community have limited resources and barely harvest enough for their own survival.

At the moment, Noel needs a loan so that he can buy medicine in order to improve his son’s health. He has not attended school because of illness, but what little Noel earns is not enough to cover the expenses related to this family emergency. For this reason, he has approached CEPRODEL in search of a loan and the support of the Kiva lenders.

He hopes and trusts in God that good-hearted people will support his request so that his little one can get well soon.

loans.use: to buy medicine for his son.

loans.name: Jinna

texts.en: Jinna is a married and the mother of two adult sons. She lives with her family in the town of San Miguel, Bohol where she earns a living by cooking and selling peanut rolls (or crushed sweetened peanuts that are rolled in a lumpia wrapper and fried). Jinna has been in this business for several years now and is requesting a loan to buy ingredients such as peanuts, brown sugar and cooking oil. This will allow her to increase her income and improve her family's life.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as peanuts, brown sugar and cooking oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies (putty, polishing compound, soldering irons, solders, etc.)

loans.name: Timoteo

texts.en:
Timoteo is a farmer from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. Timoteo has been engaged in a vegetable farming business for more than 20 years now. This is the source of his income.

Timoteo is asking for a loan  to buy more seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides. With this loan, he will be able to improve the productivity of his farm, thus augmenting his harvest and yield.

loans.use: to buy more seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for a more efficient cooking energy package

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in the year 2011, and she appreciates the programs, services and continuous education of the co-op. She is a member in good standing and very active in attending the various programs and services that the Cooperative offers. 

She is requesting a loan in the amount of 14,000 PHP (Philippines pesos). This loan is intended to buy additional basic commodities for her sari-sari (general) store.

Delia dreams of nothing more than to have a happy, healthy life and an adequate income out of her business.

loans.use: to buy additional basic commodities for her sari-sari (general) store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for a Liquefied Petroleum Gas complete cooking set

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
This San Antonio businessman restores old outdoor furniture into a marvelous piece of art.

Albert believes everything can be made beautiful with a little tender, love and care (TLC).  Three months ago, he opened his business Outdoor Furniture Restoration because he had the desire to work for himself.   

Albert has the eye to see the beauty in any piece of furniture that can be restored to its original state or turned into a new piece unlike anything you have ever seen.  Albert’s dream of owning his own business became a reality when he visited SCORE, a local San Antonio organization that provides business counseling for entrepreneurs.  After a brief discussion, Albert was directed to Accion Texas to apply for a microloan. 
 
The microloan Albert received allowed him to open his business, begin creating marketing collateral, purchase a few old furniture pieces to start his inventory and pay for tools needed to restore each piece of furniture.   Currently, he is the only employee and plans to expand once he gains more clients.  Albert says, “The Accion loan allowed me to reach two goals quickly, to work for myself and continue my business.”

loans.use: To purchase furniture pieces, marketing and marketing collateral and tools to restore the furniture.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a married woman and a mother of three children from San Miguel, Bohol. She has been engaged in farming for several years now. This is her only source of income.
 
Marites is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides. With this, she will be able to improve the productivity of her farm, thus augmenting her harvest and yield.
 
In the future, Marites hopes to expand her farm so that it will generate more revenue necessary for the needs of the family, especially for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en: Rogelio is a motorcycle driver from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. He is a married man and has six children who are still attending school. His wife operates a sari-sari or variety store business. Rogelio is asking for a loan to buy spare parts for the motorcycle like wheels, tires, chains, nuts and bolts, and additional stocks for the store like canned goods, candies, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries. With this loan, he will be able to improve and maintain the good working condition of his motorcycle, and his wife will expand the variety of her stock in her store. Rogelio has hopes of making his business a success so that it will generate more income necessary for the needs of the family, especially for the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the motorcycle like wheels, tires, chains, nuts and bolts, and additional stocks for the store like canned goods, candies, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries.

loans.name: Herculina

texts.en:
Herculina runs a sari-sari or variety store business, selling various goods and items to the people in her community in Trinidad, Bohol. She is a married woman and a mother of three children. Herculina has been in the business for several years now. This is the source of her income.

Herculina is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, candies, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking seasonings and other items. Through this, she will be able to improve the variety of her stock, thus augmenting her sales and income. In the future, Herculina has hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, candies, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking seasonings and other items

loans.name: Joralyn

texts.en:
Joralyn is 37 years old, married and a resident of Lower Langcangan, Oroquieta City, Philippines. She earns a living through her sari-sari store. 

She has been a member of PMPC for two years and enjoys the privileges of being a member of the Cooperative. Now she is applying a loan of PHP 8,000 to purchase more stock of goods for her business.

Joralyn deeply wishes to maintain her membership in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase goods for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is  49 years old and a married resident of Taboc Norte, Oroquieta City, Philippines. She earns a living through direct selling. 

She has been a member of PMPC for three years and enjoys the privileges being a member of the Cooperative. Now, she is applying a loan of 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy additional items and materials for her business.

Editha deeply wishes to maintain as a member in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase additional items and materials for her business

loans.name: Genara

texts.en: Genara earns a living through her sari-sari (variety) store business, selling various goods and items to the people in her place. Genara is a married woman and has six children. Genara has operated her store for more than ten years now, and this is the source of her income. Genara is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, soaps, toiletries, biscuits, soda and beverages, snack foods, cooking ingredients, etc. Genara hopes that this loan will help her to increase her income and profit. She also wants to save money for the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, soaps, toiletries, biscuits, soda and beverages, snack foods, cooking ingredients, etc.

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo, age 46, is from Tubod, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. He is married, and has kids. He earns a living through quarrying, and later on engaged in the sand and gravel business. The business is doing well and so far it enables him to provide for his family's needs.

Romeo has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for 2 years and enjoys the privileges of being a member of the Cooperative. Now, he is applying a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to purchase other equipment needed to use for quarrying. Romeo deeply wishes to expand his business someday and repay his obligations with PMPC in a timely manner.

loans.use: to purchase equipment needed for his sand and gravel business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a selection of diary and also to sell food

loans.name: Luz Janeth

texts.es: Luz de 39 años, es separada y tiene tres hijos por los cuales seguir sustentando, es una mujer trabajadora y desde hace varios años aprendió a confeccionar en forma empírica y actualmente tiene un taller de confección a terceros y genera otros dos empleos y en temporadas altas debe contratar otras cuatro personas más debido a la alta demanda de trabajo. Su sueño es multiplicar sus ingresos económicos,  darle el mejor estudio a sus hijos y una vida de mejor calidad, ampliar su taller para tener mayor producción, generando empleo a otros y para ello necesita comprar una máquina recubridora, para lo cual ella solicitó dicho préstamo, ella también terminará de cancelar un saldo a la Corporación.
texts.en: Luz is 39 years, separated from her husband and has three children to feed. She is a hardworking woman who learned to sew a number of years ago and now has a seamstress shop that has two other employees and during busy times has four more workers due to the high demand. Her dreams are to increase her income, give her children a better education and a better life, and expand her shop to increase production and hire more workers, and to do that she needs to purchase another sewing machine. That is the reason she is requesting the loan, and she also plans to finish paying off an existing credit balance with the corporation.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and pay off her existing credit balance.

loans.name: Tarita

texts.en:
Tarita joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in the year 2008 and she appreciates the programs, services and continuous education of the Co-op. She is a member in good standing and very active in attending the various programs and services that the Cooperative offers. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 35,000.00 Philippine pesos (PHP). This loan is intended to buy materials for the renovation of her house.
Tarita dreams of nothing more than to have a happy, healthy life and an adequate income out of her  business.

loans.use: to purchase materials for the renovation of her house

loans.name: Medreen

texts.en: Medreen is 29 years old having 4 children. She sells food stuffs like salt, soda on a small scale and also trades in cocoa as a source of additional income to her family. She serves the people around her with her products. Medreen works very hard amidst bad season changes that affect her cocoa output. She has a vision of buying land in future. Medreen intends to use the loan to buy food stuffs and cocoa to sell.

loans.use: to buy food stuffs and cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Reymundo

texts.en: Reymundo is 36 years old and single. He lives in a rural community and manages a gasoline station within the town proper. He aims to become successful and financially stable to help his parents and save for his future. He has been in the business for almost one year and he plans to further improve it in order to satisfy his customers. Having insufficient capital, he is seeking a loan of 15,000 Philppine pesos (PHP) to buy additional stocks of gasoline to sell. Through this loan, he is hoping that someday he will be able make the business profitable.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of gasoline to sell

location.town: Brgy. San Geronimo, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Micheal

texts.en: Micheal aged thirty eight years lives in Hoima Uganda.He is married with seven children and five attend school. He got money from farming and started waragi business.His family goal is to educate his children as his business goal is to expand his business into new markets only to be challenged by poor roads that make transportation of his products difficult. Michael is thus accessing credit to buy a motorcycle for transport.

loans.use: buy a motorcycle for transport.

loans.name: Ángela María

texts.es: Ángela, soltera de 52 años, tiene dos hijos mayores de edad. Desde hace 20 años estudió diseño y patronaje, y ese fue su empeño y emprendimiento trabajar desde su casa para estar al cuidado de sus pequeños hijos Ángela se inició en el gremio de las confecciones y poco a poco fue adquiriendo sus máquinas y trabajando a terceros, pudo sacar adelante a su familia. Su sueño es mejorar su taller y hacerle reparaciones, por esto solicita el crédito  en la Corporación para cambiar el piso del taller y darle una mejor apariencia y confort para recibir a sus clientes ya que ha tenido buena trayectoria y realiza gran variedad de vestuarios con telas importadas para fiestas y matrimonios, y también adquirir gran cantidad de insumos para sus trabajos como (telas, pedrerías, hijos, franjas, etc). Esto dará mayores garantías de que sus ingresos seguirán en aumento y disfrutar así de la vida que se merece junto con su familia.
texts.en: Ángela, a single woman of 52, has two adult children. She studied pattern and design 20 years ago and then endeavored to work from home as she cared for her young children. Ángela started in the sewers' guild and little by little acquired her machines and gained work as she made headway for her family. Her dream is to improve her shop and make repairs, which is why she is requesting the loan. She plans to replace her shop's floor to give it a better appearance and make it more comfortable to receive customers since she is on a good trajectory and makes a wide variety of clothes with imported fabrics for parties and weddings. She also plans to purchase a large number of supplies such as fabrics, gemstones, thread and bands. This will give her greater assurance that her income will keep growing and she can enjoy the life she deserves along with her family.

loans.use: to replace her shop's floor and acquire a large number of supplies, such as fabrics, gemstones and thread.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is a 37 year old man with 8 children living in Bundibugyo-Uganda. He transports people using his motor cycle as he practices farming in cocoa production to earn a living. He works hard but faces a challenge of competition from other producers and seasonality changes which affect the cocoa business output. His dream is to buy many motorcycles so as to increase his income. He intends to use the loan to buy cocoa to sell this peak season.

loans.use: to buy cocoa to sell this peak season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase necessary materials to make repairs as well as stock his warehouse with a variety of products.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
This is Jennifer, 45, resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to nelson, a worker abroad and they have children. She manages their household while operating the business.  At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Jennifer operates a tailoring business. She mainly offers curtains, bed sheets, blankets and other home trapping. Seasonal demands for clothing like uniforms and such are available all year round. She also does repairs and alterations. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php8, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other items needed in her business.
 
Jennifer hopes to have more customers and dreams to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fabric, cloth, thread, needles and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en: Dorothy a single hardworking mother lives in Hoima Uganda.She is charged with a responsibility of taking care of three children. She deals in Textiles and earns side income from farming (gnuts). She desires to see her business grow only to be challenged by competition, high transport costs coupled with limited capital that all hinder her business growth. Dorothy is acquiring a loan to buy more clothes to sell..

loans.use: buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Saidai

texts.ru: Саидаи мама двоих малышей и верная жена. Ее муж работает диспетчером в автовокзале. Ее малышам 1 и 2 годика. Саидаи с мужем, детьми и родителями мужа живет в маленьком районе городка Куляб. Она любит семьи и старается сидя дома принести пользу. Саидаи сидит дома и следит за детьми. Она решила не отставать от традиций и посадить очередной весенний урожай. Но из-за финансовых издержек семейного бюджета ей не удастся самостоятельно посадить урожай. По этой причине Саидаи просит кредит для купли всех необходимый средств (семена, удобрения). Поддержите ее.
texts.en: Saidai is a mother of two small kids and a loyal wife.  Her husband works as a dispatcher at an auto station.  Her children are 1 and 2 years old.  Saidai, her husband, their children and her husband's parents live in small district in the city of Kulob.  She loves her family and always tries to provide a benefit staying home.  Saidai stays at home and watches the children.  She decided to keep up with traditions and plant the next spring sowing, but due to financial limitations of the family budget, she will not be able to plant the harvest independently.  This is why Saidai is requesting this loan to buy all of necessary items (seeds, fertilizers).  Support her.

loans.use: to buy necessary items for planting the spring harvest

loans.name: Deme Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DEME est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 35 ans, et 2 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de de Djoni, commune de Konobougou, préfecture de Baroueli, Région de Ségou,(quatrième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréale, de sel, d’argile, et d’article divers. Les femmes du groupe DEME sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente SIGA  la personne assise est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse d’argile pour faire des poteries. Elle compte acheter 4 sacs d’argile sur place avec les femmes du village. La vente se fait en gros et en espèce à Konobougou, a une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 20 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The Deme group is composed of married women, who on average are 35 years old with two children. They all live in traditional families in the village of Djoni, in the  Konobougou district, part of the Baroueli Prefecture, in the Segou Region (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They met through kinship, neighborhood ties and friendship. They sell cereal, salt, clay, and various other items.

The women in the Deme group are on their second group loan. In order to meet the huge demand of their customers, they call upon Soro Yiriwaso. Loan amounts will be used to buy the goods already mentioned.

The member who is sitting is Siga. She is illiterate, and is currently a vendor of clay used to make pottery. She intends to buy four bags of clay from local village women. Sales are conducted wholesale against cash in Konobougou, to a mixed clientele. 

She expects to make monthly profits of 20,000 CFA francs, which will be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: buy clay

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en: Jackson aged forty two lives in Hoima Uganda.He is married with one child.He is a poultry farmer which is supplemented by piggery and selling small fish commonly known as "Mukene". His dream is to diversify business and become a model farmer in his area.High prices of poultry feeds affect his business. Jackson is accessing credit to buy chicks for his poultry business.

loans.use: buy chicks for his poultry business.

loans.name: Moreen

texts.en: Moreen is a married with 2 children living in Bundibugyo-Uganda. She trades in cocoa business and sells it to friends and neighbors in her area. She is a hard working woman that even if negative changes in the seasons affect her cocoa output she still works hard to earn a living. Moreen dreams of building a permanent house and needs a loan to buy more cocoa for selling.

loans.use: to buy more cocoa for selling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 23-year-old single man, who works as a team leader and operating cashier in a restaurant since February 2012, with five years of experience in  the same domain.
Hassan is a energetic person, well known and liked by most of the customers and employers, he puts a lot of effort to develop his career, in order to promote and stay capable of paying for his university fees.
Today, Hassan is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to pay for his university educational costs, to stay capable of continuing his studies.
He will work hard to make sure that he'll make his dream of graduating come true, to move on with his specialized studies career.

loans.use: To pay for his university educational costs, to stay capable of continuing his studies

loans.name: Comadres Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “COMADRES” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Mary es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de fertilizantes, venta de CD’s y DVD’s, venta de carne, venta de salchipapas, tienda de abarrotes, venta de medias.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Mary es integrante, ella indica que es el siete años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de un familiar que era socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de carne; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió desde niña, ya que el mismo era un negocio familiar, a sus diez y seis años decide emprender un negocio independiente.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de carne por mayor) que adquirirá de las distribuidoras de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro y la buena atención en el área de salud que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Comadres” (Godmothers) is starting its third loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana Community Center. This group consists of eight members and is led by a Board of Directors in which Sra. Mary is the president. The members of the Communal Bank engage in different businesses such as selling fertilizers, selling CDs and DVDs, selling meat, selling “salchipapas” (sausage and potatoes), managing a grocery store, and selling stockings.

This loan will benefit small entrepreneurs such as Sra. Mary. She says that she joined Pro Mujer seven years ago after receiving an invitation from a relative who was also a member of the organization. Mary currently has a business in which she sells meat. She became knowledgeable about this type of work when she was a girl since it was a family business. At the age of 16, she decided to establish her own independent business.

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying meat in bulk. She will acquire her products from the distributors in the city of El Alto and then sell them from her retail space. Working in this manner enables her to generate income in order to support her family. Mary is in a common-law relationship and has one child.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Mary said that she enjoys the savings and the excellent health services that are offered by the organization.

loans.use: to buy meat in bulk.

loans.name: Ashurbibi

texts.ru: Ашурбиби сельская женщина из района Яван. Она в течение 5 лет является членом дехканского хозяйства и занимается растениеводством. Ее муж предоставляет услуги мастера по ремонту домов. У Ашурбиби двое сыновей и трое дочерей. Все дочери замужем и живут отдельно своей жизнью. В данный момент Ашурбиби готовит землю для посевных работ. Ей усердно в этом деле помогают муж и сын. Ашурбиби просит кредит, чтобы закупить качественные семена, минеральные удобрения и топливо. Летом она хочет собрать богатый урожай и получить хорошую прибыль.
texts.en: Ashurbibi is a country woman from the Yavan district.  She has been a member of the dekhan farm and involved in agriculture for 5 years.  Her husband provides housing repair services.  Ashurbibi has two sons and three daughters.  All of the daughters are married and live their lives separately.  At the present time, Ashurbibi is preparing the land for sowing work.  Her husband and son are diligently helping her.  Ashurbibi is requesting this loan to buy quality seeds, mineral fertilizers and fuel.  She wants to gather a rich harvest in the summer and earn a good profit.

loans.use: to buy quality seeds, mineral fertilizers and fuel

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
This is Susan, 37, resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Mirasole, a mechanic and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Susan operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a Php12,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Susan dreams that her business will last longer and hopes that her children will finish their studies.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Nafama Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe NAFAMA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 35 ans, et 2 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Djoni, commune de Konobougou, préfecture de Baroueli, Région de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréale, de condiment, de galette, de savon, d’habillement, et d’article divers. Les femmes du groupe NAFAMA sont à leur sixième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente ADAM, la deuxième personne à partir de la droite dans le rang des debout est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de galette. Elle compte acheter 1 sac de mil, et du beurre de karité, à Konobougou. La vente se fait à son domicile en espèce et en crédit à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 11 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvestir dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The Nafama group is composed of married women, who on average are 35 years old with two children. They all live in traditional families in the village of Djoni, in the Konobougou district, part of the Baroueli Prefecture, in the Segou Region (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They met through kinship, neighborhood ties and friendship. They sell cereal, condiments, soap, clothing, and various other items.

The women in the Nafama group are on their sixth group loan. In order to meet the huge demand of their customers, they call upon Soro Yiriwaso. Loan amounts will be used to buy the goods already mentioned.

The member who is standing second from the right is Adam. She is illiterate, and is currently a vendor of flatcakes. She intends to buy one bag of millet and some shea butter in Konobougou. Sales are conducted from her home, for cash and on credit to a mixed clientele.

She expects to make monthly profits of 11,000 CFA francs, which will be reinvested in the business activity.

loans.use: Buy ingredients to make flatcakes

loans.name: Sobhiya

texts.en:
Sobhiya is a 51-year-old married lady, who has been working in baking the special traditional Lebanese Saj bread since thirteen years ago. She is well known in her region with the special quality of bread she bakes and she works hard on developing her business as much as she can to make sure that she can reply to her increasing number of customers.
Sobhiya is specialized in baking Saj bread (which is also known as Shrak, baked on a domed or convex metal griddle)and special Saj Manakish with special toppings upon customers' requests.
Sobhiya is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to rent a nearby  garden and establish a traditional bakery on it with special seats for customers to sit and enjoy their traditionally baked bread and delicious Manakish.
This is her second cycle as Al Majmoua borrower, her previous loan helped her a lot in increasing her business capital. She is anxiously looking forward for this loan, which she believes is going to develop her  socioeconomic situation and attract more customers.
She will make sure to diversify her products and reply to her customers increasing needs.

loans.use: To rent a nearby  garden and establish a traditional bakery on it with special seats for customers to sit and enjoy their traditionally baked bread and delicious Manakish

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en: Jimmy is a 28 year old married and hardworking man living in Kagadi-Uganda with 3 children aged between 8 and 7 years and all attend school. He has been operating a mini-depot of sodas to generate funds and satisfy his family needs. He also earns from a hardware shop and produce selling and is challenged by inadequate capital. Jimmy hopes to construct a good residential house and is asking for a loan to buy crates of sodas for sale.

loans.use: to buy crates of sodas for sale

loans.name: La Finca Group

texts.es:
Noel, tiene 23 años de edad, es soltero, tiene un hijo y reside junto a su familia en una aldea de la comunidad de Talgua, Lempira. Siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura cultivando café, esta producción la vende a los intermediarios en la misma zona. Ha solicitado un tercer préstamo por 10,000 lempiras en forma grupal, con el fin de comprar fertilizantes para su finca y cultivar mas plantilla. Siendo su meta aumentar la producción y los ingresos.
El grupo se llama La Finca, que esta integrado por cuatro miembros, quienes viven en la misma zona y se dedican al cultivo de café. El préstamo grupal es por 28,000 lempiras para abonar la finca. En la foto esta Selvin a la izquierda, Simeón, Lurbin y Noel a la derecha.
texts.en:
Noel is 23 years old, single, and has one child. He and his family live in a neighborhood in the community of Talgua, Lempira. Noel has always worked in agriculture by growing coffee. Whatever he produces is sold to brokers who are from the same area. Noel is requesting his third loan in the amount of 10,000 HNL as part of a formal group. He intends to buy fertilizers for his farm and cultivate more plants. His goal is to increase his production and his earnings.

This group is called “La Finca” (The Farm) and consists of four members who live in the same area and engage in the cultivation of coffee. The group loan totals to the amount of 28,000 HNL and will be used for fertilizers. In the photo from left to right are Selvin, Simeón, Lurbin, and Noel.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for growing coffee.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 24-year-old single lady, who is responsible for the living of four members of her family, whom she represents their sole breadwinner.
