Zeinab is employed in a dairy products manufacturing company since 2008, and she is doing just fine. She is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to pay for the necessary maintenance and construction needs at her parents' house to keep it a healthy living place.
She hopes that one day with her special talent and experience in her domain to start her own business and develop her family's socioeconomic situation.

loans.use: To pay for the necessary maintenance and construction needs at her parents' house to keep it a healthy living place

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en: Joshua is a hardworking married man living in Kagadi-Uganda with 6 children aged between 25 to 6 years and all attend school. He has been operating a piggery and cattle projects to generate funds and meet school dues on time. He also earns salary from teaching and from Red Cross and hopes to complete his house but he is challenged by price fluctuations and hiked school requirements.  To the lenders, Joshua thankful for the financial support as one of his children has already graduated and intends to use the loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials so that he can lay down a concrete floor and repair the roof of his house.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
Marlene es de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, vive con sus padres, y comenta que trabaja en un local de ventas de electrodomésticos y por la noche va a la facultad.
Ella está estudiando la carrera de Ciencias contables y comenta que su meta futura  montar un Estudio Contable, seguir especializando y obtener buenos ingresos para poder ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar sus cuotas de la universidad y de esa forma poder seguir estudiando de la misma manera en que lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Marlene is from the city of San Lorenzo. She lives with her parents and says that she works at a shop that sells household appliances. Marlene attends school at night.

She is studying for a Bachelor of Science degree in Accounting. Marlene says that her goal for the future is to establish an accounting practice so that she can continue to specialize and earn a good income that will enable her to help her family.

She is requesting this loan so that she can invest in the payment of her university fees. This will enable her to continue studying in the same manner as she has before.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Al Hana Group

texts.en:
Marwa is the featured borrower of Al Hana group, she got along with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, because they have always been neighbors and friends.
Marwa is the first lady from the far right side of the picture, she is a 23-year-old single lady, who is the sole breadwinner to five members of her family.
Marwa works in a bookshop since six years ago, and at the same she puts so much effort on developing her educational skills through educating herself to develop her living. She is studying psychology at the university and is working hard to open her own clinic in the future.
Her applied for loan will be invested in paying for her university education needs and requests (books and other necessary project needs).
As for the other group members, Alfa is the lady at the center 47-year-old single lady the sole breadwinner to seven members of her family, and Sariya is a  28-year-old single lady the first from the left, responsible for the living of five members of her family.

loans.use: To pay for her university education needs and requests (books and other necessary project needs)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to start his business by hiring 5 staffs and purchasing equipment

loans.name: Buyanjargal

texts.en:
Mrs.Buyanjargal is 41 years old lives with her husband and 2 sons in their small house in Tuv province, Mongolia. Her husband works at local company. Her sons attend local schools. 
Buyanjargal has been providing hairdressing service to local clients for 8 years in rental place with her another hairdresser friend. She is very talented and well-known with her friendly and affordable service. She and her husband have made renovation to their house last year to improve their living condition. She is now requesting loan of 1,500,000MNT to purchase shampoo, conditioner and other necessary materials to continue her business smoothly. She is hardworking and diligent woman.

loans.use: to purchase shampoo, conditioner and other necessary materials to continue her business smoothly

loans.name: Buyannemeh

texts.en:
Mrs.Buyannemeh is 47 years old lives with her husband and 2 children in their small house in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her husband is craftsman and run their family business of wooden furniture manufacturing. Her son has graduated his school and now works at local company and her daughter is university student. 
Buyannemeh and her husband started their business in 2008. She sells their products to local customers in local market rental booth. Her husband produces the products and she makes last touches of glazing and burnishing. Their workplace does not have extra insulation and heating is very minimal. She is now requesting loan of 5,000,000MNT to purchase insulation material and heating system to install to their workshop. She is hardworking and diligent woman.

loans.use: to purchase insulation material and heating system to install to their workshop

loans.name: Shorena

texts.en:
Shorena is 38 years old married woman, from village Abedati. She lives with her husband and daughter, both of them are temporarily unemployed. Shorena and her husband engaged in pig breeding and in cultivating plot of agricultural land, where they grow nuts. The family sells grown pigs and nuts locally and generate some income. Shorena wants to enlarge her agricultural business and start dairy farming. For the beginning she requested a loan 1000 GEL for purchasing milked-cow, start producing cheese and sell milk-products locally. Shorena will be able to increase productivity and living condition for her family and also enlarge her business for future. 
The Start Up credit will be a great support for the family, as their income will be significantly increased regards Kiva Lenders.

loans.use: To purchase milked-cow

loans.name: Al Tafaol Group

texts.en:
Raya is the featured borrower of Al Tafaol group, she got along with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, because they have always been neighbors and friends.
Raya is 46-year-old single lady, the first from the right with green veil covering her hair. She has been running two business to make her living. She is specialized in selling flowers since seventeen years ago, and selling chicken since three years.
Raya is a hard worker, well known in her region with the special prices and good quality of products she serves.
Raya is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to support her both established business in a well managed way through increasing her business merchandise with special flowers' seeds, fertilizers and accessories needs, in addition to buying the necessary chicken food and chicken raising needs.
As for the other group members, Maha is the lady at the center, and Cherine is the first from the left.

loans.use: To support her both established business in a well managed way through increasing her business merchandise with special flowers' seeds, fertilizers and accessories needs, in addition to buying the necessary chicken food and chicken raising needs

loans.name: Benkola Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKOLA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 45 ans, et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Teguere, commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de céréale, et de savon. Les femmes du groupe BENKOLA sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente MARIAM, la personne assise est analphabète, elle est actuellement restauratrice. Elle compte acheter du riz, du beurre de karité, de la farine boulangère et des condiments chez les à hebdomadaire Massigui. La vente des plats se fait en espèce chez elle dans sa petite gargote à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 21 000Fcfa, qui sera en partie réinvesti dans l’activité, et le reste pour assurer la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
The Benkola group is composed of married women, who on average are 45 years old with four children. They all live in traditional families in the village of Teguere, in the Massigui district, part of the Dioila Prefecture, in the Koulikoro Region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They met through kinship, neighborhood ties and friendship. They run restaurants, trade cereals and soap.

The women in the Benkola group are on their second group loan. In order to meet the huge demand of their customers, they call upon Soro Yiriwaso. Loan amounts will be used to buy the goods already mentioned.

The member who is sitting is Mariam. She is illiterate, and currently operates a restaurant. She intends to buy rice, shea butter, bread flour and condiments, at the weekly market in Massigui. Food preparations are sold against cash in her small home-based eatery, to a mixed clientele.

She expects to make monthly profits of 21,000 CFA francs, some of which will be reinvested in the business activity, the rest being used to ensure the children's schooling.

loans.use: buy ingredients for food preparations

loans.name: Saadani Group

texts.en:
PRAXEDA,who is in her late 40s is widow with three who are still going to school.  She has been running two projects, a retail shop and a grocery store for seven years now.  She works from 08am to 11pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Praxeda's 11th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy the missing items in the retail shop and started the grocery business.  She has paid back all her loans successfully.  She used the profit to buy a plot of land, paid school fees and covered house hold expenses.  She is doing great with the loan and appreciates for Kiva's supporting their group.  She will use this loan to buy rice, beans, sugar, maize mail, baking flour,beers, sodas, wine, juice and spirits.  She dreams of building her own house.

PRAXEDA will share this loan with her loan group "SAADANI" which has three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, maize mail, baking flour,beers, sodas, wine, juice and spirits.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a 33 year old honest and hardworking married man living in Kagadi-Uganda with 3 children aged 13, 9 and 5 years and all attend school. He has been a town agent since 2011 and he does agriculture too in order to room for career growth and going for further studies. He dreams of owning a business and income growth though challenged by bad attitude from tax payers and a hostile community. Patrick is requesting for a loan to buy a saloon.

loans.use: to buy a saloon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for 3 oxen and 3 calves

loans.name: Asiyati

texts.en: Asiyati aged 26 years with two children lives in Hoima-Uganda. She operates a salon business which she  started  so as to cater for her family needs. She hopes to have a big salon around town doing bridal services.Despite her hard work, Asiyati is challenged by seasons because her business reaches its peak on Christmas and Easter seasons. She is acquiring credit to buy cosmetics to use in her salon.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to use in her salon.

loans.name: Djamadjigui Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DJAMADJIGUI est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 36 ans, et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Teguere, commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, et le commerce de céréales. Les femmes du groupe DJAMADJIGUI sont à leur premier prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO. La cliente SALI, la première personne à partir de la droite dans le rang des debout est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de riz. Elle compte acheter 3 sacs de chez les grossistes à Massigui. La vente se fait à son domicile et parfois en ambulante en espèce et en crédit à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 20 000Fcfa, qui sera utilisé pour assurer les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The Djamadjigui group is composed of married women, who on average are 36 years old with four children. They all live in traditional families in the village of Teguere, in the Massigui district, part of the Dioila Prefecture, in the Koulikoro Region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They met through kinship, neighborhood ties and friendship. They operate restaurants and sell grain cereals.

The women in the Djamadjigui group are on their first group loan. In order to meet the huge demand of their customers, they call upon Soro Yiriwaso. Loan amounts will be used to buy the goods already mentioned.

The member who is standing first from the right is Sali. She is illiterate, and is currently a vendor of rice. She intends to buy three bags of rice from wholesalers in Massigui. Sales are conducted from her home and sometimes as an itinerant vendor, for cash and on credit to a mixed clientele.

She expects to achieve monthly profits of 20,000 CFA francs, which will be used to cover the family's daily expenditures.

loans.use: buy cereals

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret has a retail shop in Hoima Uganda.She is married with two children and both attend school.She works seven days a week.She intends to have developmental projects and educate her children to university in future.Price fluctuations and weather changes affect her business. Margret is accessing credit to buy soap and sugar for sell.

loans.use: buy soap and sugar for sell.

loans.name: Raya Group

texts.en:
Rhea is the featured borrower of Raya Group, she got along with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, because they have always been friends since they arrived to Lebanon to work as housekeepers.
Rhea is a 35-year-old single lady, who puts so much effort to develop her living. She is working as a housekeeper to increase her income and improve her own business back in Philippine.
Rhea's acquired loan from Kiva will be sent to support her rice planting business at her hometown Philippine, she will send the money to her family to buy the necessary planting needs.
Rhea is the lady at the center of the picture, as for the other members, Hannah is the first from the right, and Lileth the first from the left.

loans.use: To support her rice planting business at her hometown Philippine, she will send the money to her family to buy the necessary planting needs

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine is from Vanadzor town. She lives there with her husband (in the photo) and three children. Her elder daughter studies pharmacy at Vanadzor State College. 
Marine applied for the loan to SEF last year for paying her daughter Elen's university tuition. After successfully paying the first loan back, currently Marine has applied for another loan for paying this year's tuition fee of her daughter. The loan will be very helpful for this family and they hope for support of Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter Elen's university tuition.

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe TIESSIRI est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 34 ans, et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Djoni, commune de Konobougou, préfecture de Baroueli, Région de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de céréale, de condiment, de sel, de poisson, de galette, et d’article divers. Les femmes du groupe TIESSIRI sont à leur cinquième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente FATOUMATA  la première personne à partir de la droite dans le rang debout est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de condiment. Elle compte acheter ,5 sacs de feuille de baobab sèche, 3 paniers de tomate, et 20 kg de beurre de karité sur place avec les femmes du village. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce à Konobougou à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 10 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The Tiessiri group is composed of married women, who on average are 34 years old with three children. They all live in traditional families in the village of Djoni, in the Konobougou district, part of the Baroueli Prefecture, in the Segou Region (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They met through kinship, neighborhood ties and friendship. They operate restaurants, sell grain cereals, condiments, salt, fish, flat cakes and various other items.

The women in the Tiessiri group are on their fifth group loan. In order to meet the huge demand of their customers, they call upon Soro Yiriwaso. Loan amounts will be used to buy the goods already mentioned.

The member who is standing first from the right is Fatoumata. She is illiterate, and is currently a vendor of condiments. She intends to buy five bags of dried baobab leaves, three baskets of tomatoes, and 20 kilos of shea butter from local village women. Retail sales are conducted in Konobougou, for cash to a mixed clientele.

She expects to achieve monthly profits of 10,000 CFA francs, which will be reinvested in the business activity.

loans.use: buy condiments

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe TIESSIRI est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 38 ans, et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Teguere, commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, et le commerce de céréale. Les femmes du groupe TIESSIRI sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente MARIAM, la deuxième personne à partir de la droite dans le rang debout est analphabète, elle est actuellement restauratrice. Elle compte acheter du riz, du beurre de karité, des condiments, et de la farine boulangère chez les grossistes à Massigui. La vente des plats se fait en espèce chez elle, dans sa petite gargote à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 76 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The TIESSIRI group is composed of married women; they are on average 38 years old with four children each. They all live in traditional families in Teguere village in the district of Massigui, Dioîla - which is in the Koulikoro region (the second largest state in the republic of Mali)
They came to know one another through family, neighbours and via friends. They offer meals, and trade in cereals. The women from the TIESSIRI group are on their third mutual loan.
With the goal of meeting the significant demand from their customers, they are seeking assistance from Soro Yiriwaso. The funds will be used to purchase the merchandise mentioned here.
MARIAM, standing second from the right in the photo, is completely illiterate, and currently a restaurateur. She intends to purchase rice, shea butter, condiments and bread flour from the wholesalers in Massigui.
She sells her meals for cash from a small eatery at her home, to a mixed customer base. She intends to generate a monthly profit of 76,000 FCFA, which will be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Abir

texts.en:
Abir is a 33-year-old married mother of four children, she is a Palestinian refugee living and working from her home which is located in a Palestinian camp.
Abir has been working in selling beauty products, cosmetics and accessories from her house since eight years ago, she is so helpful and supportive to her husband, to make sure that her children will have the necessary living needs.
She is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise with special cosmetics and accessories newly released as a spring and summer collection.
She will also use part of the loan, to make necessary maintenance at her house to keep it a healthy living place.
She hopes to keep on developing her business to make sure that her family is living happily.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with special cosmetics and accessories newly released as a spring and summer collection

loans.name: Sabah

texts.en:
Sabah is a 48-year-old married mother of three children, she has been working in conserving food as Mouneh and selling it since 2000. Her business is going on just fine, but her family's needs are increasing, that's why she is working hard on establishing another business to make sure that she will stay capable of replying to her family's needs.
Today Sabah is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to start and additional income business to increase her income and develop her family's living, she will start tailoring business, since she has a wide experience in this domain, but she needs the specialized updated machines, to reply professionally to her customers needs.
Sabah is very excited about this challenge and is willing to succeed.

loans.use: To start and additional income business to increase her income and develop her family's living

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia is a 34-year-old married mother of two children, she has been working at her house in selling beauty cosmetics, accessories and perfumes since three years ago.
Nadia is well known in her region with the special products she sells and prices she sets. Her family's needs are increasing, that's why she has to expand her working sector, that's why today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to buy  a car necessary for her working region expansion and business development.
She is very optimistic about this loan, and hope it will meet her expectations.
One day she believes she will be financially capable of establishing her own shop instead of being mobile.

loans.use: To buy  a car necessary for her working region expansion and business development

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet is 34 year old married female. Harriet has got a produce business, groundnuts paste and grinding in Kijura centre since 2004. She also does farming that adds on her income to cater for the family.  Her dream is to develop her business into a modern factory which can pack gnuts paste for export.However she is challenged by high prices, rent, electricity bills and fluctuating power which spoils grinding machine. Harriet will use the loan to buy materials for building.

loans.use: to buy materials for building.

loans.name: Ritah

texts.en: Ritah aged twenty nine lives in Hoima Uganda. She is single with one child. He has a retail shop as her primary business. She desires to have a healthy family and expand her business although price fluctuations hinder her business profits. Ritah is acquiring a loan to buy sugar,match boxes and soap for sell.

loans.use: buy sugar,match boxes and soap for sell.

loans.name: Luis Arturo

texts.es:
El señor Luis, tiene 43 años de edad, vive en una comunidad en el Oriente de Honduras vive con su compañera de hogar y es padre de 2 hijos su actividad es la venta de Productos elaborados de Madera como ser Mesas, Sillas, Camas y Roperos. cuenta con más de 15 años de dedicarse  a este tipo de actividad y tiene una buena clientela.
Don Luis su negocio está ubicado en un lugar muy estratégico de alto comercio, está solicitando el préstamo para la compra una Planta Solar debido a que en la comunidad donde vive no tienen luz eléctrica y espera así  mejorar sus condiciones de vida, uno de sueños es tener su propio Alumbrado está contento con el apoyo que se le está brindado a él y a su familia.
Don Luis con el apoyo que reciba del préstamo le contribuirá a lograr sus sueños.


                                                                            
Trojes, Honduras - Febrero 2014
texts.en:
Luis, 43, lives in a community in the eastern part of Honduras with his common-law wife and two children.  He earns a living selling the wood products he makes such as tables, chairs, beds and wardrobes.  He has been in business for over 15 years and has a good customer base.

Luis, whose business is set up in a very strategic, busy commercial district, is requesting a loan to buy a solar energy station because there is no electricity in the community where he lives.  He wants to improve his living conditions.  One of his goals is to have his own electric lighting.  He is grateful for the support he and his family are receiving, and hopes the support of the loan will contribute toward reaching his goals.


Trojes, Honduras - February, 2014

loans.use: To buy a solar energy station for his house.

loans.name: Hector Jose

texts.es: Héctor tiene 24 años de edad, originario de la ciudad de Quezalguaque. Es un joven soltero, estudia en una de las universidades de la ciudad. Su mayor sueño es culminar sus estudios universitarios y empezar a aportar en su familia. Solicita el crédito para poder pagar sus módulos de finalización de estudios y así lograr obtener su título cumpliendo su sueño más anhelado de su vida. Su plan futuro es adquirir un empleo en donde pueda aplicar sus conocimientos adquiridos.
texts.en: Héctor, 24, is from the city of Quezalguague.  He is single and studies at the city university.  His greatest dream is to finish his university education and begin to contribute to the family.  He is requesting a loan to pay for the final phase of his education so he can graduate and realize the dream he has had all his life.  In the future he wants to get a job where he can use the knowledge he has acquired.

loans.use: To pay for his final phase of education.

loans.name: Timinadia Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe TIMINADIA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 39 ans, et 5 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Teguere, commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de céréale, et de condiment. Les femmes du groupe TIMINADIA sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente DIARRA, la deuxième personne à partir de la droite est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de grain d’arachide. Elle compte acheter  6 sacs d’arachide sur place avec les paysans du village, puis le décortiquer.  La vente se fait en détail et en espèce à Massigui à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 85 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The TIMINADIA group is composed of married women; they are on average 39 years old with five children each. They all live in traditional families in Teguere village in the district of Massigui, Dioîla - which is in the Koulikoro region (the second largest state in the republic of Mali)
They came to know one another through family, neighbours and via friends. They offer meals, and trade in cereals and condiments. The women from the TIMINADIA group are on their third mutual loan.
With the goal of meeting the significant demand from their customers, they are seeking assistance from Soro Yiriwaso. The funds will be used to purchase the merchandise mentioned here.
DIARRA, standing second from the right in the photo, is completely illiterate, and currently a peanut seller. She intends to purchase six sacks of peanuts locally from the villagers, and to shell them.
She sells her peanuts for cash in Massigui, to a mixed customer base. She intends to generate a monthly profit of 85,000 FCFA, which will be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: to purchase peanuts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizers and tools, and hire workers to care for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Fortunato

texts.es:
Fortunato vive en la ciudad de Paucartambo. Esta ciudad se característica por tener paisajes hermosos y ser la ciudad folclórica del departamento del Cusco. La mayoría de los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y crianza de animales. En el mes de julio se celebra la festividad de la virgen de Carmen y llegan de diferentes lugares del Perú para esta fiesta que se extiende por tres días. 

Fortunato durante todo el año se dedica a la agricultura pues tiene varios terrenos de cultivos donde siembra papa, trigo, cebada, avena, habas y otras cosas, él es uno de los fundadores del banco comunal “Nuevo Amanecer” y tiene varios años participando. En esta ciudad no existe entidad financieras permanentes como la Asociación Arariwa entonces él se presta dinero desde hace varios años atrás entonces en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para compra semillas.

Fortunato está agradecido por el apoyo brindado y se compromete a pagar con mucha responsabilidad y puntualidad las cuotas.
texts.en:
Fortunato lives in the city of Paucartambo which is known for its beautiful scenery and for being the "folklore" city of the department of Cusco.  Most of the local people work in agriculture and livestock farming.  In the month of July, here they celebrate the festivity of Our Lady of Carmen and people from different parts of Peru come for the three-day holiday.

During the entire year Fortunato works in agriculture since he has several crop fields where he grows potatoes, wheat, barley, oats, beans and other items.  He is one of the founding members of the communal bank "Nuevo Amanecer" and has been involved for several years.  There are no permanent financial entities in this city so he has received loans through the Arariwa Association.  On this occasion he is requesting a loan to buy seeds.

Fortunato is grateful for the support he is receiving and committed to paying back the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy seeds.

loans.name: Chuisanto 2 Group

texts.es:
Julio (al centro de la fotografía) es un señor casado, de 36 años de edad, vive junto a sus tres hijos, en Santa Catarina Ixtahuacán, Sololá. 
Julio expresa con mucha alegría que se dedica a la venta de banano silvestre, que es un producto muy demandado en su comunidad y por lo mismo su comercialización es rentable. Esta labor la aprendió de sus padres hace 30 años; además es algo que le gusta hacer y es el medio de donde obtiene buenos ingresos y ganancias que le ayudan a contribuir con la economía de su familia.
Ella ha venido realizando esta actividad desde muy joven, y ahora ha adquirido más conocimiento en esta área, así que tomo la decisión de formar un grupo con el objetivo de diversificar sus productos en el mercado y de esta manera obtener un ingreso para mejorar la economía de las familias de los integrantes de su grupo. El préstamo lo utilizaran para la compra de insumos para el mantenimiento de banano.
Su sueño es diversificar su producción sembrando  10 cuerdas ( 0.722 hectáreas) de café.
texts.en:
Julio (in the center of the photograph) is 36, married and lives with his three children in Santa Catarina Ixtahuacán, Sololá.  He says, with much cheerfulness, that he grows wild bananas which is a product in very high demand in his community, so he earns a good profit.  He learned the trade from his parents 30 years ago and it is something he enjoys doing.  He is able to earn a good income and profit to contribute to the family economy.

He has been in this activity since he was very young and now has more expertise in this area, so decided to form a communal bank in order to diversify the products he sells and help earn more income for the families of the group members.  The loan will be used to buy supplies for banana maintenance.

His dream is to diversify production by planting 0.722 hectares of coffee.

loans.use: To buy supplies for his banana crop maintenance.

loans.name: Naneth

texts.en:
Naneth joined the Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in the year 2010. She appreciates the programs, services and continuous education of the co-op. She is a member in good standing and is very active in attending the various programs and services that the cooperative offers. 

She is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 10,000 to purchase additional stock for her business. Naneth dreams of nothing more than to have a happy and healthy life as well as to earn an adequate income from her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her business.

loans.name: Dembagnouma Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DEMBAGNOUMA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 45 ans, et 6 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Biba,préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréale, de condiment, et de d’ah. Les femmes du groupe DEMBAGNOUMA sont à leur vingt cinquième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente SANATA  la première personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang debout est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de grain de dah. Elle compte acheter 2 sacs de dah sur place avec les femmes du village. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce, au marché journalier du village à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 47 000Fcfa, qui sera en partie réinvesti dans l’activité, et le reste pour assurer la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
The DEMBAGNOUMA group is composed of married women; they are on average 45 years old with six children each. They all live in traditional families in Biba village in the district of Dioîla - which is in the Koulikoro region (the second largest state in the republic of Mali)
They came to know one another through family, neighbours and via friends. They trade in cereals, condiments and bissap. The women from the DEMBAGNOUMA group are on their twenty fifth mutual loan.
With the goal of meeting the significant demand from their customers, they are seeking assistance from Soro Yiriwaso. The funds will be used to purchase the merchandise mentioned here.
SANATA, standing on the far left in the photo, is completely illiterate, and currently a seller of bissap seeds. She intends to purchase two sacks of bissap locally from the women of the village.
She makes her sales for cash in the daily market in the village, to a mixed customer base. She intends to generate a monthly profit of 47,000 FCFA, part of which will be reinvested in the business, and the remainder used to fund her childrens' education.

loans.use: to purchase bissap seeds.

loans.name: Kavumbi

texts.en: Kavumbi is a 64 years old female, married with two (2) children aged 17 and 15 years old whom she support. This is her fourth loan of Ksh.80,000 she was introduced to Visionfund Kenya  by the Visionfund officer. She sales Khangas, her business is located at Magarini, she has been in this business for fifteen years and she earns a monthly income of Ksh.19350, she’s planning to use the loan to purchase more khangas to sell to her customers. She will use the profit to expand the business. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to expand her business and educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase more khangas to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Bebiana

texts.en:
Bebiana is a merchant from Bien Unido, Bohol. She is a married woman and a mother of two children. Bebiana operates a sari-sari or convenience store where she sells various goods and items to the people in her area.

Bebiana is asking for a loan to buy more stock of goods to sell in her store such as detergents, toiletries and seasonings. With this loan, she will be able to improve the variety of her stock, which will attract more buyers. In the future, Bebiana hopes to make her business a success to ensure that it provides a sustainable source of income.

loans.use: to buy more stock of goods to sell in her store such as detergents, toiletries and seasonings.

loans.name: Dongie

texts.en: Dongie is a fisherman from the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. He is a married man with three school-aged children. Dongie dreams of improving his fishing business but lacks the capital to do so. He is requesting a loan to buy gasoline, fish nets and fish hooks. With this loan, Dongie will be able to improve his catch thus giving him more fish to sell in the market. With an increased income, Dongie will be able to buy nutritious food for his family and even continue to send his children to school.

loans.use: to buy gasoline, fish nets and fish hooks.

loans.name: Siguitemason Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe SIGUITEMASON est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 43 ans, et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Biba, commune de Biba, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréale, de condiment, d’habillement, et de produit cosmétique. Les femmes du groupe SIGUITEMASON sont à leur vingt cinquième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente SATA, la deuxième personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des debout est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse d’habits. Elle compte acheter 10  pièces de pagnes chez les grossistes à Dioïla. La vente se fait à son domicile et parfois en ambulante en espèce et à crédit à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 13 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The SIGUITEMASON group is composed of married women; they are on average 43 years old with four children each. They all live in traditional families in Biba village in the district of Biba, Dioîla - which is in the Koulikoro region (the second largest state in the republic of Mali)
They came to know one another through family, neighbours and via friends. They trade in cereals, condiments, clothing and cosmetic products. The women from the SIGUITEMASON group are on their twenty fifth mutual loan.
With the goal of meeting the significant demand from their customers, they are seeking assistance from Soro Yiriwaso. The funds will be used to purchase the merchandise mentioned here.
SATA, standing second from the left in the photo, is completely illiterate, and currently a clothing seller. She intends to purchase ten traditional sarong-type 'pagnes' from wholesalers in Dioïla.
She makes her sales for cash and credit, both from her home and also mobile, to a mixed customer base. She intends to generate a monthly profit of 13,000 FCFA, which will be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: to purchase traditional cloth 'pagnes'

loans.name: Benkola Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKOLA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 34 ans, et 5 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de N’Dinkoro, commune de kerela, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréales, de savon moderne, d’habillements, de chaussures, et du sucre. Les femmes du groupe BENKOLA sont à leur premier prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
La cliente AMI, la personne assise au milieu est instruite, elle est actuellement vendeuse de savon moderne. Elle compte acheter 5 cartons de savon chez les grossistes à Fana. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 21 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The BENKOLA group is composed of married women; they are on average 34 years old with five children each. They all live in traditional families in N’Dinkoro village in the district of Kerela, Dioïla - which is in the Koulikoro region (the second largest state in the republic of Mali)
They came to know one another through family, neighbours and via friends. They trade in cereals, soap, clothing, shoes and sugar. The women from the BENKOLA group are on their first mutual loan.
With the goal of meeting the significant demand from their customers, they are seeking assistance from Soro Yiriwaso. The funds will be used to purchase the merchandise mentioned here.
AMI, seated in the middle of the photo, is educated, and currently a soap seller. She intends to purchase five boxes of soap from wholesalers in Fana.
She makes her retail sales for cash from her home, to a mixed customer base. She intends to generate a monthly profit of 21,000 FCFA, which will be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: to purchase soap.

loans.name: Mosoq Allpa Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “MOSOQ ALLPA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gina ella es conviviente y tiene 32 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de taller de estructuras metalicas, la socia realiza trabajos como ventanas, puertas entre otros trabajos, la socia trabaja junto con su esposo, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia en este negocio ya tiene 5 años y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar su taller de estructuras metálicas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar pinturas, sierras y metales.

Los socios que estan pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de venta de chicha, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de animales.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the “MOSOQ ALLPA” communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Cuzco, belonging to the province and department of Cuzco. 

One member is Gina. She is in a common law marriage and is 32 years old. She has 2 children. She works in her business, which is a metal shop. She makes things such as window frames, doors, and more. She works with her husband. Her schedule is from 8:00 a.m until 6:00 p.m. She has been in this business for 5 years and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to ex[and her metal shop. She is asking for the loan to buy paint, saws and metal. 

The members who as pasted onto the group photo had their pictures taken after the meeting because they had to be absent due to work. 
 
The other members work in businesses such as selling chicha, a convenience store, and selling animals.

This member is grateful to those who are a part of her dream in this way and she is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy paint, saws and metal.

loans.name: Djiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DJIGUIYA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 28 ans, et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Chioro Balabougou, commune de Kerela, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréale, de condiment, de savon artisanal, d’habillement, de poisson, de gâteau, et d’article divers. Les femmes du groupe DJIGUIYA sont à leur premier prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente FATOUMATA, la deuxième personne à partir de la droite dans le rang des assis est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de savon artisanal (gabakourouni). Elle compte acheter 100 morceaux de savon chez les grossistes à Fana. La vente se fait à son domicile et parfois en ambulante en espèce et à crédit à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 9. 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The DJIGUIYA group is composed of married women; they are on average 28 years old with three children each. They all live in traditional families in Chioro Balabougou village in the district of Kerela, Dioïla - which is in the Koulikoro region (the second largest state in the republic of Mali)
They came to know one another through family, neighbours and via friends. They trade in cereals, condiments, artisanal soap, clothing, fish, cakes and various items. The women from the DJIGUIYA group are on their first mutual loan.
With the goal of meeting the significant demand from their customers, they are seeking assistance from Soro Yiriwaso. The funds will be used to purchase the merchandise mentioned here.
FATOUMATA, seated second from the right in the photo, is illiterate, and currently a seller of artisanal soap (gabakourouni). She intends to purchase one hundred bars of soap from wholesalers in Fana.
She makes her sales for cash and credit, both from her home and sometimes on a mobile basis, to a mixed customer base. She intends to generate a monthly profit of 9,000 FCFA, which will be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: to purchase artisanal soap.

loans.name: Demerde Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DEMERDE est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 42 ans, et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de N’Dinkoro, commune de kerela, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce, de céréale, de condiment, de charbon, de savon, d’oignon, de gâteau, et d’article divers. Les femmes du groupe DEMERDE sont à leur premier prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente FATOUMATA, la première personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des assis est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de savon artisanal (gabakourouni). Elle compte acheter 1 sac de savon chez les grossistes à Fana. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 9. 000Fcfa, qui sera réinjecté dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The DEMERDE group is composed of married women; they are on average 42 years old with four children each. They all live in traditional families in N’Dinkoro village in the district of Kerela, Dioïla - which is in the Koulikoro region (the second largest state in the republic of Mali)
They came to know one another through family, neighbours and via friends. They trade in cereals, condiments, charcoal, soap, onions, cakes and various items. The women from the DEMERDE group are on their first mutual loan.
With the goal of meeting the significant demand from their customers, they are seeking assistance from Soro Yiriwaso. The funds will be used to purchase the merchandise mentioned here.
FATOUMATA, seated on the far left of the photo, is illiterate, and currently a seller of artisanal soap (gabakourouni). She intends to purchase one sack of soap from wholesalers in Fana.
She makes her retail sales for cash from her home, to a mixed customer base. She intends to generate a monthly profit of 9,000 FCFA, which will be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: to purchase soap.

loans.name: Kolaban Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe KOLABAN est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 34 ans, et 5 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de N’Dinkoro, commune de kerela, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréale, de condiment, de savon, de charbon, d’igname, et d’aliment bétail. Les femmes du groupe KOLABAN sont à leur premier prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
La cliente KADIA, la première personne à partir de la droite dans le rang des assis est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de charbon. Elle compte acheter 15 sacs de charbons de bois sur place avec les paysans du village. La vente se fait en gros et en espèce à Konobougou  aux clients venus de Bamako. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 21 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The KOLABAN group is composed of married women; they are on average 34 years old with five children each. They all live in traditional families in N’Dinkoro village in the district of Kerela, Dioïla - which is in the Koulikoro region (the second largest state in the republic of Mali)
They came to know one another through family, neighbours and via friends. They trade in cereals, condiments, soap, charcoal, yams and animal feed. The women from the KOLABAN group are on their first mutual loan.
With the goal of meeting the significant demand from their customers, they are seeking assistance from Soro Yiriwaso. The funds will be used to purchase the merchandise mentioned here.
KADIA, seated on the far right of the photo, is illiterate, and currently a charcoal seller. She intends to purchase fifteen sacks of charcoal locally from the village folk.
She makes her sales for cash in Konobougou, to customers coming from Bamako. She intends to generate a monthly profit of 21,000 FCFA, which will be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal.

loans.name: Johana Matilde

texts.es:
Ella se llama Johana Matilde, es una niña bogotana, tiene tan solo 20 años de edad, vive con la tía y fue criada por la abuela y vecina, en todo ese tiempo transcurrido cuando tenia 5 años de edad empezó los estudios en la I.E.D. NUEVA COLOMBIA era una buena estudiante, donde a pezar de las adversidades presentadas en la vida logro terminar los estudios con éxito, se graduó de bachiller académica y para ella era de gran orgullo, pues ella sabia que había culminado la meta, meses después cuando todo mundo empezó de nuevo las actividades escolares, ella de nuevo volvía a organizar los  propósitos entre ellos, empezar una carrera no cualquiera si no la que siempre había soñado estudiar, la cual llevaba definiendo hace dos años, que es HOTELERIA Y TURISMO. 
Pasaron 2 años y no le era posible, no contaba con ningún apoyo familiar ni recursos económicos para lograrlo, ella se sentía vacía, desilusionada, sentía tristeza de no poder tener las posibilidades de lograr el sueño, pero no se daba por vencida, porque ella quería ser alguien en la vida, fue entonces cuando tuvo la oportunidad de entrar a estudiar a CAMPO ALTO, empezaba un sueño mas por lograr, ella empezó a trabajar y asi se ayudaba en los estudios, se esforzaba por ser la mejor en el grupo de clase y cumplir con los trabajos, por motivos de trabajo a veces fallaba, pero si no trabajaba no podría seguir estudiando asi culmino el 1 y 2 semestre con esfuerzo  y las ganas de salir adelante, ya que en el ámbito familiar le a tocado sola desde que la abuela falleció, ella tenia tan solo 10 años de edad, pero la vecina siempre le daba apoyo, cuidado y respaldo como nunca lo hizo la familia, para ella era de gran valor, era mas que una amiga, una mama. 
Ahora Johana esta en 3 semestre de la carrera, se siente muy feliz y con ganas de seguir delante de poder lograr terminar la carrera y ser una maestra de ella mientras ella se encuentra haciendo las practicas, ella dice que Dios siempre le da las luchas mas pesadas a los mejores guerreros, por lo tanto las practicas las hace fuera de Bogotá, en Funza, todos los días de lunes a viernes ,para ella es agradable saber que esta cumpliendo el propósito, pero por otra parte surgen mas gastos como los transportes  de todos lo días y los pagos de servicios que le cobran en la casa, que aunque es poco es plata de mas, ella se siente  tensa pero sabe que de alguna manera debe continuar, no le falta nada y además sabe que ya va terminar, ella siempre busca las formas, por ello a hora esta recurriendo a KIVA como una ayuda  y flexibilidad que le daría en los pagos mensuales para poder seguir continuando en los estudios y graduarse ahora técnicamente en la carrera, seria de gran impulso para ella una ayuda que en este caso se le puede dar KIVA, le colaborara por la posición económica, ella agradecería por ayudar a una persona mas en lograr una meta y hacer ese sueño realidad.
texts.en:
This is Johana Matilde. She is from Bogota. She is only 20 years old and lives with an aunt. She was raised by her grandmother and a neighbor. When she was 5 years old, she began to go to school at I.E.D. NUEVA COLOMBIA. She was a good student and despite the adversities that came up in her life she was able to finish her schooling successfully. She graduated from high school and for her that was a source of great pride, because she knew that she had reached her goal. Months later, she started scholarly activities again. She began to organize her goals and among them was starting a major. Not any major, but the one she had always dreamed of studying, which she had been planning out for two years, which is HOSPITALITY AND TOURISM.  
 
Two years went by and it wasn't possible for her. She didn't have any family support or financial resources to achieve it. She felt empty, disillusioned, and sad that she wasn't able to achieve her dream. But she didn't give up, because she always wanted to be someone in life. That was when she had the opportunity to study at CAMPO ALTO. A new dream to achieve was beginning. She started to work and that is how she helped herself go to school. She strived to be the best in the group in class and do the work. Sometimes, because of her job, she had to miss class, but if she didn't work she wouldn't be able to go to school. That was how she finished the 1rst and 2nd semesters, with hard work and eager to get ahead. In her family life, she has had to be alone, since her grandmother died. She was only 10 years old, but the neighbor always supported her, cared for her and backed her up, since he family never did. For her, that was a great value, she was more than a friend, she was a mother. 

Now Johana is in the 3rd semester of her major. She feels happy and eager to get ahead and be able to finish her major and be a master of herself. Now she is doing the practical training. She says that God always gives the heaviest battles to the best warriors, so she is doing her training outside of Bogotá, in Funza everyday from Monday through Friday. For her it is nice to know that she is achieving her purpose, but on the other hand, there are more expenses, like transportation every day, and paying for services that they charge her for in the home. Even though it isn't much, it is still money. She feels tense because she knows that somehow she has to go on, she doesn't have much longer to go and she knows she is going to finish soon. She always looks for the way, but now she is is going to KIVA for help and flexibility in the monthly payments so she can keep going to school and graduate with her degree. This help that KIVA can give her in this case will drive her. It will help her in her financial position. She will be grateful for the help for one more person to achieve a goal and make her dream come true.

loans.use: to pay for a semester's tuition.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 48 year old married man living in Kagadi-Uganda with 9 children aged between 17 and 7 years. He has been dealing in produce selling, farming and motorcycle transport to earn a living. Joseph hopes to educate his children despite price fluctuations and is asking for a loan to buy more maize, beans and rice for resale.

loans.use: to buy more maize, beans and rice for resale

loans.name: Soutoura Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe SOUTOURA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 42 ans, et 6 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Chioro Sakarabougou, commune de Kerela, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréale, de condiment, de savon, de piment, d’oignon, et de galette. Les femmes du groupe SOUTOURA sont à leur premier prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente AMINATA, la première personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des debout est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de piment. Elle compte acheter 10 kg de piments et des sachets plastiques chez les grossistes à Konobougou. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 10 000Fcfa, qui sera utilisé pour assurer les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The SOUTOURA group is composed of married women; they are on average 42 years old with four children each. They all live in traditional families in Chioro Sakarabougou village in the district of Kerela, Dioïla - which is in the Koulikoro region (the second largest state in the republic of Mali)
They came to know one another through family, neighbours and via friends. They trade in cereals, condiments, soap, spices, onions, and pancakes. The women from the SOUTOURA group are on their first mutual loan.
With the goal of meeting the significant demand from their customers, they are seeking assistance from Soro Yiriwaso. The funds will be used to purchase the merchandise mentioned here.
AMINATA, standing on the far left of the photo, is illiterate, and currently a seller of spices. She intends to purchase 10 kgs of spices and some plastic bags from wholesalers in Konobougou.
She makes her retail sales for cash from her home, to a mixed customer base. She intends to generate a monthly profit of 10,000 FCFA, which will be used to cover the family's daily living expenses.

loans.use: to buy spices.

loans.name: Ever

texts.es:
Ever vive en la ciudad de Paucartambo y donde realiza sus actividades económicas. Esta ciudad se característica por tener paisajes hermosos y ser la ciudad folclórica del departamento del Cusco. La mayoría de los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, comercio, ganadería y crianza de animales. En el mes de julio se celebra la festividad de la virgen de Carmen y llegan de diferentes lugares del Perú para esta fiesta que se extiende por tres días. 

Ever durante todo el año se dedica a la agricultura pues tiene varios terrenos de cultivos donde siembra papa, trigo y otras cosas, él es uno de los fundadores del banco comunal “Nuevo Amanecer” y tiene varios años participando. En esta ciudad no existe entidad financieras permanentes como la Asociación Arariwa entonces él se presta dinero desde hace varios años atrás entonces en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para fumigar sus campos de cultivos. 

Ever está agradecido por el apoyo brindado y se compromete a pagar con mucha responsabilidad y puntualidad las cuotas.
texts.en:
Ever lives in the city of  Paucartambo and that is where he does his economic activities. This city is described as having beautiful landscapes and for being a traditional city in the department of Cuzco. Most of the residents work n agriculture, trade, ranching and raising animals. In July, they celebrate the festival of the Virgin of Carmen and people come from different parts of Peru for this festival that lasts for three days. 

During the year, Ever works in agriculture. He has several plots of cropland where he grows potatoes, wheat and more. He is one of the founders of the “Nuevo Amanecer” communal bank and he has been participating in it for several years. In this city, there are no financial entities like Asociación Arariwa so he has been borrowing money for several years. At this time he needs the loan to fumigate his cropland.  

Ever is grateful for the support being offered and committed to making his payments on time and responsibly.

loans.use: to fumigate his crops.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en: Angelina is a 45 year old female living in Masindi, Uganda. She is responsible for taking care of two children. She sells fish and cassava in the market stall a business she started so as to earn income. Angelina has got a dream of having a good home and a healthy family despite the challenge of inadequate capital. Angelina needs a loan to buy more fish and cassava.

loans.use: to buy more fish and cassava.

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe TIESSIRI est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 43 ans, et 6 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Chioro Sakarabougou, commune de Kerela, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréale, de la patte d’arachide, de gâteau, et d’encens. Les femmes du groupe TIESSIRI sont à leur premier prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente FATOUMATA, la première personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des debout est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse d’encens (déodorant traditionnel Woussoula). Elle compte acheter du gueni, du magnokisseni, de l’eau de Cologne, des bouteilles vides et d’autres parfums à Fana. Après 17 jours de traitement, le produit final sera embouteillé et mis au marché. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 12 000Fcfa, qui sera utilisé pour assurer la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
The TIESSIRI group is composed of married women; they are on average 43 years old with six children each. They all live in traditional families in Chioro Sakarabougou village in the district of Kerela, Dioïla - which is in the Koulikoro region (the second largest state in the republic of Mali)
They came to know one another through family, neighbours and via friends. They trade in cereals, peanut butter, cakes and incense. The women from the TIESSIRI group are on their first mutual loan.
With the goal of meeting the significant demand from their customers, they are seeking assistance from Soro Yiriwaso. The funds will be used to purchase the merchandise mentioned here.
FATOUMATA, standing on the far left of the photo, is illiterate, and currently a seller of incense (the traditional deodorant Woussoula). She intends to purchase guéni (a type of fragrant root), some magnon kisseni (an exotic plant), some eau de cologne and some empty bottles in Fana.
Following seventeen days of treatment, the final product will be bottled and sold.
She makes her retail sales for cash from her home, to a mixed customer base. She intends to generate a monthly profit of 12,000 FCFA, which will be used to cover her children's school expenses.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make incense.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth, 67, is married and lives in Mobod, Oroquieta City, Philippines. She earns a living through raising pigs.

She has been a member of the Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for one year and enjoys the privileges of being a member of the cooperative. Now she is applying for a loan of 3,000 Philippine pesos to buy goods needed to sustain her pigs.

Elizabeth deeply wishes to maintain her status as a member in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: to buy goods needed to sustain raising her pigs

loans.name: Doviko

texts.en: Doviko lives in Hoima Uganda. He is 50 years old and married with six children. He deals in produce buying and selling maize and beans. From farming he got start up capital. He started business so as to improve on his family earnings.His dream is building a well established residential home. Doviko faces a difficulty of high transportation costs. He is thus acquiring a loan to finish his house.

loans.use: to finish his house.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 47 year old female. Mary is responsible of taking care of one child .She sells fish and cassava in the market stall. She started the business so as to earn a living. Mary has got a dream of expanding her business into new markets even though competition is a challenge being faced. She intends to use the loan to buy more fish and cassava to sell.

loans.use: to buy more fish and cassava to sell.

loans.name: Valya

texts.en:
Valya has been involved in cattle breeding for 15 years. She lives in Getap village with her husband and son. Her son is a army officer and her husband is farmer. Valya keeps small cattle which helps her and her family to have stable income. She would greatly like to increase the number of cattle so has applied for this loan of USD 2000. 
Valya plans to purchase 2 more cows and enrich the livestock. This is her second loan. She has taken a loan from local financial institutions before, but because of very difficult financial conditions, wasn't able to pay it back on time. Now, by ensuring that her cattle breeding business is successful and she is able to provide monthly payments for this loan, Valya has been approved for this loan. She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products

loans.use: to pay for 2 cows

location.town: Getap village of Vayots Dzor region

loans.name: Kotognotala Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe KOTOGNOTALA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 39 ans, et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans la ville de Fana, quartier Banakabougou, commune de Guégnéka, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de produit cosmétique, de charbon, de fruits et légume, et d’article divers. Les femmes du groupe KOTOGNOTALA sont à leur premier prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente FATOUMATA, la première personne à partir de la droite dans le rang des assis est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de charbon. Elle compte acheter 60 sacs de charbon de bois avec les paysans à Zanfina. La vente se fait, en gros et en espèce chez elle uniquement à ses clients venus de Bamako. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 65 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The KOTOGNOTALA group is composed of married women; they are on average 39 years old with three children each. They all live in traditional families in the Banakabougou district of Fana town in Guégnéka parish, Dioïla - which is in the Koulikoro region (the second largest state in the republic of Mali).
They came to know one another through family, neighbours and via friends. 
They trade in cosmetic products, charcoal, fruit and vegetables and various other items. The women from the KOTOGNOTALA group are on their first mutual loan.
With the goal of meeting the significant demand from their customers, they are seeking assistance from Soro Yiriwaso. The funds will be used to purchase the merchandise mentioned here.
FATOUMATA, seated on the far right of the photo, is illiterate, and currently a charcoal seller. She intends to purchase sixty sacks of charcoal from the local farmers in Zanfina.
She makes her sales for cash and is based solely in her home, to her customers who come from Bamako. She intends to generate a monthly profit of 65,000 FCFA, which will be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine owns and operates a variety store. She is 53 years old and married with six children. One of her children is married, four are still studying and one is working. Josephine aims to let her four children finish their studies and have viable sources of income. 

To realize her dreams, she is seeking a loan of 12,000 Philippine pesos. She will use the loan to buy additional grocery items to sell within her local community. 

She knows that, with this loan, she could generate better profits and satisfy customer demand.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items to sell

loans.name: Susie

texts.en:
Susie, age 52, is happy tending her little store.   She is married with four children.  The store is her means of earning a living to support to her family.  Fortunately, her store is located in a populous neighborhood and so she makes a promising amount of daily sales.  Susie's store is doing well even though there is increased competition from other stores.   Susie believes that with PMPC's support, as one family, they will sustain and beat the competition.  

Susie has reached her 3rd year of being a member to Paglaum MPC.  She has applied for a loan of PHP 14,900 for the store.  Expanding her inventory will mean additional income.  She has confidence that she can maintain the label of member in good standing.  She is a hardworking mother and wishes to sustain the store and so that she can afford a good education for her children.

loans.use: To purchase additional varieties of goods such as canned goods, beverages, noodles and shampoos.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en: Flora is 62 years old and lives in Lobogon, Aloran, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.  In order to help the family, she sells vegetables.  Aside from selling rice cakes, she operates a sari-sari store.  In 2009, she became an active member of Paglaum MPC with good credit standing.  She wants to obtain financial assistance in the amount of PHP 14,900 to purchase more goods for her sari-sari store because selling rice cakes is not sufficient for her daily needs.  She plans to send her children to college so that they can help her in the future and to repair their house.

loans.use: to buy more stocks for her sari-sari store business

loans.name: Ermita

texts.en:
Ermita is from  Buenavista, Oroquieta City, Philippines.  She is 76 years old and is married. 

In 2005, Ermita applied for her membership with PMPC.  Hearing all the benefits, she never hesitated to become one.  She maintains the status of being a member in good standing and repays her obligations in a timely manner.

Recently, Ermita is asking for financial assistance of PHP 38,000 to purchase additional stocks for her sari-sari store.  Through this, she hopes to increase her more income and to be able to expand her business.  She has found assistance for her financial needs through Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and she is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: to purchase stocks for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DANAYA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 39 ans, et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Kolokobougou commune de Konobougou, préfecture de Baroueli, Région de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de condiment, de savon, et de légume. Les femmes du groupe DANAYA sont à leur cinquième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente SEDJE, la première personne à partir de la droite, est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de condiment. Elle compte acheter de l’oignon, du sel, et de la feuille de baobab sèche chez les grossistes à Konobougou. La vente se fait en détail, et en espèce chez elle à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 8 000Fcfa, qui sera investi dans l’élevage de caprins.
texts.en:
The members of the Danaya Group are married women with an average age of 39 and an average of 3 children. They live in traditional families in the village of Kolokobougou in the Konobougou district, located in the Baroueli Prefecture in the Region of Ségou (the fourth administrative district of the Republic of Mali).
They know each other through kinship, neighborhood ties and friendship. They operate restaurants and trade condiments, soap and vegetables. The women in the Danaya Group are on their fifth group solidarity loan. In order to meet the huge demand of their customers, they are seeking support from Soro Yiriwaso.
The loan amounts will be used to buy the goods already mentioned.
Sedje is on the far right of the photo. She is illiterate, and currently trades condiments. She intends to buy onions, salt and dried baobab leaves from wholesalers in Konobougou. She sells her products from her home for cash to a mixed clientele. She expects to make a monthly profit of 8,000 FCFA, that she will invest in breeding goats.

loans.use: to buy condiments

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine, 34 years old, lives in Polangyuta, Siquijor, Siquijor.  She was gifted with 3 children.  Josephine is the breadwinner for the family.  She has experienced hardships, especially in raising her family.  This industrious member finds herself engaging in raising poultry.
 
In need of additional working capital, Josephine decided to join Paglaum Cooperative.  She has received several loans already and recently requested PHP 14,000 for buying sacks of feed and chickens and to pay labor costs for building their chicken cage.  Being a MIGS member (Member in Good Standing) of the cooperative, she has been able to manage her income.  She is able to provide for the daily needs of her family.  Josephine is very thankful because if it were not for Paglaum, she might not have any savings at all nor be guided properly in her finances.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of feed and chickens.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida, 36 years old, is separated and lives in Gabayan, Lazi, Siquijor. She has two children who are in school.

From her desire to help the family, she engaged in a fish vending starting up with a capital of 3,000 PHP. It has operated for two years already. 

Now, she is planning to borrow PHP 10,000 from Paglaum MP Cooperative, of which she became a member in 2013. 

She wants to have a stall in the public market to display her fish. Someday she will be happy seeing her children finish their studies.

loans.use: To purchase additional equipment for fishing, such as a fish net.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is 67 years old, married, and a resident of Taboc Norte, Oroquieta City, Philippines. She earns a living through a sari-sari store. 

She has been a member of PMPC for three years, and enjoys the privileges being a member of the Cooperative. 

Now she is applying a loan to buy basic commodities like rice, oil, sugar and salt for her sari-sari store.

Monica deeply wishes to remain a member in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: to buy basic commodities like rice, oil, sugar and salt for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Milliam

texts.en:
Milliam is 46 years old from Nyandarua and is married. They have three children who are aged between 28 and 22 years old.

Milliam has a second hand clothing business that she has been running for the past one year. She has applied for her first loan from VisionFund Kenya to enable her buy more clothes for sale.

She hopes to get another loan in the future which will enable her improve her family's livelihood and business.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 43 ans, et 5 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Fala Sidibela, commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréale, d’arachide et de condiment. Les femmes du groupe BENKADI sont à leur huitième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente MAGNINE  la deuxième personne à partir de la droite dans le rang des debout est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse d’arachide non décortiqué. Elle compte acheter 6 sacs d’arachide sur place avec les paysans du village. La vente se fait en détail, et en espèce au marché hebdomadaire de Massigui à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 18 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi Group are married women with an average age of 43 and an average of 5 children. They live in traditional families in the village of Fala Sidibela in the Massigui district, located in the Dioïla Prefecture in the Region of Koulikoro (second administrative district of the Republic of Mali).
