They know each other through kinship, neighborhood ties and friendship. They trade cereals, groundnuts and condiments. The women in the Benkadi Group are on their eighth solidarity loan cycle. In order to meet the huge demand of their customers, they are seeking support from Soro Yiriwaso.
The loan amounts will be used to buy the goods already mentioned.
Magnine is the second person from the right in the photo. She is illiterate, and currently trades unshelled groundnuts. She intends to buy 6 bags of groundnuts from local village farmers. She sells her products retail for cash at the weekly market in Massigui to a mixed clientele. She expects to make a monthly profit of 18,000 FCFA, that she will reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts

loans.name: Ghulam  Zuhra

texts.en: Ghulam Zuhra is a 44-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business; currently she requested a loan of PKR 45,000 to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales which will ultimately help in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Skeena

texts.en: Skeena is 40 years old married woman and running business milk selling with her husband for the past 8 years.  She has two buffaloes in milk and sells their milk to many of their neighbors along with butter and cheese that they make from the milk.  She has become famous for providing good-quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently she is in her 7th loan cycle and has applied for a loan of PKR 60,000. This will allow her to purchase one more cow. She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her and will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is a married woman and has four young children.  Analiza is also engaged in a rice farming business with her husband. These are the sources of her income.

Analiza is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for the farm and groceries for her store, such as canned goods, candies, snack foods, soda, soap and toiletries. 

With this, she will be able to improve the variety of her stock, thus attracting more buyers. She will be able to increase the productivity of her farm as well. 

In the future, Analiza hopes to improve her farm so that it will generate the additional revenue necessary for the needs of the family, and for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the farm and groceries for her store, such as canned goods, candies, snack foods, soda, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is 39, married, and gifted with five children attending school. Despite the hardship of living, she and her husband aim to improve their status of living and educate their children. 

She wants to further improve her retail store and increase her profits, but she has limited capital. 

For this reason, she is asking for a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to buy more stock of snack foods, noodles, canned goods, rice, frozen foods, laundry soaps, beverages and seasonings to sell in her store. 

She is hoping that her loan will be a great help for her to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of snack foods, noodles, canned goods, rice, frozen foods, laundry soaps, beverages and seasonings to sell

loans.name: Djantoyerela Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DJANTOYERELA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 50 ans, et 5 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Fala Koulikoro commune de Fala Koulikoro, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le de céréale, condiment, de sel, et de d’ah. Les femmes du groupe DJANTOYERELA sont à leur vingt cinquième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente WASSA, la personne assise est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de sel. Elle compte acheter 16 sacs de sel et des sachets plastiques pour emballage chez les grossistes au marché hebdomadaire de Massigui. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle, à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 45 000Fcfa, qui sera investi dans l’élevage de caprins afin de diversifier ses activités.
texts.en:
The members of the Djantoyerela Group are married women with an average age of 50 and an average of 5 children. They live in traditional families in the village of Fala Koulikoro, located in the Dioïla Prefecture in the Region of Koulikoro (second administrative district of the Republic of Mali).
They know each other through kinship, neighborhood ties and friendship. They trade cereals, condiments, salt and bissap. The women in the Djantoyerela Group are on their 25th group loan cycle. In order to meet the huge demand of their customers, they are seeking support from Soro Yiriwaso.
The loan amounts will be used to buy the goods already mentioned.
Wassa, who is seated in the photo, is illiterate. She is currently a salt trader. She intends to buy 16 bags of salt and plastic bags for packaging from wholesalers in the weekly market in Massigui. She sells her products retail from her home for cash to a mixed clientele. She expects to make a monthly profit of 45,000 FCFA, that she will invest in goat-breeding in order to diversify her business.

loans.use: to buy salt

loans.name: Sherry Mae

texts.en:
Sherry Mae is 25 years old, married, and resident of Lilo-an, Maria, Siquijor, Philippines. They have one child, who is in school.  

Starting with capitalization of 3,000 PHP, she opened a sari-sari (general store) and was able to expand it with the help of Paglaum MP Cooperative. Aside from financial assistance, she was able to generate savings and enjoys the benefit given by the co-op. She became a member in 2013.

Now she is applying for a 5,000 PHP loan to buy additional stock for her sari-sari store, specifically, basic commodities.  

In the future, she wants to own a mini-mart someday, and will be fully satisfied if she sees her child finish her studies.

loans.use: To purchase additional canned goods, beverages, toothpaste and soft drinks.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 37 year old man from Kakamega county. He is married to Margaret who is a business-lady and together they have two children aged ;4 and 5 years old respectively.

He is a farmer where has a small-scale poultry farming, a business he has been doing for the last 4 years and makes a monthly income of Kes 8,700. He has applied for his first loan with VISION FUND KENYA which he will use to purchase more poultry feeds. He plans to use the anticipated profit to expand the business.

His dream is to become large scale dairy farmer and support his family.

loans.use: to purchase poultry feeds

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 50 years old from Nyandarua South and is married. They have five children aged between 21 years and 11 years old.

John has a farming business that he has been running for many years and has applied for his second loan from VisionFund Kenya to enable him buy a cow. 

He hopes to have a good life in the future as a result of his business expansion.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Archelle

texts.en:
Archelle is 28 years old and has one child. Archelle is married and has one child who is in school.

Archelle is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Archelle requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Archelle has been pig fattening for 1 year now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Archelle would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Balqees

texts.en: Balqees, age 31, is a married woman. She is running business selling milk for the past three years. She has two cows for milk. She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough to lead her decent life. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. She also sells animals on seasonal basis to generate an extra amount of income. She has improved her business to meet day to day expenses of life.  It’s 3rd year with Kashf Foundation; she is happily running her business through support of it. Now she requested for a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase one more cow. She hopes to have increase in the production capacity of milk which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Zareena

texts.en: Zareena, age 50, is a married woman.  She deals in business of animals’ sales. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 45,000 to purchase more animals. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Sakhiyan

texts.en: Sakhiyan is 57 years old married lady and is running a small general store in her community for many years.  She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family. To make her store fully stocked she requested a loan for PKR 50,000 which she will use to buy stock of rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 41 years old married to Margaret and together they are blessed with three children aged 21,15 and 8 years old and they are in school.

He has been in the farming business in Ndunyu njeru for nine years and this is his fifth loan term with Vision Fund Kenya. He intends to use the loan amount to buy fertilizer, seeds and pay school fees. With anticipated profit, he intends to boost the farming business.

In the near future, he would like to have more dairy cows for dairy farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer,seeds and pay school fees

loans.name: Miriya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe MIRIYA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 39 ans, et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Bougoufièkoro, commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de céréale, de condiment, d’habillement, de vanne, d’ustensile en caoutchouc, de boisson, et de fruits et légume. Les femmes du groupe MIRIYA sont à leurs vingt deuxième prêts solidaires. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente MAMOU, la première personne à partir de la droite dans le rang des debout est analphabète, elle est actuellement restauratrice. Elle compte acheter du riz, du beurre de karité, des condiments, et de la farine boulangère, chez les grossistes à Massigui. La vente des plats se fait en espèce chez elle dans sa gargote à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 90 000Fcfa, qui sera investi dans le commerce d’habits.
texts.en:
The members of the Miriya Group are married women with an average age of 39 and an average of 3 children. They live in traditional families in the village of Bougoufièkoro in the Massigui district, located in the Dioïla Prefecture in the Region of Koulikoro (second administrative district of the Republic of Mali).
They know each other through kinship, neighborhood ties and friendship. They operate restaurants and trade cereals, condiments, clothing, wicker baskets, rubber utensils, beverages, fruit and vegetables. The women in the Miriya Group are on their 22nd group loan cycle. In order to meet the huge demand of their customers, they are seeking support from Soro Yiriwaso.
The loan amounts will be used to buy the goods already mentioned.
Mamou is standing on the far right of the photo. She is illiterate and currently runs a restaurant. She intends to buy rice, shea butter, condiments and baking flour from wholesalers in Massigui. She sells her dishes for cash from a small restaurant in her home to a mixed clientele. She expects to make a monthly profit of 90,000 FCFA that she will invest in trading clothes.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her restaurant

loans.name: Riaz

texts.en: Riaz, age 52, is a married woman.  She deals in business of animals’ sales. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 60,000 to purchase more animals. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Ansar

texts.en: Ansar is 42 years old married woman and the mother of three children. She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing services of tailoring in her community.  She very well knows the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns enough to lead a decent life. To help her continue operations of her business, she requested for a loan of PKR 50000/- to buy a stock of threads in different colors with the packs of laces, buttons and ribbons to meet with the increasing demand. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads in different colors with the packs of laces, buttons and ribbons.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Nasreen is a 36-year-old, married woman and the mother of five children. She has been running business selling cloth for many years. She purchases variety of cloth from the main city and then sells it to the people of her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality cloth in her community. Nasreen requested a loan of PKR 45,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of different cloth for the summer season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she would be able to earn more income through her greater sales.  She is in her 4th loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to buy a stock of different cloth for the summer season

loans.name: Shama

texts.en: Shama is a 34-year-old married woman. She has five children. For about 8 years she is been in work of hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. To help her to continue her operations, she has requested for a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy reels of threads in different colors with packs of beads, sequins and stones for its embellishment. In this way she would be able to cater more customers consistently. She is hopeful to get increase in her income by targeting more customers.

loans.use: to buy reels of threads in different colors with packs of beads, sequins and stones.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en: Shehnaz, age 51, is a married woman.  She faced a lot of financial problems soon after her marriage as her husband’s income was not sufficient to meet the expenses of their household. So she started business milk selling to contribute in the family income.  She has become famous for providing good-quality milk. She also sells animals to generate an extra amount of income.  She has improved her business to meet day to day expenses of life.  Currently she is in her 6th loan cycle and has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000. This will allow her to purchase one more cow to inflate her sales of milk.  She is hopeful that this loan will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Satya Laksana Group

texts.en:
After the death of the head of the Satya Laksana group, other members took a loan from MUK and selected a new head. Ni Komang was appointed to replace Ni Ketut. 

After six months of raising pigs, Ni Komang sold two of her pigs and made a profit of 300,000 IDR per month. These results have been deducted from loans of 1,600,000 IDR to MUK. Together with her husband, who is a farmer, Ni Komang was able to develop pig raising efforts so as to help the family income.

Ni Komang and the Satya Laksana group decided to continue the loan and each is getting 1,600,000 IDR. They are excited to continue to run the businesses. The settlement was attended by 12 members. One member couldn't come because of sickness.

Ni Komang will use her loan to purchase two superior piglets. To reduce the cost of feed, Ni Komang will combine it with the traditional food. She hopes this time the pigs will grow fast and fat so the sale price will be high.

loans.use: to purchase two superior piglets.

loans.name: Surrya

texts.en: Surrya is a 52-year-old married woman. She is a very talented lady and excels in work of stitching clothes. She has gotten a lot of appreciation from her community. She accepted the fact that if her husband works alone for their family, they will not be able to meet the expenses of their household. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. She has now requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase more reels of threads with the packs of buttons and zippers in various colors. In this way she will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She is in her 3rd loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of threads with the packs of buttons and zippers in various colors.

loans.name: Hameedan

texts.en: Hameedan is 52-year-old married woman. She is doing business selling milk for many years with the support of her husband who is also shown in the photo. She has 2 cows in milk. She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough to lead her decent life. She has five children.  She is very motivated to provide them with good food, health and clothing.  She has improved her business to meet day to day expenses of life. It’s her eight year with Kashf Foundation; she is happily running her business through support of it. Now she requested for a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase one more cow. She expects boost in her sales and earnings alongside.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Maryum

texts.en: Maryum is 24 years old married lady and is running a small general store in her community for many years.  She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family. To make her store fully stocked she requested a loan for PKR 40,000 which she will use to buy rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Then

texts.en:
Then is a married woman of 60. She was educated at a low level due to her family’s economic limits. 

She started a farming business as her primary source of income and has been married to a local farmer. Together they have two children. Her daily duties are to take care of her rice crops and look after the domestic tasks. Her business is going well and earns her a moderate income for the family.

Then will use this loan to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank for the sake of her family members and so as to improve her household sanitation practices. She thanks the water loan program with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Then is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions to safeguard the health of her family and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank for the sake of her family members.

loans.name: Jenny Marcela

texts.es:
Ella es Jenny Marcela, una joven que llego de Cali a la ciudad de Bogotá buscando bienestar para ella y para los suyos, ya que la madre es cabeza de hogar y no puede brindarle la oportunidad de estudiar debido a que son personas de bajos recursos, llego a la ciudad de Bogotá, una ciudad desconocida y en la cual se encontraba sola llegando con muchos planes y sueños por cumplir, el más importante seguir con los estudios profesionales  y poder especializarse como Cosmetología y Esteticista Integral, ya que este siempre fue el sueño poder ejercer esta profesión, ya que siempre le ha despertado mucho el interés por embellecer a las personas, mejorando la salud, calidad de vida y sobre todo el autoestima.  
Gracias a un volante conoció  la Institución Campo Alto, se dirigió a las instalaciones para conocer e informarse acerca de cómo podía comenzar a cumplir el sueño de poder estudiar y pudo, gracias a un trabajo de temporada que consiguió pudo pagar con mucho esfuerzo el primer semestre empezando a estudiar en el mes de agosto y terminar el semestre en diciembre con muchas dudas de saber si podía continuar los estudios para el año 2014 se entero del subsidio que brinda kiva el cual le brinda una ayuda con el cual se reduce la cuota de pago y le brinda la gran oportunidad de terminar los estudios y poder cumplir con la meta propuesta.
texts.en: Jenny Marcela came from Cali to the town of Bogotá in search of a better life for herself and her family. Her mother being sole responsible for the household and having very little in the way of resources, she cannot help Jenny pay for her studies. Jenny came to Bogotá alone and with her head full of projects and dreams, her most cherished one being to keep studying and become a cosmetics specialist and beautician, the profession of her dreams. She has always thought that it is important to make people beautiful in order to give them better health, a better quality of life, and, above all, more self-confidence. She learned about Campo Alto teaching institute by reading a leaflet and went there in person to gather more information about pursuing her dreams. She got seasonal work in the city and was thus able to pay registration fees for the first semester, which went from August to December. Just when she was wondering how she would pay for the next semester, she learned about Kiva loans. Thanks to this loan, she will have to pay less per month and will be able to finish her studies and achieve her goal.

loans.use: to pay for registration fees for one semester.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en: Samina is 28 year old married lady and the mother of six children; one of her child is also shown in the photo. She has been stitching gloves for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet with the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads and wool in different colors with the packs of needles. It will help her to inflate her sales.  She is in her 3rd loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads and wool in different colors with the packs of needles.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies to look after her coffee crops.

loans.name: Pasitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PASITAS” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Sara es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de muebles, venta de dulces, costura de ropa, venta de pan, tienda de barrio, venta de abarrotes, venta de estuco.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Sara es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de muebles; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años al casarse decide emprender un negocio familiar y aprovecho que su esposo realizaba carpintería.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de madera por mayor) que adquirirá en las barracas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella esta casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución y las amigas de su banca.
texts.en: Communal bank 'Pasitas' is starting its third loan cycle within field partner Pro Mujer as part of focus centre Santiago II. It comprises eight members and is chaired by a board, with Sara as its president. The members are engaged in various trades: furniture sales, jam sales, sewing, bread sales, general store, grocery shop, stucco sales. The loan will thus benefit small women entrepreneurs. Sara has been with Pro Mujer for two years, on the introduction of a friend who also works with the field partner. She sells furniture, a business she started several years ago when she married, as her goal was to have a family business, so she took advantage of the fact that her husband was a carpenter. She will use the loan to increase their working capital by buying wood wholesale from the stalls of the town of El Alto. She will then sell the furniture her husband makes. The profits she derives from the business go toward supporting her family, since she is married and has four children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she speaks of the health-related information she receives there and mentions that the members of the communal bank have become her friends.

loans.use: to buy wood wholesale.

loans.name: José Crisanto

texts.es:
José de 32 años de edad, estudio hasta octavo grado, está acompañado y tiene una niña la cual es menor de edad y no estudia su esposa se dedica  a los oficios domésticos.  Él es albañil y también se dedica a la pesca artesanal, aprendió el oficio de albañil mientras trabajaba como ayudante y después su mismo patrón comenzó a darle trabajo al ver su capacidad y desempeño. Menciona  que cada día aprende más a pesar de tener más de 15 años de experiencia.

Necesita el préstamo para comprar lamina y madera para arreglar su casa,  ya que es donde su familia descansa y también quiere comprar trasmallo para la pesca; porque así es como lleva el sustento diario a su familia, sueña con que su hija estudie y llegue a ser profesional y tenga una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: José is 32 years old and studied up to eighth form. He is married and has a small daughter, not yet of school age. His wife takes care of the household. He is a builder and a fisherman. He learned the builder's trade while apprenticed to his employer, who started giving him more and more tasks when he saw how capable and how willing to make an effort he was. José says that every day one learns something new, no matter how much experience one has, which is 15 years in his case. He needs the loan to buy metal sheets and wood to repair his house, which is where his family lives. He would also like to buy a trammel, since fishing is how he feeds his family. He dreams of his daughter going to school and then into higher education so that she would learn a profession and have a better life.

loans.use: to buy the materials needed to repair his house, as well as fishing implements.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en: Yasmeen is 39 years old married woman. She deals in business selling animals with the support of her husband (also shown in the photo).  At present she has 2 buffaloes and 2 goats. She looks after the cattle and her husband sells them to the people of their community. She is happily doing it together to support their family. She has eight children and needs to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures including food, clothing and education. Currently she is in her 3rd loan cycle and requested for a loan 40,000 PKR to buy more animals. She expects boost in her earnings and wishes to spend part of it on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy more animals.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a 35 years old man from Kakamega married to Lonah who is a small scale farmer in the same county, they have 4 children aged 6,4,2,and 1 years old respectively.
He sells uniforms a business she has done for the last 16 years earning an income of kes 20000 monthly, This is his 3rd loan with Vision fund Kenya kes 50000 which he wants to use to buy rolls of fabrics and build a shop where he can be selling the uniforms from. The profits will be used to pay fees and repay the loan.
His dream is to become the supplier of school uniforms in the whole region.

loans.use: To purchase rolls of materials to make uniforms for sale to parents and different schools.

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.es:
María de 40 años de edad, nunca fue a la escuela debido a la pobreza en que vivía con sus padres y sus padres nunca le tomaron importancia al estudio. Es madre soltera,  tiene dos hijos de 13 y 22 años de edad  y están con ella, nadie más vive con ella. 
	

María se dedica a la venta de tortillas desde hace un año, antes trabajaba lavando y planchando ajeno, pero un día una amiga le dijo que pusiera su negocio propio y que le regalaría una champa que tenía a la orilla de la calle, y fue así como ella empezó su negocio. María  se levanta a las 4:00 AM a cocer el maíz, luego a las 8:30 se ve para el molino ya que a las 10 tiene que empezar a hacer las tortillas, su jornada termina hasta las 5:30 PM así es su rutina diaria.

El crédito lo utilizara para comprar una plancha industrial,  leña y  10 sacos de maíz , aprovechando  que esta barato. 

Su sueño es que sus hijos se preparen en una carrera universitaria,  ya que ella nunca tuvo esa oportunidad, mejorar su vivienda, mejorar la champa para ya no mojarse y pagar el crédito.
texts.en:
María is 40 years old and never attended school as she and her parents were poor; her parents also did not think that education was very important. María is a single mother. She has two children, aged 22 and 13 years old. María's children still live at home but nobody else lives in the house.

María has been making a living selling tortillas for a year. Before she worked washing and ironing clothes but, one day, a girlfriend said to her to start up her own business. The friend gifted María a field at the side of the street and María started her own business. María wakes up at 4am in order to cook the corn. Later, at 8.30am, she heads to the mill as at 10 she starts to prepare the tortillas. María's day ends at 5.30pm.

This loan will be used to buy an industrial iron, firewood and ten bags of corn, in order to take advantage of low prices.

María's dream is that her children will go to university as she never had such as opportunity. She also wants to make improvements to her home and to her field - so that she does not get wet -, and to pay off her loan.

loans.use: to buy an industrial grill, firewood and ten bags of corn, to take advantage of low prices.

loans.name: Hayastan

texts.en:
Hayastan studies pedagogy at Armenian State Pedagogical University. 
She lives in Lernagog village with her parents and brother. The University is located in Yerevan so Hayastan lives and studies there. the family is hardworking and works hard to sustain its living. Unfortunately it is very difficult for them to cover Hayastan's educational costs and they ask for your support. The requested loan will help Hayastan to pay for her university tuition and continue her studies there. 
She will hope for your support.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for a more efficient LPG kitchen cooking system.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for an efficient liquefied petroleum gas stove.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna, from Capatan, is a hog grower and a vendor too. She is 48 years old, married and has four children. Three of them are studying. Her spouse is an electrician. The family's income goes for meals and education expenses. 

She wants to improve her earnings and that is why she is asking for PHP 37,000 to invest in her businesses. She will buy feed and vaccines for her hogs and buy frozen meat products (hot dogs and pork sausages) to sell.

With good income, she will be able to continue to send her children to school for them to earn degrees and have good paying jobs some day.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for hogs and to buy frozem meat products to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy the materials he needs to repair the kitchen roof.

loans.name: Ribka

texts.en:
Ribka is a 56-year-old woman who is married to Stevanus, s 59-year-old man. They are blessed with four children: Efrosina, 31; Yulius, 29; Jusak, 27; and Agustinus, 25. All of them are married.
 
Ribka has a business selling water sieves. She has been running the business for 19 years. Because the capital that she had was very small, she could only produce only small quantities. Since Ribka is assisted by her daughter, they can produce 1,320 sieves each month, bringing an income of approximately IDR 400,000 each month. This business enables her to support Stevanus in meeting their family's needs. In addition, she also helps Stevanus to grow vegetables in a small plot of rented land.
 
Now Ribka needs more money to buy the raw materials to produce more sieves. Therefore, she requested an individual loan from TLM amounting to IDR 3,000,000. The loan will be spent on fabrics, wire, threads, and straws. She believes the loan from TLM will help her in improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics, wire, threads, and straws.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 43 year old lady from Kakamega county married to Harrison who is also  business man in the same town. They have 4 children aged 26, 19, 17 and 13 respectively.
She keeps poultry a business she has done for the last 5 years earning an average income of kes 6000 per month. 

She is taking her 2nd loan of kes 30000 with VisionFund Kenya to use in buying chicks (one day old ones)and chicken feeds. 

The profits will be used to repay the loan and do some savings.

Josephine's dream is to prosper in life.

loans.use: To purchase one day old chicks and chicken feeds.

loans.name: Lolina

texts.en:
Lolina is 66 years old and married with three children.

Lolina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like canned goods, bath soap, sugar, dried fish, biscuits, etc. to sell.

Lolina has borrowed and paid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and also earns additional income from raising livestock.

Lolina aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy more items like canned goods, bath soap, sugar, dried fish, biscuits, etc. to sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 30 years old and has two children. 

She is responsible housewife who runs a small retail store within her community to supplement her husband's income. She has operating the business for almost two years and she aims for more improvements in order to generate a higher income. 

Due to financial insufficiency, she is seeking a loan amount of PHP 10,000.00 to buy additional stocks of soft drinks, canned goods, assorted biscuits, beverages, seasonings and noodles to resell in her store. She is kind and industrious, and she hopes that she will further improve the business some day.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of soft drinks, canned goods, assorted  biscuits, beverages, seasonings and noodles.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy foodstuffs like rice, sugar, plantain, and more.

loans.name: Bonface

texts.en:
Bonface is a 33 year old man from Kakamega married to Laura who is also a business woman in the same county, they have 4 children aged 16,13,10,and 7 years old respectively.

Bonface operates in a taxi business which he has done for the last 4 years.He earns a monthly income of kes 30,000. This is his 2nd loan with VisionFund Kenya of kes 27,204 

With the loan, Bonface will be able to buy a sunshine box to lighten-up his home, besides the light he will also use it to charge for customers their mobile phones and spotlights. 

The profits will be used to pay fees and repay the loan.

Bonface's  dream is to own  a fleet of cars for his taxi business growth.

loans.use: To purchase an asset called sunshine box

loans.name: Wycliffe

texts.en:
Wycliffe is a 46 year old man from Kakamega married to Mary who is a small scale farmer in the same county. They have 5 children aged 18,16,11,8 and 5 years old respectively.

He is a shoe manufacturer a business he has done for the last 21 years earning an income of kes 13,500 per month.This is his 4th loan with VisionFund Kenya of kes 40,000 which he wants to use to buy leather shoe soles, glue and shoe threads for making new shoes. The profits will be used to pay fees and repay the loan.

Wycliffe's dream is to open a workshop for training young people on how to make new shoes.

loans.use: To purchase leather and shoe soles for making new shoes.

loans.name: Honorita

texts.en:
Honorita is a married woman and a mother of four grown children. She lives with her family in the town of Trinidad, Bohol. 

Honorita earns a living through her retail store business. She sells various goods to the people in her place. This is the source of her income.
Honorita is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, candies, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries. With this, she will be able to improve the variety of her stock, thus attracting more buyers into her store. 

In the future, Honorita hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, candies, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries.

loans.name: Carmilo

texts.en:
Carmilo is is a fisherman from Bien Unido, Bohol. He is a married man and a father of three children. 

Carmilo has been in the fishing business for several years now. This is the source of his income.
 
Carmilo is asking for a loan to buy a new fish net, lead weights, hooks and other items. With this, he will be able to improve his catch, thus giving him more fish to sell in the market. Carmilo hopes to expand his fishing business and make it a success.

loans.use: to buy a new fish net, lead weights, hooks and other items.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is a vegetable vendor from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She is a married woman.  

Conchita has been in the business for several years now. Conchita is asking for a loan to buy more vegetables to sell such as squash, onions and garlic, carrots, taro, and potatoes. With a loan, Conchita will be able to improve her stock, thus allowing her to serve more buyers in her store.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seedlings

loans.name: Marta

texts.es:
Marta de 64 años de edad,  no tubo la oportunidad de estudiar, esta acompañado  el esposo se dedica a la agricultura. De una relación anterior procreo dos hijos,   los cuales ya están en hogares apartes; en esta relación no ha procreado hijos ella solo vive con su esposo,  por lo tanto solamente él depende de ella ya que el esposo esta de avanzada edad.

Marta  se dedica a los oficios domésticos,  ella con el esposo solamente tienen la crianza de vacas que le dan los ingresos de leche,  ellos los comprar cuando están a buen precio y les hace falta poco para que tengan el ternero para que  la vaca les den la leche, ya que tienen un terreno que por la edad del esposo no le sacan provecho de cultivarlo.

El préstamo que está solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar una vaca,  que un vecino le vende y ha visto que es de buena raza esto mejorara mucho, ya que tendra otra fuente de ingresos con la leche que le de la vaca.

Los sueños que tiene es que siempre Dios le preste vida,  para seguir teniendo estas vaca y darle a su esposo una vejez muy linda y a la vez tener de igual forma su vejes a lado de su esposo.
texts.en:
Marta is 64 years old. She didn't have the opportunity to study. She is in a common law marriage and her partner is in agriculture. She has two children from a previous relationship, who are in separate homes. In her current relationship she does not have children. She lives only with her husband so he depends on her as he is advanced in age.

Marta does domestic work for a living. She, with her husband, raises cows that give them income from their milk. They buy them when they are at a good price and won't cause them to go without. They have the calf so that the cow can give them milk as they have land that cannot be cultivated due to the husband's age.

The loan that she is requesting from CREDICAMPO is to buy a cow that a neighbor is selling. She has seen that it is a good breed. It will help a lot as they will have another source of income with the milk from the cow.

Her dream is that God always give her life, continue having these cows and to allow her and her husband to live their older years together.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Lia

texts.en: Lia is 40 years old married woman, from village Mikeltskaro, Kaspi district. She has son and husband, who works at private orders as daily worker and approximately generates 250 GEL per month. The family is required to cover all expenses for only this income. They live under poverty as having no money for their basic needs. Lia has studied professional career, but she doesn't have her own activity. With the requested money, that was approved with joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, she will open beauty salon. Particularly, she will purchase all machinery and tools and will serve clients herself. Lia will become financially independent, as generate her own salary and get faithful clients. Lia will be really grateful for giving her chance make better style of life for her family and she awaits your support.

loans.use: To open beauty salon

loans.name: Ogsen

texts.en: Ogsen lives in Ejmiatsin village with her parents, grandfather, brother and sister-in-law. Ogsen studies at university as an lawyer. His father works at church as an food responsible person and his brother is a policeman. Together with studies, Ogsen also works at local company as an security guy. The family is hardworking so have monthly stable income for living. Currently Ogsen faces financial difficulties for paying his tuition fee so he applied for this loan. It will help him o pay for university tuition and continue his studies there. Please help Ogsen with this loan and give him an opportunity to continue his education..

loans.use: to pay for university tuition

loans.name: Diana Beatríz

texts.es:
Diana de 20 años de edad,  estudio hasta noveno  grado de educación, está acompañada  desde hace 2 años el esposo se dedica al trabajo de seguridad pública y son padres de una niña de 15 meses de edad.

Diana se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos y a la venta de pupusas cuando le encargan los vecinos; por el  momento las hace en una plancha prestada y ve que vende esto lo ha aprendido sola, ya que viendo la necesidad que no hay quien venda pupusas ahí en el cantón.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar una plancha y las preparaciones para hacer las pupusas y poner una pequeña tienda en la casa , ya que ahí se hace un grupito de personas que piensa sacarle provecho poniendo esa pequeña pupuseria y eso le generara el ingreso para ayudarle a su esposo en los gastos del hogar.


su sueño es poder implementar una pupuseria y una tienda muy surtida en el cantón,  ya que no hay tiendas cercas y la gente tiene que ir a comprar en el otro cantón aledaño o al municipio.
texts.en:
Diana is 20 years old. She was in school through the ninth grade. She has a husband she married two years ago who works in public security, and they are the parents of a 15-month-old girl.

Diana is primarily works at housework and also on selling pupusas (a traditional kind of stuffed pastry), which she began when her neighbors requested it of her. At the moment, she makes them on a loaned grill and is learning how sell them on her own, a necessity both for her learning and sales since there's no one else in the canton who sells pupusas.

The loan that she is seeking from CREDICAMPO will be used to buy a grill of her own and other supplies that she needs to make pupusas and open a small store in her home. There, there's a group of people who intend to buy food from her if she had a pupusa shop, which will help her earn money and support her husband's income.

Her dream is to open a pupusa stand and a well stocked store in the area, since there aren't any nearby stores and people have to go shopping in the neighboring village or in the city.

loans.use: buy a grill and other supplies to begin making pupusas out of a store in her home.

loans.name: Rosita De Chojñacollo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROSITAS DE CHOJÑACOLLO” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Genoveva es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante solo es uno, mismo que están relacionados en el área de la lechería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Genoveva es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de leche; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por recomendación de sus familiares, quienes realizaban el mismo negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de forraje para ganado por mayor) que adquirirá de las comunidades cercanas y posteriormente lo dará a su ganado. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le guata la capacitación y el crédito que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Rositas de Chojñacollo" (Little Roses of Chojñacollo) is starting its first term with Pro Mujer as part of the regional office of Copacabana. It is comprised of nine members and is run by a director's board headed by Genoveva, the president. The members run a just one kind of business, since they are all related through the dairy industry.

This loan will benefit all of the members of Genoveva's group. She herself joined a year ago at the invitation of one of the agency's promotional officers who came to visit her at her home. Currently she runs a business selling milk. She said she learned this business at the recommendation of her family, who also do the same kind of work.

This loan will be used to increase capital in the form of cattle fodder, purchased on the wholesale market, which she will obtain from nearby communities and then feed to her cattle. This work generates income to support her family. She lives in a common-law marriage and has two children.

When asked what she liked about Pro Mujer, she said that she likes the training and the loans that the institution offers.

loans.use: buy cattle fodder at wholesale.

loans.name: Sokhak

texts.en:
Sokhak is 21 years old and single. He lives with his parents and other siblings in a rural village of Batheay district, Kampong Cham province. Sokhak just graduated from high school in 2013 and is now a year-one student in the faculty of management at National University of Management. His major is management, the major that he loves and thinks is suitable for his personality. His education is subsidized by his parents, but soon he aims to seek a part-time job to be able to afford his education fees by his owns.

Due to inadequate capital, Sokhak requested a loan for $2,000, which he will use to cover the overall fees for a bachelor's degree. Sokhak is grateful for the loan, which allows poor students to pursue a higher level of education while contributing to the future development of Cambodia.

loans.use: to cover the overall fees for a bachelor's degree.

loans.name: Benhildah

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 29-year-old Benhildah from Masvingo. She is single with no children. For the past three years, Benhildah has run a retail business where she sells cosmetics. Her main business challenge is low sales in the first quarter of the year.

Benhildah is requesting a 400 USD loan to purchase cosmetics to resell. She says the extra income generated with her loan will allow her an increase in disposable income. In the future Benhildah plans to open a shop in the CBD.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to resell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy television sets, DVD players, home theaters, and clothing

loans.name: Juan Bautista

texts.es:
Juan Bautista es un señor de 57 años, casado, padre de tres hijos solamente uno de ellos a su cargo, habita en el municipio de Achuapa un poblado ubicado a 200 kilómetros de la capital de Nicaragua.
A pesar de estar muy alejado de la ciudad es un lugar muy dinámico que se dedica meramente a la actividad comercial donde esto le ha permitido desarrollarse como municipio.
Don juan es un señor ganadero y agricultor que gran parte de su vida se ha dedicado a esto, ya que creció en el seno de una familia campesina pero con deseos de superación y cuando formó su hogar optó por poner una pulpería donde hoy trabaja en conjunto con su esposa.
En ella ofrece abarrotería en general, ropa y zapatos, la cual es muy conocida por sus habitantes por la amabilidad que tratan a sus clientes y por ofrecer precios muy bajos.
Don Juan en este momento está necesitando un crédito para invertir en ropa de verano ya que se acerca la temporada de semana santa donde la costumbre en este país es salir de vacaciones a las playas, ríos y campestres y los habitantes optan por comprar este tipo de ropa.
Tiene la fe en Dios que los inversionistas de Kiva a través de Ceprodel apoyen su solicitud para poder llevar a cabo su inversión.
texts.en:
Juan Bautista is 57 years old and a father to three children, only one of whom is in his care. Juan lives in the Achuapa municipality, in a town 200 km from the Nicaraguan capital.

Although Juan lives very far from the city, the area is very dynamic and people here work in business; this has allowed the area to develop.

Juan is a cattle-raiser and farmer. He has spent a large part of his life in this, as he grew up in a country family. However, with a desire to do better, when Juan started his family he decided to open a grocery store where today he works alongside his wife.

The grocery store offers general products, clothes and shoes. The shop is known by locals for the friendly service and low prices.

Juan currently needs a loan in order to invest in summer clothes. Holy Week is approaching and the tradition in Nicaragua is for people to head of to the beaches, rivers and rural areas. As a result, people choose to buy summer clothes.

Juan has faith in God that Kiva investors - through Ceprodel - will support his loan application so that he can invest in his business.

loans.use: to buy summer clothes.

loans.name: Petrona Lorena

texts.es:
Petrona de 32 años de edad, estudio hasta 9° grado, está casada y su esposo se dedica a la albañilería, tiene 4 hijos y todos viven con ellos, pero solo estudian los últimos 3 nadie más vive con ellos.
	

La señora se dedica al comercio de ropa y mariscos desde que tiene 12 años,  aprendió el negocio con su mamá, pues fue ella quien la indujo al mundo del negocio, por lo cual se encuentra muy agradecida, ya que por medio de ello puede ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar. Comenta que ella viaja hasta la ciudad para comprar el pescado, para llegar, ella toma un pick up, de donde ella vive para la carretera, luego toma tres buses. El viaje es de un día ida y regreso cuenta que viaja hasta allá porque se consigue más barato el pescado y lo vende de casa en casa  en los caseríos vecinos, su horario no tiene limite a veces trabaja 8 horas y a veces más,  pero lo hace con mucho gusto, ya que su sueño es sacar adelante a su familia.


El crédito será invertido en la compra de mariscos y en la compra de ropa. Su sueño es que sus hijos se preparen en una carrera universitaria, ya que ella no tuvo esa oportunidad, comprar otro terreno para dejar donde vivir a sus hijos ya que en el terreno que tiene no cabe otra casa y poner un negocio de ropa con la ganancia y pagar el crédito.
texts.en:
Petrona is 32 years old and completed up to ninth grade. She is married; her husband is a builder. The couple has four children who still live at home; the youngest three are still in school. Nobody else lives with the family.

Petrona has been making a living selling clothes and seafood for twelve years. She learned this trade with her mother. It was she who introduced Petrona to the business world, for which she is very grateful. Thanks to her mother, Petrona is able to help her husband with household costs. Petrona tells us that she travels to the city to buy the fish. She takes a pick-up truck from the highway and then takes three buses. The return journey takes the whole day. Petrona goes such a distance as the fish is cheaper. Petrona sells door-to-door in the neighbouring villages. She does not have a fixed timetable. Sometimes she works eight hours in the day, sometimes more. She likes her job, though, as her dream is to help her family to prosper.

This loan will be used to buy seafood and clothes. Petrona's dream is that her children can go to university as she herself did not have such an opportunity. Petrona also wants to buy another plot of land so that her children can live there. The land that she currently owns is not big enough to build another house. Petrona would also like to start a clothes business, and to pay off her loan.

loans.use: to buy seafood and clothes.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 61 years old and married with eight children. She lives in Capatan. Due to an accident, Maria’s spouse stays at home. Despite having many children, she is happy to support them in every ways she can. Maria manages a store in front of her house which is across from an elementary school. She patiently sells grocery items, food, and snacks to her customers. 

Maria is requesting an 18,000 PHP loan to buy sardines, noodles, biscuits, bread, and soft drinks to sell. She will keep offering good products and services to all her customers which will help increase her profits for her family.

loans.use: to buy sardines, noodles, biscuits, bread, and soft drinks to sell in her store

loans.name: Nèkè

texts.fr:
Monsieur Néké est né vers 1979 à Kocoula à San, marié, père de 2 enfants il réside avec son épouse à Ouayerma I un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative de la république du Mali.
Monsieur  Néké n’ayant pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école et après avoir mené beaucoup d’activité sans succès, s’est initié à l’activité de blanchisserie il ya sept  ans. Il mène son activité dans son quartier où il dispose son atelier de blanchisserie. Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle par la qualité de son travail et de sa ponctualité. Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, Il décide de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 4 années et avec qui il est à son troisième prêt individuel. Il sollicite ce troisième prêt individuel pour acheter deux Fers électrique, deux tables à repasser et une moto Jakarta pour pouvoir récupérer les habits de ses clients qui  sont un peu loin de son atelier et déposer après service.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 60 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour augmenter son fonds de commerce de ses dépenses, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Néké was born in around 1979 in Kocoula in the San Region. He is married and is father to 2 children. He lives with his wife and family in Ouayerma, a working-class neighbourhood in the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).
Néké never got the chance to go to school and after having tried to run several different businesses without success, he started his laundry business seven years ago. His laundry business is located within his neighbourhood. He is very popular with his customers for the quality of his work and his punctuality. He joined the Microfinance Institution Soro Yiriwaso 4 years ago in order to better satisfy his ever-increasing clientele. He is currently on his third individual loan cycle. He is currently seeking this latest individual loan cycle in order to buy 2 electric irons, two ironing boards and a Jakarta motorcycle that he will use to offer a door-to-door service for his customers who live further away from his laundry.
He expects to make a monthly profit of 60,000 FCFA that he will use to increase his business capital and cover his expenses, as well as contributing to his family expenses and paying the interest on his loan. He will reinvest the remaining amount in his business.

loans.use: to buy 2 electric irons, two ironing boards and a Jakarta motorcycle.

loans.name: Nemesiana

texts.en:
Nemesiana is a married woman and a mother of two children. She is a resident of San Miguel, Bohol. For several years, Nemesiana has been a farmer who grows different types of crops such as bananas. 

Nemesiana is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide. Her loan will allow her to improve the productivity of her farm. Nemesiana also wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy farming supplies to help her grow coffee

loans.name: Venantie

texts.en:
Venantie is 46 years old. She is married with six children. Her husband works as a farmer.  She has spent ten years in maize farming. She will use Kiva loan to support labor costs and fertilizer during maize production:  they need to buy fertilizers in order to increase their production. With profits from her farming she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Hayastan

texts.en:
Hayastan is from Artashen village of Armavir region. She lives with her parents, brother, sister and grandmother. Hayastan studies at Pedagogical University and together with his studies works at local village school. She is very enthusiastic and hardworking young lady who studies hard to get her higher education degree and become a good specialist. 
Hayastan now applies for this loan to be able to pay for her university tuition. The loan will be a huge support for her to cover education costs and continue her studies in university.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition

loans.name: Everiane

texts.en:
Everiane aged 46. She is married to a farmer and they have both seven children. None of her children attend schools.  She has been a maize farmer for the past 9 years. She will use Kiva loan to support labor costs and fertilizer during maize production:  they need to buy fertilizers in order to increase their production. With profits from her farming she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.


The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy ferilisers and support labor costs during maize production

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is a farmer from San Miguel, Bohol. She is a widow and has been a farmer for almost 20 years now. Narcisa works hard on her farm in order to earn an income.

Narcisa is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide for the farm. Her loan will help her to improve the productivity of her farm thus augmenting her harvest and yield.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her farm

loans.name: Roxana Maritza

texts.es: Roxana tiene 23 años de edad es madre soltera y habita en casa propia junto a sus hijas de 7 años y 3 años de edad. Roxana es una mujer emprendedora y responsable quien se se dedica a la venta de joyería (cadenas, anillos, pulseras, aretes, etc.). La venta la realiza de forma ambulante desde hace mucho tiempo y es así lleva el sustento a su hogar. Roxana desea invertir en la construcción de un cuarto dormitorio para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de arena, ladrillo, cemento y lámina galvanizada. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento dado que no puede hacerlo por su cuenta.
texts.en: Roxana is 23 years old. She is a single mother and lives in her own home with her two daughters, aged 7 and 3 years old.  Roxana is an enterprising and responsible woman who is in the business of selling jewelry (chains, rings, bracelets, earrings, etc). She has many years of experience and does her sales on foot. This is how she maintains her home. Roxana wants to invest in building a fourth room for her home. To do this, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI, which she will use to purchase sand, brick, cement, and corrugated steel. She hopes to be able to count on this financing as she cannot do it on her own.

loans.use: buy construction materials to build a fourth room on her home.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en: Edna is 59 years old and a married woman with 10 children. She is a vendor selling grocery items to the people in her village. She operates her store daily from 6 o'clock in the morning up to 7 o'clock in the evening. She wanted to increase the grocery items to sell but she had insufficient funds; that is why she is asking for 10,000 Philippines pesos to buy canned goods, breads, biscuits, sardines and soft drinks to sell. It will help increase sales capacity in her business and gain good profits for her family as well.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, breads, biscuits, sardines and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine aged 50. She is a mother of six children. She has been a maize farmer for the past seven years. She will use Kiva loan to support labor costs and fertilizer during maize production:  they need to buy fertilizers in order to increase their production. With profits from her farming she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilisers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand his business through purchasing fabrics

loans.name: Luzarina

texts.en:
Luzarina is a fish vendor from Bien Unido, Bohol. She is a married woman and has been in the business for more than 20 years now. This is the source of her income. Luzarina is asking for a loan to buy more fresh fish, seashells and fish to process into dried fish. With this loan, she will be able to sell more, thus augmenting her sales and income. 

In the future, Luzarina hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish, seashells and fish to process into dried fish

loans.name: Mely

texts.en:
Due to financial hardship, Mely engages in buying and retailing rice within the local community. She is 40 years old and has three schooling children. She and her husband aim to improve their status of living in order to educate all their children. In this regard, Mely plans to continue and improve her business to generate a higher income. Having inadequate capital, she is asking for an additional 8,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy additional stock of rice to sell. 

She is hoping that her loan request will be granted in order to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of rice to sell

loans.name: Jorge

texts.en:
Jorge is 35 years old, married and had three children. To sustain his family, he sells pork meat to the people in his village using his motorcycle to reach nearby villages too. Jorge hopes to increase his sales and earnings for the education of his children. He is now asking for 30,000 Philippines pesos to buy more meat to resell for profits. He will continue selling a good quality of meat and achieve customers' loyalty in his business. 

In the future, Jorge hopes to improve his income for his family's overall welfare.

loans.use: to buy more meat to resell for profits

loans.name: Solita

texts.en:
Solita is 47 years old and single. She operates a business retailing and wholesaling live chickens, which she has been doing for almost seven years. Solita earns a net income of  70,000 PHP a month. Her net income is spent on her daily expenses. 

Due to insufficient funds to her business, Solita requested a loan for 50,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase live chickens to sell. She hopes that her business will continue to grow and become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase live chickens to sell.

loans.name: Kiprop

texts.en:
Kiprop lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya, and at over 6,300 feet above sea level, is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize producing regions, lending it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya.” Many farmers in the region have started projects planting bluegum trees on their land, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. The people around Kitale have been beekeeping for centuries, and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.

Kiprop is married and has five children. He is a teacher. Both he and his wife practice farming. They have been farming for twenty years now and they are currently growing maize, coffee, bananas, beans and rearing livestock in their farm. Kiprop is excited about beekeeping as it will earn him some extra income.

This is Kiprop's first loan with Honey Care and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to invest in his farm. Kiprop's hope for the future is to have enough income when he retires.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. It is located close to Uganda, and Mount Elgon, an extinct volcano which straddles the two nations and even has a peak at the Kenya-Uganda border. Founded by European settlers in the early 1900s, Kitale originally grew due to its proximity to the Ugandan railway. The area around Kitale is filled with natural forests, and maintenance of tree cover by the area’s residents has helped both preserve the region’s soil and ensured that the area remains good for beekeeping. Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company, whose massive sunflower plantations provide nearby bees with a veritable buffet of high-quality forage.

Solomon is married and has four children. He is a Church elder. Both he and his wife are farmers. They have been farming for twelve years now and they are currently growing maize, coffee, bananas, vegetables and rearing livestock. Solomon is excited about beekeeping as it will provide him with honey for food.

This is Solomon's first loan with Honey Care and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to invest in his farm. Solomon's hope for the future is to live a modern life.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential beekeeping region.

Julius is married and has six children. He is a driver. Both he and his wife are farmers. They have been farming for 30 years now, and they are currently growing maize, bananas and vegetables and rearing livestock on their farm. Julius is excited about beekeeping, as the bees will help in pollinating his crops.

This is Julius' first loan with Honey Care, and he plans to use the proceeds from his bees to invest in his farm. Julius' hope for the future is to live a better life.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Devota

texts.en:
Devota is 54 years old. She has one child. She will use Kiva loan to support labor costs and fertilizer during maize production:  they need to buy fertilizers in order to increase their production. With profits from her farming she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya, and at over 6,300 feet above sea level, is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize producing regions, lending it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya.” Many farmers in the region have started projects planting bluegum trees on their land, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. The people around Kitale have been beekeeping for centuries, and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.

Paul is married and has six children. He runs a transport business. Both he and his wife are farmers. They have been farming for 25 years now, and they are currently growing maize and vegetables and rearing livestock, as well as beekeeping. Paul is excited about beekeeping as it will earn him some income.

This is Paul's first loan with Honey Care, and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to improve the living standards of his family. Paul's hope for the future is to live a modern life.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Ruzanna

texts.en: Ruzanna lives in Kapan town with her husband, son and daughter Monika. She works at one of the local clothing stores and her husband is a driver. Ruzanna's daughter studies at university and currently is in her second year of study. Salaries that Ruzanna and her husband get are enough only for covering basic needs of the family. Therefore, Ruzanna applied for this loan to be able to cover her daughter's university tuition. The loan will be a huge support to this hard working family.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter Monika's university tuition

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 39 years old. She is married with three children. She has been in the rice production for five years. She will use Kiva loan to support labor costs and fertilizer during rice production:  they need to buy fertilizers in order to increase their production. With profits from her farming she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity. 


The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and support labor costs during rice production

loans.name: Flavia

texts.en:
Flavia is 38 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Mukono region of Uganda. She has two children who are both currently in school. For the past 8 years, Flavia has been working hard to manage her drug shop, which sells drugs. 

To help expand her business, Flavia has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more drugs to add to the shop, and will help Flavia to generate greater profits and improve her standards of living. Flavia hopes that in the future she will be able to start up a clinic. 

Flavia is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Flavia who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more drugs to add to the shop,

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a fish vendor from Bien Unido, Bohol. She is married and has four children. For 20 years now, she has been engaged in fish-vending and operating a sari-sari store. This is the source of her income. 

Edna is asking for a loan to buy additional stocks of canned goods, chips, candies, shampoo, coffee and detergent and fresh fish. With this, she will be able to improve her business as well as her income.

In the future, Edna hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of canned goods, chips, candies, shampoo, coffee and detergent and fresh fish.

loans.name: Helyn

texts.en:
Helyn is a 45-year-old married woman and a mother of seven children from Panglao, Bohol. She has been engaged in a food-vending business for more than 10 years now. She sells homemade bread and doughnuts.

Helyn is asking for a loan to buy more ingredients like flour, sugar, milk, baking soda, etc. Through this loan, she will be able to cook and sell more to her customers. In the future, Helyn has hopes of making her business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients like flour, sugar, milk, baking soda, etc.

loans.name: Yandri

texts.en:
Yandri is a 25-year-old man who is married to Arni, a 24-year-old housewife. From their marriage, they have two children; Jersy, three years old; and the last one is Jason, one year old.
