Yandri has a business selling fish. This business has been running for 3 years.He usually buys the fish from the fisherman to resell them in the market. His income from this business averages IDR 2,000,000 each month. At the moment he needs additional capital to buy more fish. Therefore he requested an individual loan from TLM, amounting to IDR 3,000,000. The loan will be spent on more fish to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more yellow mottled fish to resell.

loans.name: Donatha

texts.en:
Donatha aged 44. She has three children. She has spent five years in the rice production. She will use Kiva loan to support labor costs and fertilizer during rice production:  they need to buy fertilizers in order to increase their production. With profits from her farming she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy ferilizers and support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Suriyanti

texts.en:
Suriyanti is a 47-year-old woman who is married to Welem, a 47-year-old man. They have four children, namely Erningsih, 23, worker; Erwin, 21, college; Emil, 19, in the 3rd grade of Senior High School; and the last one, Ersan, 14, in the 2nd grade of Junior High School. 

Suriyanti has been running a kiosk business since 1995. She sells goods which are for daily needs such as soaps, detergents, shampoo, coffee, tea, instant noodles, etc. She can generate income from the business of about IDR 100,000 each day. 

Currently she has to pay her son’s education fees but she does not have enough money to do so. Therefore she requested an individual loan from TLM amounting to IDR 3,000,000 to help her.

loans.use: to pay registration fees for her son's education.

loans.name: Nune

texts.en:
Nune lives with her only son in Kapan town. She is engaged in agriculture and also works at one of the local companies. Nune is very hard working mother who does her best to give her son appropriate living conditions. Nune has already applied to SEF before for improving her farm. She has paid that loan very responsibly and would like to continue her cooperation with SEF and Kiva. 
She has requested this loan to be able to cover her son Ruben's university tuition. Ruben studies architecture at university. The loan will be a huge support for Nune and her son and they hope for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for her son Ruben's university tuition

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is 31 years old.  He is a father of two.  Vincent has been a rice farmer for the past five years. With the loan, he will use Kiva loan to support labor costs and fertilizer during rice production:  they need to buy fertilizers in order to increase their production. With profits from her farming he wishes to invest in her business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.


The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and supports labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Keffa

texts.en:
Keffa lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential beekeeping region.

Keffa is married and has five children. He runs a retail business. Both he and his wife practice farming; they are growing maize, bananas, vegetables and beans and are rearing livestock. Keffa is excited about beekeeping, as it will earn him some income as well as provide him with honey for food.

This is Keffa’s first loan with Honey Care, and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to pay school fees for his children. Keffa’s hope for the future is to buy an additional farm.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses lives in Kakamega. Kakamega county is located in Western Kenya and is famous for its rain forest. Many farmers in the area grow maize, sugarcane and bananas, with maize being the primary crop. The density of the old growth trees in the Kakamega forest, and the variety of crops grown in the area, make this an excellent area for beekeeping.

Moses is married and has eight children. He is a retired deputy director in the agricultural sector and now he undertakes farming with his wife. They have been farming for 10 years now, and they are currently practicing dairy, poultry and fish farming as well as growing maize in their farm. Moses is excited about beekeeping, as it will earn him some income and provide him with honey for medicine.

This is Moses’ first loan with Honey Care, and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to pay school fees for his children. Moses’ hope for the future to start his own business.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia, one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential beekeeping region.

Emily is married and has four children. Both she and her husband are farmers. They have been farming for ten years now and they are currently growing maize, beans, vegetables, pineapples, and sweet potatoes on their farm. Emily is excited about beekeeping as it will provide them with honey for food.

This is Emily’s first loan with Honey Care and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to educate her children. Emily’s hope for the future is to live a better and successful life.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Shadrack

texts.en:
Shadrack lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. It is located close to Uganda and Mount Elgon, an extinct volcano which straddles the two nations and even has a peak at the Kenya-Uganda border. Founded by European settlers in the early 1900s, Kitale originally grew due to its proximity to the Ugandan railway. The area around Kitale is filled with natural forests and maintenance of tree cover by the area’s residents has helped both preserve the region’s soil and ensured that the area remains good for beekeeping. Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company, whose massive sunflower plantations provide nearby bees with a veritable buffet of high-quality forage.

Shadrack is married and has three children. He is a veterinary officer. Both he and his wife practice farming where they grow maize and rear livestock on their farm. Shadrack is excited about beekeeping as the bees will help in pollinating their crops.

This is Shadrack’s first loan with Honey Care, and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to invest in his farm. Shadrack’s hope for the future is to live a modern life.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya, and at over 6,300 feet above sea level, is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize producing regions, lending it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya.” Many farmers in the region have started projects planting bluegum trees on their land, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. The people around Kitale have been beekeeping for centuries, and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.

Albert is married and has four children. He works in the government administration as a chief. Both he and his wife practice farming where they grow maize, beans, bananas, and they also rear livestock. Albert is excited about beekeeping as it will earn him some income.

This is Albert’s first loan with Honey Care, and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to invest in his farm. Albert’s hope for the future is to retire a wealthy man.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Flory

texts.en:
Flory, 46 years of age, is widowed and has three children. She has owned and managed a retail store in her village for almost 18 years. With this business, she's earning a net income of PHP 400 daily.

She spends her income on her electric bill, water, and internet bill. Due to insufficient funds, she would like to borrow a loan amounting to PHP 15,000 to purchase rice grains, canned goods, and noodles to sell. 

She's hoping that her retail store business will continue to grow and become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase rice grains, canned goods, and noodles to sell.

loans.name: Agripina

texts.en:
Agripina is a 45-year-old married woman from Dimiao, Bohol. She has been engaged in a hog raising business for more than six years now. This is the source of her income.

Agripina is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise. With this loan, she will be able to improve her hog raising business, thus augmenting her income. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Bopha's Group

texts.en:
Bopha is 41 years old and grows tobacco as the main source of her income to support the family. This current business earns her 31,900 KHR per day to support her family. Originally from the Kampong Cham province, she is a married mother of two children. She has been with VisionFund for 21 years. 

Now, she is seeking a loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she is a group leader consisting of four members. 

This is the first cycle loan for Bopha and her group members. As the leader, she is applying loan for 1,400,000 KHR each, and she will spend her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer and to pay for labor fees. 

She hopes to upgrade her lifestyle and make it better than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for labor fees.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential beekeeping region.

Catherine is married and has twelve children. Both she and her husband are farmers. They have been farming for twenty years now and they are currently growing maize and vegetables and rearing livestock on their farm. Catherine is excited about beekeeping as it will earn her some income and the bees will help in pollinating her crops.

This is Catherine’s first loan with Honey Care, and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to improve her life. Catherine’s hope for the future is to live a comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
Anastacia lives in Lunga Lunga, a small town in Kwale County. Kwale County is located on the Kenyan coast near Tanzania. Inconsistent rains, especially recently, have made farming difficult, and the poverty rates in the county are above the Kenyan average. Beekeeping is somewhat new to Kwale, but the passionfruit farms and mangrove forests throughout the area provide excellent sources of nectar for bee colonies. Many farmers in the area have expressed excitement at the prospect of owning their own hives and having a second source of income from their honey to help care for their families.

Anastacia is single with seven children. She is a farmer. She has been farming for twelve years now, and she is currently running a poultry farm as well growing passionfruit on her farm. Anastacia is excited about beekeeping as it will earn her some income through the sale of honey.

This is Anastacia’s first loan with Honey Care, and she intends to use the proceeds from her beehives to buy a poultry house. Anastacia’s hope for the future is to increase the number of her beehives to twenty.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 43 years old and lives in the town of Mukono in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has three children with none of them currently in school. For the past 7 years, Betty has been working hard to manage her saloon, which sells hair foods, braids and weaves. 

To help expand her business, Betty has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more hair foods, braids and weaves, and will help Betty to generate greater profits and boost the business. Betty hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her saloon to a modern level. 

Betty is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Betty who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more hair foods, braids and weaves.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 39 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past five years, Ruth has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar, salt, posho flour, potatoes, and sodas 

To help expand her business, Ruth has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more items like sugar, salt, posho flour, potatoes, and sodas and will help Ruth to generate greater profits and improve her standard of living. Ruth hopes that in the future she will be able to start up a mini-supermarket. 

Ruth is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Ruth who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as sugar, salt, posho flour, potatoes, and sodas

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
As a way of generating income, Marites runs a small retail store within their village to help her husband in generating income. She has been in the business for more than one year earning a net profits of PHP 2,000 per month. She aims to improve her business and increase her income in order to sustain their daily necessities and save some for future emergencies. 

Having inadequate capital, she would like to avail a loan of PHP5,000 to buy additional stocks of snack foods, canned goods, noodles, beverages, seasonings, soft drinks and laundry soap to sell. She believes that her loan will enable her to make her business grow.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of snack foods, canned goods, noodles, beverages, seasonings, soft drinks and laundry soap to sell.

location.town: Brgy. Bonfal Proper, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Salom

texts.en: Salom was born in 1964. He is a hardworking and industrious man. Salom is married and has 2 children. His children are 17 and 13 years old. Salom is very careful about being a father to his children. He began his business with transportation 12 years ago to earn a living. Salom runs his business well. He drives a variety of goods from one region to another. Salom needs financial support because his truck has broken. He must to repair it to continue his business. Salom is asking for a loan of 5000 Somoni to repair his truck. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To repair his truck

loans.name: Delia Cleidy

texts.es:
Delia Cleidy tiene 19 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijo en el distrito de Pucará, una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, especialmente al cultivo de frutales, arroz y café, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, en su mayoría sus clientes son mujeres, se dedica a este rubro desde hace tres años, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de cremas corporales, perfumes, cosméticos entre otros para abastecer su negocio y de esta manera generara mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Delia Cleidy is 19 years old. She lives with her husband and child in the Pucará district, a community with a hot climate. Its populace makes a living in agriculture, especially fruit, rice, and coffee cultivation, business, and livestock. It is located in the Jaén province, which is in the Cajamarca region, in the northern mountains of Peru.

She makes a living selling beauty products. The majority of her customers are women.  She has dedicated herself to this business since she was three years old. She has requested a loan of 1,000 Nuevos Soles to purchase body creams, perfumes, and cosmetics, among others, to supply her business, and so she will bring in a higher income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase products like beauty creams and cosmetics, among others, to make her business grow.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence lives in Mkwajuni, a small town in Kwale County. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast near the border of Tanzania. While beekeeping has not historically been a major activity in the region, the mangrove swamps closer to the coast and large passion fruit farms inland provide bees with robust sources of nectar. Though most farmers in the area are new to beekeeping, many are very enthusiastic about keeping bees.

Florence is single with two children. She is a farmer. She has been farming for eight years now and she is currently growing passion fruits in her farm. Florence is excited about beekeeping as it will provide her with honey for medicinal use.

This is Florence’s first loan with Honey Care and she intends to use the proceeds from her beehives to build a family house. Florence’s hope for the future is to acquire farm tools.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Seang Thach's Group

texts.en:
A citizen of Battambang province, Seang Thach is 28 years old and a married mother of one school age daughter. To make a living, she grows rice and cassava, and she also earns extra income via other jobs. 

She has been engaged with this business for 10 years, and it has returned her 25,000 KHR per day. This is now the second cycle loan for Seang Thach with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has completely repaid the other loan with positive impact for her family. 

Now, she leads a group of two in order to request a loan. She is applying for a loan of 500,000 KHR and her co-borrower is requesting 1,200,000 KHR. As a leader, she will use her entire loan portion to pay for plowing fees and fertilizer. She hopes to gain better yields than last year's.

loans.use: to pay for plowing fees and fertilizer

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to care to her coffee crops.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is married, and has nine children. She lives in Kitale, which is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya, and at over 6,300 feet above sea level, is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize producing regions, lending it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya.” Many farmers in the region have started projects planting blue gum trees on their land, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. The people around Kitale have been beekeeping for centuries and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.

Both Leah and her husband practice farming growing maize, vegetables, pineapples, sweet potatoes, and beans and rearing livestock. Leah is excited about beekeeping as it will provide her with honey for food.

Leah requested her first loan from Honey Care, which she will use to purchase beehives and apiary materials for honey production. She plans to use the income from her beehives to educate her children. Leah’s hope for the future is to live a better life.

loans.use: to purchase beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis lives in Kakamega. Kakamega county is located in Western Kenya and is famous for its rain forest. Many farmers in the area grow maize, sugar cane and bananas, with maize being the primary crop. The density of the old growth trees in the Kakamega forest, and the variety of crops grown in the area, make this an excellent area for beekeeping.

Francis is married and has nine children. His is a business man while his wife is a farmer. She has been farming for twenty-eight years now and she is currently growing vegetables and maize in their farm. Francis is excited about beekeeping as it will earn him some income and provide him with honey for medicine.

This is Francis’ first loan with Honey Care and he intends to use the proceeds from his beehives to buy a dairy cow. Francis’ hope for the future is to buy a motor bike to start a business in transport.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald is 28 years old and lives in the town of Kamwenge, in the Fortportal region of Uganda. He is married and has one child who is currently in school. 

For the past four years, Ronald has been working hard to manage his grocery shop, where he sells Irish potatoes and charcoal. 

To help expand his business, Ronald has requested a loan of UGX 2,000,000 (Ugandan shillings) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more Irish potatoes and charcoal and will help Ronald to generate greater profits and educate his child. Ronald hopes that, in the future, he will be able to have a better life. 

Ronald is a member of BRAC Uganda's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs, like Ronald, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more irish potatoes and charcoal.

loans.name: Lida

texts.es:
La socia Lida se dedica al trabajo como contadora,ella tiene un estudio contable,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,por medio de este trabajo la socia quiere salir adelante,el sueño de la socia es mejorar en su trabajo.La socia solicita el credito para implemtar su estudio contable como un escritorio. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Lida works as an accountant. She has an accounting firm. She works from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m. Through this work, Lida wants to come out ahead. Her dream is to improve her work. She is requesting this loan to install a desk in her accounting firm.

Lida is happy for the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to install a desk in her accounting firm.

loans.name: Delmy Raquel

texts.es:
Delmy de 30 años de edad, estudio hasta 5 grado ya que por motivos económicos a ella se le hizo difícil continuar y decidió dedicarse al trabajo doméstico, cuidar animales tales como, gallinas, patos, jolotes, ella vive junto con su abuelo y una niña y ellos son los que dependen de ella. 

Ella tiene 20 años de dedicarse a esta labor, ya que por mucho tiempo le ha permitido ganarse la vida, pero ella actualmente trabaja en la escuela preparando los alimentos para los estudiantes y así como ella se gana su vida con este nuevo trabajo que ella tiene.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para terminar de reconstruir su casa ya que a ella le hace falta instalar las puertas, ventanas y techo a su casa, el cual en la compra de teja ella gastara $300 en madera, $300 y mano de obra $350.es así como ella quiere mejorar su vivienda.

Delmy a futuro desea tener una vivienda digna, que le permita darles una mejor protección, a su familia, ya sea en salud, limpieza, protección y mucho más.
texts.en:
Delmy is 30 years old. She studied until the 5th grade since, due to economic factors, it was difficult for her to continue. She decided dedicate herself to domestic work and take care of animals such as hens, ducks, and turkeys. She lives with her grandfather and a young girl, and it is they who depend on her.

She has devoted 20 years to this work, since she has been allowed to make a living for a long while. However, she currently works in a school preparing the meals for the students and she makes a living with this new job that she has.

The loan that she is requesting from CREDICAMPO is to finish rebuilding her home since she is still missing the installation of doors, windows, and a roof in her home. She will spend $300 on tile, $300 on wood, and $350 on labor. This is how she wants to improve her home.

In the future, Delmy wishes to have a dignified home that allows her to protect her family better through better health, cleaning, protection, and much more.

loans.use: to finish rebuilding her home since she is still missing the installation of doors, windows, and a roof in her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a liquefied petroleum gas (LPG) package to enable him to have clean and efficient cooking energy in the kitchen.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a liquefied petroleum gas package in order to save on cooking energy.

loans.name: Jahongir

texts.en:
Jahongir is 27 years old, married, and has three children. He is a hardworking man. He is in the business of animal husbandry, which he has been doing for four years. Jahongir has a cowshed in his house. He lives in a village and has a good opportunity to develop his business. Jahongir buys cattle, feeds and sells them in a local market. 

Jahongir wants to repair his house, which is in bad condition, but he lacks enough money. He requested a loan for 2,000 Somoni, which he will use to buy building materials as cement, wood, paints, etc.

loans.use: to purchase building materials such as cement, wood, paints, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fruit and vegetables wholesale.

loans.name: Concepcion Maria

texts.es: Concepción tiene 23 años de edad, originaria de la ciudad de Malpaisillo. Es una joven soltera con muchos deseos de superación. Actualmente, estudia en una de las universidades de la ciudad. Concepción no cuenta con los recursos suficientes, pero ella y su familia hacen sacrificios para completar sus estudios como profesional, motivo que la ha llevado a esforzarse y se siente satisfecha de lo que ha logrado hasta ahora. Solicita el crédito para poder pagar sus módulos de finalización de estudios y así lograr obtener su título. Su plan futuro es conseguir un empleo en donde pueda aplicar los conocimientos adquiridos.
texts.en:
Concepcion is 23 years old. She is from the city of Malpaisillo. She is a young single person with much desire to get ahead. At present, she is studying at one of her city's universities.

Concepcion lacks sufficient financial resources but she and her family are making sacrifices to complete her professional studies. This is the motive that has led her to press forward and she feels satisfied with what she has achieved thus far.

She is requesting a loan to pay the fees for finalization of her studies and, thus, to obtain her graduate title.

Her future plan is to acquire a position where she may apply the knowledge she has obtained.

loans.use: to pay finalization costs in order to  graduate and obtain her title.

loans.name: Nseese  Kakwekulakulanya Group

texts.en:
Patrick, a member of the group whose previous loan was funded by the Kiva lenders, is grateful to Kiva for the good job they are doing. His sales increased with the funding from the previous loan, and so did his profits. The profits helped him to pay tuition for some of his children in secondary school. 

He is seeking another loan to buy more retail stock to improve his reducing sales and ultimately, his profits. He is hardworking and thanks the Kiva lenders and UGAFODE for partnering with the group in the journey to prosperity.

loans.use: to buy more items, such as corn flour, cooking oil, rice and soap, for his retail shop.

loans.name: Sophath's Group

texts.en:
Sophath is a rural villager from Battambang province. She is a 44-year-old widowed mother of three children. To cover her family’s cost of living, she grows rice and pineapples as the main sources of income. She has been involved with this business for 25 years, earning about 31,200 KHR per day. 

This is the sixth cycle loan for Sophath with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), while her co-borrower is in her fourth cycle. She has fully repaid her past loan, and it has enabled her to upgrade her standard of living better. 

For this cycle, she is seeking 500,000 KHR, and her joint borrower is requesting 1,000,000 KHR. As the leader, Sophath will spend her entire loan portion to buy insecticide, fertilizer and to pay for labor costs. She highly hopes that she will collect a better yield better than before.

loans.use: to buy insecticide and fertilizer and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
La socia Doris tiene 53 años de edad es casada y tiene 3 hijos, la socia es enfermera, la socia también se dedica al negocio de venta de productos de belleza, la socia vende lápiz labiales, cremas y perfumes, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde puede vender los productos de belleza. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar lápiz labiales, cremas y perfumes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member, Doris, is 53 years old. She is married and has three children. She is a nurse, and she also earns money in the business of selling beauty products. She sells lipsticks, creams, and perfumes. She works from 8:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m. 

Doris has had her business for several years and it is going very well. Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell beauty products. She is requesting this loan to buy lipsticks, creams, and perfumes. 

Doris is happy about the loan and she promises to make her loan payments.

loans.use: to purchase lipsticks, creams, and perfumes.

loans.name: Las Estrellas Group

texts.es:
Iris (de blusa blanca, primera de derecha a izquierda en la fotografía) es una mujer soltera, de 38  años de edad, vive junto a sus cinco hijos, en Santo Domingo, Suchitepéquez. 
Iris expresa muy orgullosa que la actividad que realiza es el cultivo y venta de maíz (base de la alimentación en Guatemala), que es un producto muy demandado en su comunidad y por lo mismo su comercialización es rentable. Esta labor le permite  obtener buenos ingresos y ganancias que le ayudan a colaborar con la economía de su familia.
Ella ha venido realizando esta actividad desde muy joven, y ahora ha adquirido más conocimiento en esta área, así que tomo la decisión de formar un grupo con el objetivo de diversificar sus productos en el mercado y de esta manera obtener un ingreso para mejorar la economía de las familias de los integrantes de su grupo. El préstamo lo utilizaran para la compra de insumos para el mantenimiento y cultivo de maíz.
Su sueño es poder apoyar a sus hijos a tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Iris (in the white blouse, 1st from right to left in the photograph) is a single woman, 38 years old, who lives with her 5 children in Santo Domingo, Suchitepequez.

Iris expresses pride in the fact that her activity is raising and selling corn (the basic food in Guatemala), a product much in demand in her community. Moreover, her sales are profitable. The work permits her to obtain a good income and these earnings enable her to contribute to the family economy.

Iris has continuously carried out this activity from a very young age, and as a result, she has acquired more knowledge in this area. The result is her decision to form a group with the objective of diversifying their products in the marketplace and, in this manner, obtaining better incomes to improve the family economy of group members. The loan will be utilized to purchase inputs for the cultivation and maintenance of their corn crops.

Iris' dream is to be able to help her children to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: buy inputs for cultivating and maintaining corn crops.

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es:
Emilio de 49 años de edad,  estudio hasta 3 grado por motivos de distancia, él no pudo continuar con sus estudios ya que le tocaba viajar desde su cantón hasta el municipio. Él actualmente está acompañado, su esposa se dedica al trábalo de oficios domésticos, tiene 3 hijos que están en la casa con él, 2 de ellos estudian.

Emilio tiene 20 años de dedicarse al trabajo de la albañilería, es así como él se gana la vida actualmente, aprendió este trabajo gracias a su tío que le enseño; además, de dedicarse  a esta labor también trabaja en la agricultura de 6 de la mañana hasta las 2 de la tarde, él viaja 25 minutos a pie para llegar a su lugar de trabajo.

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comenzar a preparar la tierra para sembrar su milpa ya que trabaja con mosos para realizar su trabajo. Con el préstamo comprar 4 sacos de abono, pagara alquiler de 14, 000 metros cuadrados de terreno, semilla de maíz y lo demás para otros gastos imprevistos posteriormente.

El préstamo le ayudara ya que él desea producir maíz para darle la alimentación a su familia durante todo un año, además él desea vender una parte de su cosecha cuando la obtenga para obtener algunos sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Emilio is 49 years old and studied only up to third grade at school. He could not continue with his studies as he lived far away and had to travel. Emilio is married; his wife is a housewife. The couple has three children, all of whom live at home; two of the children are in school.

For 20 years Emilio has been working as a builder and this is how he makes a living. He learned this trade from his uncle. In addition to building work, Emilio also works as a farmer from 6am until 2pm. He travels 25 minutes, by foot, in order to arrive at his work. 

Emilio is applying for this loan in order to start preparing the land to sow his corn field. Emilio works with labourers in order to do his work. Emilio will use this loan to buy four bags of manure; to pay rent on 14,000 square metres of land; to buy corn seeds; to use for other, unexpected costs.

This loan will help Emilio as he wants to grow more corn to feed his family for a whole year. In addition, Emilio wants to sell part of his harvest in order to make an income on it.

loans.use: to buy four bags of manure; to pay rent on 14,000 square metres of land; to buy corn seeds; to use for other, unexpected costs.

loans.name: Sojida

texts.ru: Ее зовут Сочида. Ей 53 года. Она замужем  и имеет двоих сыновей. Ее сыновья вместе с женами живут с ней. Сочида настоящая дехканка. Она занимается растениеводством, сажает овощи пшеницу и другие сельскохозяйственные культуры. К приходу весны Сочида готовилась активно. Она решила взять кредит, чтобы купить минеральные удобрения и семена. С такими средствами она собирается посадить урожай. Когда у нее будут удобрения и семена она сразу приступит к работе. Сочида очень надеется, что ее поддержат, и она получит богатый урожай.
texts.en: Sojida is 53, married, and has two sons. Her sons and their wives live at home with her. She is a genuine farmer and plants vegetables, wheat and other crops. Sojida is busily preparing for the arrival of spring and has decided to take out a loan to buy mineral fertilizers and seeds. When she has the seeds and fertilizers, she will begin planting immediately. Sojida hopes for support and a rich harvest.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and plant her annual crops

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is 35 years old and lives in the town of Kasese in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past five years, Margret has been working hard to manage her boutique, which sells ladies’ and men's clothes. 

To help expand her business, Margret has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes, and will help Margret to generate greater profits and expand on the business. Margret hopes that in the future, she will be able to bring in new clothes to the business. 

Margret is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Margret who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes.

loans.name: Haydee De Jesús

texts.es:
Haydee es una joven muy trabajadora y honesta de 25 años de edad, tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar hasta quinto grado debido a la situación económica que vivía su familia, ella se encuentra casada y su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, tiene dos hijos quienes no estudian porque están muy pequeños. 

La actividad que realiza Haydee es el comercio, tiene una pequeña tienda, este negocio lo inició hace un año, anteriormente ella se dedicaba a la venta de tamales, atol, tostadas de plátano y lo hacía de casa en casa, pero luego que tuvo sus hijos se le hacía imposible salir a vender pues tenia que cuidarlos, fue ahí cuando comenzó el negocio con $50.00, compró azúcar, aceite y jabón y descubrió que se vendía y cada vez fue comprando más y más, ella se levanta muy temprano porque los clientes llegan a comprar  pan y café desde las 5:00 AM. ella se encuentra muy agradecida con Dios por su tienda, la cual está mejorando día con día.

El préstamo que ella está solicitando será invertido así: una parte para la tienda y otra parte para en cementar  su casa, ya que el piso es de tierra y los niños juegan ahí. 

Haydee se ha propuesto muchas metas a futuro, entre ellas están tener una tienda bien surtida y construir su casa de ladrillo ya que hoy es de baraheque, con la ganancia de la tienda espera pagar el crédito y dejar  las puertas abiertas a futuros créditos, y también sueña con que sus hijos estudien y se preparen.
texts.en:
Haydee is a very hardworking and honest young woman. She is 25 years old. She only had the opportunity to study through fifth grade due to her family's economic situation. She is married, and her husband works in agriculture. She has two children who are not in school because they are very little.

Haydee earns her living in commerce; she has a small shop that she started a year ago. Previously, she worked selling tamales, "atol" [a corn-based drink], and plantain chips that she made at home, but after she had her children, it became impossible to go out selling because she had to care for them. That's when she started her business with $50. She bought sugar, oil, and soap and she discovered that they were selling. Each time, she bought more and more. She gets up very early because the customers arrive to buy bread and coffee starting at 5:00 a.m. She is very grateful to God for her shop, which is getting better every day.

The loan that she is requesting will be invested as follows: one part for the shop, and another part to pour a cement floor in her house, as it has a dirt floor and the children play there. 

Haydee has many goals for the future. Among them are to have a well-stocked shop and to build her house with bricks, since it is currently wattle and daub. With the profits from her shop, she hopes to repay the loan and to leave the door open for future loans. She also dreams of her children going to school and being educated.

loans.use: to invest in her store and to cement the floor of her house.

loans.name: Moni

texts.en:
Moni lives north of Bogor, about two hours from Jakarta. She manages a small shop selling snacks and mobile phone airtime credit. Moni is married and lives with two persons in the family home.

Moni joined Ruma one month ago because she was interested in selling mobile phone airtime credit. With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Moni sees improvements in her shop. For the last month, she has earned an average of $18 per day in mobile phone airtime credit sales.  

She hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions on the weekends. Her goal for her business is to expand and have more new business in the future.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends.

loans.name: Kholniso

texts.en:
Kholniso is a hard-working woman. She is married and has two non-adult children. She lives with her family in the north part of Tajikistan. 

Kholniso has been busy with animal husbandry more than six years. Little by little, with the passing of the time, she developed her business. Her husband helps her with managing the business. 

Kholniso sells milk to local people. She also sells kefir and sour cream. 

Kholniso is going to further develop her business. With this aim, she is asking for a loan of TJS 10,000 (somoni) to buy cows in order to increase working capital. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Murodboy

texts.en:
Murodboy was born in 1987. He is married and has a little son who is two years old.

Murodboy has been busy with animal husbandry for more than two years. He feeds cows and sheep. He likes his job and runs the business well. 

Murodboy is the only breadwinner of his family. His wife is ill now. Doctors must perform an operation, but Murodboy does not have the money. He is asking for a loan of 2,000 Somoni for the operation for his wife. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay for an operation for his ill wife.

loans.name: Sren's Group

texts.en:
Sren is 53 years old, widowed, and has seven children. She is a citizen from Prey Veng province, Cambodia. She grows rice as the main source of income, which she has been doing for 33 years. She earns a decent income to support the family. 

Sren leads a group consisting of four members, all of whom are the first-time borrowers from VisionFund Cambodia. As the leader, Sren will use her portion of the loan to build a latrine for her household. She hopes to improve her standard of living hygienically.

loans.use: to build a latrine for her household

location.town: Prey Veng Province, Sithor Kandal district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase biodigester for resale

loans.name: Katimba Kukunda Group

texts.en:
Abubakari, a member of the Katimba Kukunda Group, is a subsistence farmer and animal keeper whose ventures have been struggling until he got to know about UGAFODE services. 

Given that the local community also faced the same challenges, Abubakari mobilized six other people, and they received training from UGAFODE officials. They started saving, and now can borrow and repay. The training empowered them with business skills and better farming methods, which have translated into profits; now they are paying tuition for their children. 

Abubakari will use the loan to pay tuition for his son, who is due for exams at university. With the loan money, he does not have to worry about his son missing exams. He is hardworking.

loans.use: to pay university tuition for his son.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase biodigesters for resale

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is 42, married, and blessed with four children. They live in a rural community and make their living through farming. To have additional income, Janet runs a small retail store while she takes care of her youngest child. She aims to acquire more inventory of grocery items to sell, but she has insufficient capital. Therefore, she wants a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy additional rice, frozen foods, soaps, beverages, seasonings, snack foods, and soft drinks to resell. She believes that someday, she will further improve the business through this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy rice, frozen foods, soaps, beverages, seasonings, snack foods, and soft drinks to resell

loans.name: Yeredeme Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe YEREDEME est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 44 ans, et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Chioro Balabougou, commune de Kerela, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréale, de condiment, de savon, d’igname, et de gâteau. Les femmes du groupe YEREDEME sont à leur premier prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente HAWA  la première personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang debout est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse gâteaux. Elle compte acheter 15 kg de farine boulangère, 5 litres d’huile, du bicarbonate, et des sachets plastiques chez les grossistes à Fana. La vente se fait à son domicile et parfois en ambulante en espèce et à crédit à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 9 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans l’élevage de volaille afin de diversifier ses activités.
texts.en:
Yeredeme Group is made up of married women who average 44 years of age and 4 children. They all live in traditional families in Chioro Balabougou, a village in the municipality of Kerela, Dioïla Prefecture, Koulikoro Region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They got to know each other through links of kinship, community, and friendship. They sell cereals, condiments, soaps, yams, and cakes. In order to meet a huge customer demand, they are seeking help from Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso, from which they are seeking their first solidarity loan (group loan). The loan will be used to buy the products mentioned above.

Hawa is the woman standing on the left in the photograph. She is illiterate and, currently, a cake seller. She intends to buy 15 kg of bakery flour, 5 liters of cooking oil, bicarbonate, and plastic bags from wholesalers in Fana.

She sells at her home, and sometimes as a traveling saleswoman, for cash and on credit, to a mixed-gender clientele. She intends to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 9'000 (ca US$ 19), to be reinvested in chicken farming in order to diversify her business.

loans.use: to buy 15 kg of bakery flour, 5 liters of cooking oil, bicarbonate, and plastic bags

loans.name: Kotognotala Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe KOTOGNOTALA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 39 ans, et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Kolokobougou commune de Konobougou, préfecture de Baroueli, Région de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de produit cosmétique, d’huile, de gâteaux, de beignet, et d’article divers. Les femmes du groupe KOTOGNOTALA sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente FANTA, la première personne à partir de la droite, est analphabète, elle est actuellement restauratrice. Elle compte acheter du riz et des condiments à  Konobougou. La vente des plats se fait chez elle dans sa petite gargote et à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 10. 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans l’activité.
texts.en:
Kotognotala Group is made up of married women who average 39 years of age and 3 children. They all live in traditional families in Kolokobougou, a village in the municipality of Konobougou, Baroueli Prefecture, Ségou Region (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They got to know each other through bonds of kinship, community, and friendship. They run food serving businesses and sell cosmetics, cooking oil, cakes, doughnuts, and various products.

In order to meet a huge customer demand, they are seeking help from Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso, from which they are seeking their fourth solidarity loan (group loan). The loan will be used to buy the products mentioned above.

Fanta is the woman on the right in the photograph. She's illiterate and currently runs a food serving business. She intends to buy rice and condiments in Konobougou. 

She sells the dishes she prepares at her home, in her small restaurant, to a mixed-gender clientele. She intends to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 10'000 (ca US$ 21), to be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy rice and condiments

loans.name: Saida

texts.ru: Саида из провинциального района Гиссар собирается одновременно начать две деятельности - овцеводство и растениеводство. Ей 34 года. Она целеустремленная и трудолюбивая женщина. Данными деятельностями она будет заниматься вместе с мужем. На свои сбережения они уже арендовали участок земли, провели вспашку, закупили корм для скотов. Теперь на сумму от кредита Саида хочет закупить семена картофеля, минеральные удобрения, а также приобрести несколько голов овец и барашек. Благодаря кредиту у нее и у мужа будет работа. Они очень надеются на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Saida from the provincial region Gissar is going to simultaneously start two activities - herding sheep and raising crops. She is 34 years old. She is a focused and hardworking woman. She will engage in these activities together with her husband. With their savings, they have already rented a plot of land, done the plowing, and purchased feed for livestock. Now, with the loan sum Saida wants to buy seed potatoes and mineral fertilizers, and also to acquire several heads of sheep and lambs. Thanks to the loan, both she and her husband will have work. They hope very much for support.

loans.use: to purchase seed potatoes, mineral fertilizers, and also to acquire a sheep and lamb

loans.name: Rokia

texts.fr:
Madame Rokia née en  1955 à Koutiala, est mariée,  mère de 5 enfants, elle réside avec son époux dans une famille traditionnelle à Bougoula ville un quartier populaire de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative de la république du MALI. 
Elle mène les activités de préparation et  vente de l’encens il y’a 20 ans, elle s’approvisionne des matières premières à Sikasso.
A fin de satisfaire le besoin de sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle sollicite auprès de l’Institution de Micro Finance Soro Yiriwaso un sixième prêt individuel. Ce prêt lui permettra de faire l’achat des matières premières pour la fabrication de l'encens pour la revendre au détail  à Sikasso à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.  
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30 000 francs CFA par mois. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rokia was born in 1955 in Koutiala. She is married and the mother of five children. She lives with her husband in a traditional family in Bougoula, a working-class neighborhood of the town of Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali. She has been making and selling incense for 20 years. She stocks up on her raw materials in Sikasso. 

In order to meet the steadily growing demand, she is applying for a sixth individual loan from the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution. This loan will allow her to buy the raw materials need to prepare incense and later retail it in Sikasso, to a customer base including both men and women, for cash and on credit. She plans to earn an average monthly income of 30,000 francs per month. Thi sincome will allow her to pay off her loan and use the rest for her savings.

loans.use: to buy the ingredients for making incense.

loans.name: Mayra Del Carmen

texts.es:
Mayra de 34 años de edad,  estudio hasta séptimo grado, por motivos de escasos recursos económicos  no pudo continuar con sus estudios y decidió dedicarse al trabajo en la agricultura junto con su padre y al cuido de animales domésticos.  Ella actualmente es casada, su esposo trabaja en la agricultura y tienen un hijo el cual depende de ellos.

Mayra utilizara el préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas y para la preparación de la tierra para sembrar maíz, ella comprara, 4 sacos de abono, semilla de maíz y pago de mano de obra.  


Ella a futuro desea tener una buena cosecha, con la siembra de la parcela de maíz para obtener ingresos de la venta de su cosecha, y a la vez tener alimentación para su familia.
texts.en:
Mayra is 34 years old, is married and has one child who is dependent on her. Her husband works in agriculture. She studied up to Grade 7 and then due to a lack of financial resources had to quit school. She worked in the fields with her father and took care of the animals.

Mayra will use this loan to purchase agricultural inputs to prepare the land to plant corn. She will buy 4 bags of fertilizer, corn seed, and pay for labor. In the future she hopes to have a good harvest, generate good income from selling her product and at the same time have food to feed her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, corn seed, and pay for labor.

loans.name: Bruno Martin Lizardo

texts.es: Bruno de 23 años de edad,  soltero y sin hijos, es una agradable estudiante de la facultad diseño gráfico que estudia mucho para alcanzar sus metas en la vida. Con la ayuda de sus padres, Bruno  con mucha dedicación a sus  estudios está logrando un buen récord de notas y así poder ser un buen diseñador gráfico.  Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá  para el pago de sus pensiones universitarias  y  realizar la compra  de útiles de estudio que necesita. Bruno   se encuentra muy agradecido  por la ayuda brindada y se despide con muchos deseos de culminar sus metas propuestas agradece a Kiva y Edaprospo.
texts.en:
Bruno is 23 years old, his is single, and he doesn't have children.  He is a beloved student of his school’s faculty.  He studies graphic design and studies hard in order to reach his life goals.  With the help of his parents and due to his dedication to his studies, he is getting great grades and will become a great graphic designer.

With this loan he will be able to pay university expenses and buy the supplies he needs for his studies.  Bruno is very thankful for the help.  With the help of Kiva and Edaprospo, he will be able to reach his goals.

loans.use: to buy school supplies.

loans.name: Margaritas De San Antonio Group

texts.en:
The six women of the Daisies live in San Antonio Aguas Calientes, a small town not far from the beautiful colonial city of La Antigua, Guatemala.   These women are wives and mothers as well as business owners and they share the dream of being able to improve the financial situation of their families.  They are looking forward to working with Namaste. Namaste will provide them with basic financial training, a business advisor to help them develop and follow a business plan, and a small loan.
Maria Eugenia (third from right), 39, the leader of the group.  She has a husband and four children.  The youngest is not old enough for school; two children attend school and the oldest daughter helps in the business.
Maria Eugenia’s business is selling handmade blouses, scarves and accessories to the many local and international visitors who come to La Antigua. Her oldest daughter is now in charge of her mother’s old sales location in front of one of the well-known churches.  Maria Eugenia looks elsewhere in the town for clients.  She has been reasonably successful in her business and has been able to diversify her inventory to include sales of tortillas, snacks, basic home and personal care items, and traditional clothing.
Her dream is to add the sales of jade necklaces to her inventory during the high tourist season. That way she can take advantage of the larger number of potential clients to increase her earnings.  She also hopes to find a permanent location to use in the future, so she will no longer have to sell on the street as she does now.
She currently has monthly sales of 5500 Guatemalan Quetzales and net profit of 1250 Guatemalan Quetzales. She hopes to increase this substantially during her nine month cycle with Namaste.

loans.use: to add the sales of jade necklaces to her inventory during the high tourist season

location.town: San Antonio Aguas Calientes, Antigua, Sacatepéquez

loans.name: Vicha

texts.en:
Vicha is standing aside his mother in the photo. Vicha is 19 years old and single. He is now a year-one student studying economics at Norton University. His major is economics. He loves his major and thinks that it’s suitable for his personality. Recently, Vicha has also worked as a bar waiter to earn a decent salary to support his education and daily personal expenses.

Due to insufficient funds, Vicha is taking out a loan in the amount of 500 USD, which will enable him to cover his education fees. Vicha is very happy and thankful for the loan funded via Kiva to allow poor students to pursue a higher level of education while contributing to the future development of Cambodia.

loans.use: to cover his education fees at university.

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.ru: Гулнора жительница маленького городка Турсун-заде. Ей 45 лет. Она занимается шитьем национальной одежды на заказ. Сейчас из-за того что у нее финансовые проблемы она не может купить новую швейную машинку. Старая машинка совсем устарела и не пригодна для работы. По этой причине она просит Вас ей помочь. Гулноре не хотелось бы сделать паузу в работе, потому что это значительный источник дохода и любимое занятие. Поддержите Гулнору в купле новой швейной машинке. Она надеется на Вас.
texts.en: Gulnora is a resident of the small town Tursun-zade. She is 45 years old. She is engaged in sewing national clothing on order. Now, due to the fact that she has financial problems, she is not able to purchase a new sewing machine. Her old machine is quite outdated and is no longer usable for her work. For this reason, she is requesting help. Gulnora would not want to have a pause in her work, because this is a significant source of income and a favorite pastime. Support Gulnora in buying a new sewing machine.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Sirenachayoc Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “Sirenachayoc” de la Asociación Arariwa y viven en el distrito de Cusco de la provincia del Cusco, Perú. 

Feliciana nació en la ciudad Chincheros a 30 minutos en carro de la ciudad del Cusco, ella tiene 67 años de edad, ella es casada y fruto de este hermosa relación tiene 7 hijos, ella se dedica a la elaboración  de artesanía de tipo tejido como por ejemplo mantas, chalinas, chullos, chompas y otras mas. Ya son 40 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. Ella tiene un pequeño taller en su domicilio donde tiene maquinas y herramientas para elaborar sus productos y sus hijos trabajan junto con ella. (Feliciana esta levantando la mano en la fotografía). 

Feliciana en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como lana sintética y natural. 

Los demás socios se dedican a la artesania, a la venta de desayunos, a la venta de condimentos, a la venta de helados y gelatinas, venta de comida y otros brindan servicios profesionales y transportes. Los socios agradecen a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.(Las personas que aparecen en la parte inferior de la fotografía llegaron después de la reunión).
texts.en:
These members belong to Asociación Arariwa's "Sirenachayoc" communal bank and live in the Cusco district of the province of Cusco in Peru. 

Feliciana was born in the city of Chincheros, located 30 minutes in car from the city of Cusco. She is 67 years old and is married. From this beautiful marriage, she has seven children. Feliciana makes a living making woven artisan products including blankets, shawls, hats, and jackets. She has had this business for forty years and it has gone very well for her. She has a small workshop at home where she has equipment and tools needed to make her products, and her children also work with her. 

Feliciana is raising her hand in this photograph. At this time, Feliciana needs a loan  to buy working capital including artificial and real wool. The rest of the members sell other artisan goods, breakfast foods, condiments, ice cream and gelatin products, and food. Others offer professional services or transportation. The members are grateful to form part of this dream, through which they are committed to making their payments on time. 

The two people who show up in the lower part of the photograph had arrived after the meeting.

loans.use: to buy working materials including artificial and authentic wool.

loans.name: José Narciso

texts.es:
José es un joven emprendedor de 26 años de edad, su familia vivía en una situación económica muy dificil por lo que solamente estudió hasta tercer grado, actualmente él está acompañado, tiene 2 hijos y su pareja se dedica al cuido del hogar.

Desde muy pequeño, José se dedica  a la agricultura, lo aprendió trabajando con su mamá, además, su papá siempre trabajó en el corral ordeñando vacas, además de trabajar en la agricultura, también trabaja en un tractor  lo cual aprendió de su papá, de modo que este joven se dedica a toda actividad que sea posible, pues su prioridad es sacar adelante a su familia. También se dedica a la cañería, él se levanta a las 4:00 AM  porque a las 5:00 AM  llega el bus a traerlos para llevarlos a donde van a cortar  la caña, así es su rutina diaria.  

El crédito que está solicitando a CrediCampo, lo necesita para invertir en la compra de abono, semilla y veneno y para pagar el alquiler del terreno, y para comprar una yunta de bueyes para trabajar.

Entre sus sueños a futuro están, que sus hijos logren estudiar y que se preparen académicamente, repellar su casa, ya que es de adobe y pagar el crédito y salir adelante.
texts.en:
José is a young 26 year old entrepreneur. He is in a common-law relationship and has two children. His wife takes care of the house. He only studied until Grade 3 as his family was in a difficult financial situation.

José has worked in agriculture since he was quite young. He learned from his mother and also from his father who was always milking the cows. Besides farming he also drives a truck something his father taught him to do. So he works at anything possible as his priority is to get his family ahead. He also works in the sugar-cane fields and gets up at 4 am as the bus that takes them to the fields comes at 5 am. This is his daily routine.

The loan José is requesting from CrediCampo is needed to invest in the purchase of fertilizer, seeds, poison and to pay for the rent on the land and to buy a pair of oxen to work. His dreams for the future are to see his children get an education and prepare academically, plaster his house as it is made from adobe, pay off this loan and get ahead.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, poison, pay the rent on the land and buy a pair of oxen.

loans.name: Etoile Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe Étoile sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, et ont en moyenne 4 enfants, vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à Ouayerma I un quartier populaire de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Mme Lala fait la vente de friperie dans ce groupe de femmes Étoile, Elle est débout à la deuxième position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo.
 Elle compte acheter avec son prêt  2 balles de friperies à Sikasso. Elle est beaucoup sollicitée par sa clientèle grâce la qualité des friperies offerte, sa vente se fait au marché à une clientèle composée et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The six members of the 'Etoile' Group are all married women who are, on average, 37 years old and have four children.  Most of them live in traditional families in Ouayerma I, a popular district of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali).  

This will be their seventh group loan with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso, and they will use it to improve their ability to satisfy the demands of their customers.

Lala (standing second from the right in the photo) sells second-hand clothing.  With her loan, she will buy two bales of clothing in Sikasso.  She is much sought after by her customers due to the high quality of the clothes that she sells.  She makes her sales to women at the market on a cash or credit basis.

Lala expects to earn a monthly average of 40,000 francs CFA, which she will use to repay her loan and interest, and also to increase her savings level.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing for resale.

loans.name: Pacanal I Group

texts.en:
The five members of the group Panacal I live in the town of Panacal I in the state of Suchitepéquez, Guatemala.  They have successfully completed their first two nine-month cycles with Namaste, have done good work on their businesses and repaid their first loans.  Now they are starting a third loan cycle to improve and grow their businesses even more. They already know the value of working with Namaste and are eager to continue.
Maria (second from left) is an outstanding member of this group. She is 33 years old and never had the opportunity to learn to read and write. She is married with five children ranging in age from 7 to 17 years of age.  The four younger children attend school.  The oldest daughter has finished school and helps her mother with the businesses.  Maria has two businesses, one is selling bananas that her husband, a farmer, gets at good prices and transports for her. Her other business is selling traditional Guatemalan clothing.
Though she is illiterate, she has done a good job of learning how to keep track of her income and expenses in a notebook and even has separate notebooks for her two businesses.  Now she has trained her daughter to keep the books as well.
With her loan she hopes to increase her inventory of handmade Guatemalan blouses that are very popular with the local women. Her customers have been requesting these and she does not want to disappoint them.  Her monthly sales currently are 14585 Guatemalan Quetzales with a net profit of 1960 Guatemalan Quetzales.  Her goal for this nine-month cycle is to increase her net profit 4354 Guatemalan Quetzales.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of handmade Guatemalan blouses that are very popular with the local women

loans.name: Apolinario

texts.en:
Apolinario is a fisherman from Dimiao, Bohol. He is a married man and has four children. He has been engaged in the fishing business for more than six years now.

Apolinario is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, and other items. With this loan, he will be able to improve his catch, thus giving him more fish to sell in the market. 

Apolinario hopes of making his fishing business a success. Moreover, he wants to save money for the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, and other items.

loans.name: Mastura

texts.en:
Mastura is 24 years old. She is married and has two children. She lives with her husband and children in a village. 

Her husband has a small income so, six months ago, she started her own business, growing agricultural products. Mastura grows potatoes and carrots. 

She is going to develop her business. With this aim she took part in a course, ‘To Get Ahead,’ at a women's organization. She got a certificate. She is glad that she took part in this course. 

Mastura is asking for a loan of TJS 600 (somoni) to buy mineral fertilizer and seeds for her new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to mineral fertilizer and seeds for her new business.

loans.name: Jiguiseme Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe Jiguiseme sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, et ont en moyenne 6 enfants, vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à Hamdallaye un quartier populaire de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur quinzième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Mme Mariam  fait la restauration dans ce groupe de femmes  Jiguiseme, Elle est débout à la deuxième position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo.
 Elle compte acheter avec son prêt  2 sacs de 50 kg de riz, un sac de 50 kg de pomme de terre, un sac de 50 kg d’oignon plus divers condiments pour la bonne cuisine. Elle est beaucoup sollicitée par sa clientèle grâce la qualité des cuisines faite. Mariam, fait sa restauration  au marché à une clientèle composée et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The four members of the Jiguiseme Group are all married women who are, on average, 40 years old and have six children.  Most of them live in traditional families in Hamdallaye, a popular district of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali).  

This will be their fifteenth group loan with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso, and they will use it to satisfy the needs of their customers.

Mariam (standing second from the right in the photo) runs a restaurant business.  She will use her loan to buy two 50kg sacks of rice, one 50kg sack of potatoes, one 50kg sack of onions and various other ingredients.  She is much sought after for the quality of the food she makes.  Mariam's restaurant is in the market, she sells to women for cash or on credit.

Mariam expects to earn an average of 40,000 francs CFA a month.  She will use her earnings to repay her loan and interest, and also to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy rice and other ingredients for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Bellas Flores Group

texts.en:
The six women of the Beautiful Flowers group live in San Antonio Aguas Calientes, a town not far from the beautiful colonial city of La Antigua, Guatemala. The group includes a baker, a decorative iron-worker, a woman who makes tamales and another who sells fruit.  They are eager to begin their work with Namaste because of what they will learn during this nine-month cycle.  Namaste will provide them with financial training, including how to keep their books.  The women will each have a business advisor to help her write and follow a business plan.  And each will receive a small loan.
Gloria Aracely (fourth from right) is a wife and mother of two school children who has mastered a trade typically dominated by men.  She is a decorative iron-worker.  She makes beautiful had forged objects including wall and table decorations, candelabras and lanterns.  She learned this trade from her husband who is also an iron-worker. She started as her husband’s helper and assistant. Now she has her own part of the family workshop where she creates the beautiful and detailed items she sells. She will use her loan to buy material needed for making more items and to buy additional tools for her work.
Currently Gloria sells her work to shops in La Antigua.  She dreams of the day when she will have her own shop from which she can sell her hand forged items directly to consumers.  Her goal for this nine months is to increase her sales by 33% and raise her net profit to 2433 Guatemalan Quetzales.

loans.use: to buy material needed for making more items and to buy additional tools for her work

location.town: San Antonio Aguas Calientes, Antigua, Sacatepéquez

loans.name: Margarito

texts.es:
Margarito de 49 años de edad, no estudio ya que cuando él se creció en su lugar no había escuela, desde pequeño se dedicó al trabajo de la agricultura. Él es casado su esposa trabaja en los oficios domésticos de sus 5 hijos estudian y también le ayudan al trabajo de la agricultura.

Margarito tiene 30 años de dedicarse a lo que es este trabajo, ya que sus padres le enseñaron cuando él estaba pequeño, además de esto él se dedica al cuido de animales domésticos (vacas), para  ir a desarrollar sus labores agrícolas camina 30 minutos a pie y trabaja de 6.30 a las 12. P.m.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar insumos agrícolas, ya que se acerca la época y él desea estar preparado,  para sembrar su milpa, comprara 2 sacos de fertilizante, que le cuestan $130 y comprara 2 bolsas de semilla a $50 cada una  y en alquiler del terreno paga $90 

Él  con estos insumos desea darle un buen manejo de la parcela,  así poder obtener más rendimientos y obtener una buena cosecha.
texts.en:
Margarito is 49 years old, is married and has five children who study and also help work in the fields. His wife does housework. He did not attend school as there was no school in the place he grew up.

Margarito has worked as a farmer since he was very young, something he learned from his parents. He has 30 years experience in the field. He also raises livestock (cattle) . He walks 30 minutes to get to his fields and works from 6:30 am until noon.

The loan that Margarito is requesting from CrediCampo will be used to buy agricultural inputs as it is almost time to plant. He wants to prepare to plant his corn buying 2 bags of fertilizer which costs $130, two bags of seed at $50 a piece and $90 for the rent on his land. With these inputs he will be able to manage his plot well, get a higher yield and have a plentiful harvest.




El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar insumos agrícolas, ya que se acerca la época y él desea estar preparado, para sembrar su milpa, comprara 2 sacos de fertilizante, que le cuestan $130 y comprara 2 bolsas de semilla a $50 cada una y en alquiler del terreno paga $90



Él con estos insumos desea darle un buen manejo de la parcela, así poder obtener más rendimientos y obtener una buena cosecha.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and pay for the rent on his land.

loans.name: Nary

texts.en:
Nary is a local villager from Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province. She is 54 years old and she is divorced. She is also a mother of six children, two of whom are in school. To feed the family, she has been farming rice and planting vegetables for 16 years. This business returns her about USD 8.11 per day.

Nary has been with VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner) for four cycles. She successfully repaid the loans which have enabled her to keep her children in school and be sufficient for the family. 

Nary is applying for a loan to buy one motorbike to transport her vegetables to sell. She hopes to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to transport her vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Ato Alama Group

texts.fr:
ATO ALAMA est un groupe de l’association CONFIANCE de KANGARE. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans. Mariées avec en  moyenne trois enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de condiment  à l’image de MAMOU  qui est la première  personne debout de la droite vers la gauche de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à KANGARE dans la  préfecture de YANFOLILA (Région de Sikasso, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités d’achat vente de condiments : tomate, oignons et choux. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur deuxième  prêt solidaire. 
MAMOU, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à KANGARE, excelle dans la vente de condiments. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 10 paniers de tomate et 2 sacs d’oignons.  Elle s’approvisionne à SELINGUE et sur place auprès des grossistes  et vend ses condiments à KANGARE, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 30.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité d’achat vente de condiments.
texts.en:
'Ato Alama' is a group member of the business association 'Confiance' in Kangaré.  The women of the group know one another through family and neighbourhood connections.  They are, on average, 35 years old, married and have three children.
